Text

[The home of [Samuel Griffiths]179-samuel griffiths in [Lycurgus]1-lycurgus]431-the home of samuel griffiths in lycurgus , [New York]2-new york , [a city of some twenty - five thousand inhabitants]432-a city of some twenty - five thousand inhabitants midway between [Utica]3-utica and [Albany]4-albany . Near the dinner hour and by degrees [the family]433-the family assembling for [its]433-the family customary meal . On this occasion the preparations were of a more elaborate nature than usual , owing to the fact that for the past four days [Mr. Samuel Griffiths]179-samuel griffiths , [the husband]434-the husband and [father]435-father , had been absent attending a conference of shirt and collar manufacturers in [Chicago]5-chicago , price - cutting by [upstart rivals in [the west]437-the west]436-upstart rivals in the west having necessitated compromise and adjustment by [those who manufactured in the east]438-those who manufactured in the east . [He]179-samuel griffiths was but now returned and had telephoned earlier in the afternoon that [he]179-samuel griffiths had arrived , and was going to [[his]179-samuel griffiths office]439-his office in [the factory]440-the factory where [he]179-samuel griffiths would remain until dinner time .

Being long accustomed to the ways of [a practical and convinced man]441-a practical and convinced man who believed in [himself]179-samuel griffiths and considered [his]179-samuel griffiths judgment and [his]179-samuel griffiths decision sound — almost final — for the most part , anyhow , [Mrs. Griffiths]180-mrs. griffiths thought nothing of this . [He]179-samuel griffiths would appear and greet [her]180-mrs. griffiths in due order .

Knowing that [he]179-samuel griffiths preferred leg of lamb above many other things , after due word with [Mrs. Truesdale]181-mrs. truesdale , [[her]180-mrs. griffiths homely but useful housekeeper]442-her homely but useful housekeeper , [she]180-mrs. griffiths ordered lamb . And the appropriate vegetables and dessert having been decided upon , [she]180-mrs. griffiths gave [herself]180-mrs. griffiths over to thoughts of [[her]180-mrs. griffiths eldest daughter]443-her eldest daughter [Myra]182-myra , who , having graduated from [Smith College]6-smith college several years before , was still unmarried . And the reason for this , as [Mrs. Griffiths]180-mrs. griffiths well understood , though [she]180-mrs. griffiths was never quite willing to admit it openly , was that [Myra]182-myra was not very good looking . [Her]182-myra nose was too long , [her]182-myra eyes too close - set , [her]182-myra chin not sufficiently rounded to give [her]182-myra a girlish and pleasing appearance . For the most part [she]182-myra seemed too thoughtful and studious — as a rule not interested in the ordinary social life of [that city]444-that city . Neither did [she]182-myra possess that savoir faire , let alone that peculiar appeal for [men]445-men , that characterized [some girls]446-some girls even when [they]446-some girls were not pretty . As [[her]182-myra mother]447-her mother saw it , [she]182-myra was really too critical and too intellectual , having a mind that was rather above the world in which [she]182-myra found [herself]182-myra .

Brought up amid comparative luxury , without having to worry about any of the rough details of making a living , [she]182-myra had been confronted , nevertheless , by the difficulties of making [her]182-myra own way in the matter of social favor and love — two objectives which , without beauty or charm , were about as difficult as the attaining to extreme wealth by [a beggar]448-a beggar . And the fact that for twelve years now — ever since [she]182-myra had been fourteen — [she]182-myra had seen the lives of [other youths]449-other youths and maidens in [this small world in which [she]182-myra moved passing gayly enough]450-this small world in which she moved passing gayly enough , while [hers]182-myra was more or less confined to reading , music , the business of keeping as neatly and attractively arrayed as possible , and of going to visit [friends]451-friends in the hope of possibly encountering somewhere , somehow , [the one temperament who would be interested in [her]182-myra]452-the one temperament who would be interested in her , had saddened , if not exactly soured [her]182-myra . And that despite the fact that the material comfort of [[her]182-myra parents]453-her parents and [herself]182-myra was exceptional .

Just now [she]182-myra had gone through [[[her]182-myra mother]447-her mother 's room]455-her mother 's room to [her]182-myra own , looking as though [she]182-myra were not very much interested in anything . [[Her]182-myra mother]447-her mother had been trying to think of something to suggest that would take [her]182-myra out of [herself]182-myra , when [the younger daughter]457-the younger daughter , [Bella]183-bella , fresh from a passing visit to [the home of [the Finchleys]184-the finchleys]458-the home of the finchleys , [wealthy neighbors where [she]183-bella had stopped on [her]183-bella way from [the Snedeker School]460-the snedeker school]459-wealthy neighbors where she had stopped on her way from the snedeker school , burst in upon [her]183-bella .

Contrasted with [[[her]182-myra sister]461-her sister , who was tall and dark and rather sallow , [Bella]183-bella , though shorter , was far more gracefully and vigorously formed . [She]183-bella had thick brown — almost black — hair , a brown and olive complexion tinted with red , and eyes brown and genial , that blazed with an eager , seeking light . In addition to [her]183-bella sound and lithe physique , [she]183-bella possessed vitality and animation]462-her sister , who was tall and dark and rather sallow , bella , though shorter , was far more gracefully and vigorously formed . she had thick brown — almost black — hair , a brown and olive complexion tinted with red , and eyes brown and genial , that blazed with an eager , seeking light . in addition to her sound and lithe physique , she possessed vitality and animation . [Her]183-bella arms and legs were graceful and active . Plainly [she]183-bella was given to liking things as [she]183-bella found them — enjoying life as it was — and hence , unlike [[her]182-myra sister]461-her sister , [she]183-bella was unusually attractive to [men]445-men and [boys]465-boys — to [men]445-men and [women]467-women , old and young — a fact which [[her]182-myra mother]447-her mother and [father]435-father well knew . No danger of any lack of marriage offers for [her]183-bella when the time came . As [[her]182-myra mother]447-her mother saw it , [too many youths]471-too many youths and [men]445-men were already buzzing around , and so posing the question of [a proper husband]473-a proper husband for [her]183-bella . Already [she]183-bella had displayed a tendency to become [thick and fast friends]474-thick and fast friends , not only with [the scions of the older and more conservative families who constituted [the ultra - respectable element of [the city]477-the city]476-the ultra - respectable element of the city]475-the scions of the older and more conservative families who constituted the ultra - respectable element of the city , but also , and this was more to [[her]182-myra mother]447-her mother 's distaste , with [the sons and daughters of some of [those later and hence socially less important families of [the region]481-the region]480-those later and hence socially less important families of the region]479-the sons and daughters of some of those later and hence socially less important families of the region — [the sons and daughters of [manufacturers of bacon , canning jars , vacuum cleaners , wooden and wicker ware]483-manufacturers of bacon , canning jars , vacuum cleaners , wooden and wicker ware , and typewriters , who constituted a solid enough financial element in [the city]477-the city , but who made up what might be considered [the " fast set "[180-mrs. griffiths] in the local life]485-the " fast set " in the local life]482-the sons and daughters of manufacturers of bacon , canning jars , vacuum cleaners , wooden and wicker ware , and typewriters , who constituted a solid enough financial element in the city , but who made up what might be considered the " fast set " in the local life .

In [Mrs. Griffiths]180-mrs. griffiths ' opinion , there was too much dancing , cabareting , automobiling to [one city]486-one city and another , without due social supervision . Yet , as a contrast to [[her]180-mrs. griffiths sister]461-her sister , [Myra]182-myra , what a relief . It was only from the point of view of proper surveillance , or until [she]183-bella was safely and religiously married , that [Mrs. Griffiths]180-mrs. griffiths troubled or even objected to most of [her]180-mrs. griffiths present contacts and yearnings and gayeties . [She]180-mrs. griffiths desired to protect [her]180-mrs. griffiths .

" Now , where have [you]488-her daughter been ? "[180-mrs. griffiths] [she]180-mrs. griffiths demanded , as [[her]180-mrs. griffiths daughter]488-her daughter burst into [the room]489-the room , throwing down [her]488-her daughter books and drawing near to the open fire that burned there .

" Just think , [Mamma]185-mamma , "[183-bella] began [Bella]183-bella most unconcernedly and almost irrelevantly . " [The Finchleys]184-the finchleys are going to give up [[their]4699-they place out at [Greenwood Lake]7-greenwood lake]4700-their place out at greenwood lake this coming summer and go up to [Twelfth Lake]8-twelfth lake near [Pine Point]9-pine point . [They]4699-they 're going to build [a new bungalow up there]4701-a new bungalow up there . And [Sondra]186-sondra says that this time [it]4701-a new bungalow up there 's going to be right down at [the water]4702-the water 's edge — not away from it , as it is out here . And [they]4699-they 're going to have a great big verandah with a hardwood floor . And [a boathouse]4703-a boathouse big enough for a thirty - foot electric launch that [Mr. Finchley]187-mr. finchley is going to buy for [Stuart]188-stuart . Wo n't that be wonderful ? And [she]488-her daughter says that if [you]4704-you will let [me]183-bella , that [I]183-bella can come up [there]4705-there for all summer long , or for as long as [I]183-bella like . And [Gil]189-gil , too , if [he]189-gil will . It 's just across [the lake]4706-the lake from [the Emery Lodge]4707-the emery lodge , [you]4704-you know , and [the East Gate Hotel]4708-the east gate hotel . And [[the Phants]190-the phants ' place]4709-the phants ' place , [you]4704-you know , [the Phants of [Utica]3-utica]4710-the phants of utica , is just below [theirs]190-the phants near [Sharon]10-sharon . Is n't that just wonderful ? Wo n't that be great ? [I]183-bella wish [you]4704-you and [Dad]191-dad would make up [your]4704-you minds to build up there now sometime , [Mamma]185-mamma . It looks to [me]183-bella now as though [nearly everybody that 's worth anything down here]4711-nearly everybody that 's worth anything down here is moving up there . "[183-bella]

[She]490-i talked so fast and swung about so , looking now at the open fire burning in the grate , then out of the two high windows that commanded the front lawn and a full view of [Wykeagy Avenue]11-wykeagy avenue , lit by the electric lights in the winter dusk , that [[her]490-i mother]447-her mother had no opportunity to insert any comment until this was over . However , [she]490-i managed to observe : " Yes ? Well , what about [the Anthonys]192-the anthonys and [the Nicholsons]193-the nicholsons and [the Taylors]194-the taylors ? [I]490-i have n't heard of [their]4712-they leaving [Greenwood]12-greenwood yet . "[490-i]

" Oh , [I]490-i know , not [the Anthonys]192-the anthonys or [the Nicholsons]193-the nicholsons or [the Taylors]194-the taylors . Who expects [them]4712-they to move ? [They]4712-they 're too old fashioned . [They]4712-they 're not the kind that would move anywhere , are [they]4712-they ? [No one]4713-no one thinks [they]4712-they are . Just [the same [Greenwood]12-greenwood]4714-the same greenwood is n't like [Twelfth Lake]8-twelfth lake . [You]4715-you know that [yourself]4715-you . And [all the people that are anybody down on [the South Shore]14-the south shore]4716-all the people that are anybody down on the south shore are going up there for sure . [The Cranstons]195-the cranstons next year , [Sondra]186-sondra says . And after that , [I]490-i bet [the Harriets]196-the harriets will go , too . "[490-i]

" [The Cranstons]195-the cranstons and [the Harriets]196-the harriets and [the Finchleys]184-the finchleys and [Sondra]186-sondra , "[447-her mother] commented [[her]492-her mother]447-her mother , half amused and half irritated . " [The Cranstons]195-the cranstons and [you]186-sondra and [Bertine]197-bertine and [Sondra]186-sondra — that 's all [I]447-her mother hear these days . "[447-her mother] For [the Cranstons]195-the cranstons , and [the Finchleys]184-the finchleys , despite a certain amount of local success in connection with this newer and faster set , were , much more than any of the others , the subject of considerable unfavorable comment . [They]494-they were [the people who , having moved [the Cranston Wickwire Company]15-the cranston wickwire company from [Albany]4-albany]495-the people who , having moved the cranston wickwire company from albany , and [the Finchley Electric Sweeper from [Buffalo]16-buffalo]496-the finchley electric sweeper from buffalo , and built [large factories on [the south bank of [the Mohawk River]17-the mohawk river]498-the south bank of the mohawk river]497-large factories on the south bank of the mohawk river , to say nothing of [new and grandiose houses in [Wykeagy Avenue]11-wykeagy avenue]499-new and grandiose houses in wykeagy avenue and [summer cottages at [Greenwood]12-greenwood]500-summer cottages at greenwood , some twenty miles northwest , were setting a rather showy , and hence disagreeable , pace to [all of [the wealthy residents of [this region]503-this region]502-the wealthy residents of this region]501-all of the wealthy residents of this region . [They]494-they were given to wearing the smartest clothes , to the latest novelties in [cars]504-cars and entertainments , and constituted a problem to those who with less means considered [their]494-they position and [their]494-they equipment about as fixed and interesting and attractive as such things might well be . [The Cranstons]195-the cranstons and [the Finchleys]184-the finchleys were in the main a thorn in the flesh of [the remainder of [the elite of [Lycurgus]1-lycurgus]506-the elite of lycurgus]505-the remainder of the elite of lycurgus — too showy and too aggressive .

" How often have [I]180-mrs. griffiths told [you]4717-you that [I]180-mrs. griffiths do n't want [you]4717-you to have so much to do with [Bertine]197-bertine or that [Letta Harriet]198-letta harriet or [[her]4718-her brother]4719-her brother either ? [They]494-they 're too forward . [They]494-they run around and talk and show off too much . And [[your]4717-you father]4720-your father feels the same as [I]180-mrs. griffiths do in regard to [them]494-they . As for [Sondra Finchley]186-sondra , if [she]4721-she expects to go with [Bertine]197-bertine and [you]4717-you , too , then [you]4717-you 're not going to go with [her]4721-she either much longer . Besides [I]180-mrs. griffiths 'm not sure that [[your]4717-you father]4720-your father approves of [your]4717-you going anywhere without [some one]4723-some one to accompany [you]4717-you . [You]4717-you 're not old enough yet . And as for [your]4717-you going to [Twelfth Lake]8-twelfth lake to [the Finchleys]184-the finchleys , well , unless [we]4724-we all go together , there 'll be no going [there]4705-there , either . "[180-mrs. griffiths] And now [Mrs. Griffiths]180-mrs. griffiths , who leaned more to the manner and tactics of [the older , if not less affluent families]507-the older , if not less affluent families , stared complainingly at [[her]180-mrs. griffiths daughter]488-her daughter .

[The head of [the Lycurgus branch of [the Griffiths]555-the griffiths]554-the lycurgus branch of the griffiths , as contrasted with [the father of [the Kansas City family]557-the kansas city family]556-the father of the kansas city family]553-the head of the lycurgus branch of the griffiths , as contrasted with the father of the kansas city family , was most arresting . Long used to contending for [himself]510-her father , and having come by effort as well as results to know that [he]510-her father was above the average in acumen and commercial ability , [he]510-her father was inclined at times to be a bit intolerant of [those who were not]560-those who were not . [He]510-her father was not ungenerous or unpleasant in manner , but always striving to maintain a calm and judicial air . And [he]510-her father told [himself]510-her father by way of excuse for [his]510-her father mannerisms that [he]510-her father was merely accepting [himself]510-her father at the value that [others]561-others placed upon [him]510-her father and all those who , like [himself]510-her father , were successful .

[[His]510-her father family]521-his family at this time — twenty - five years later — unquestionably occupied one of the best , as well as [the most tastefully constructed residences in [Lycurgus]1-lycurgus]563-the most tastefully constructed residences in lycurgus . [[His]510-her father two younger children]566-his two younger children , if not [the eldest]567-the eldest , were much to the front socially in [the younger and gayer set]568-the younger and gayer set and so far nothing had happened to weaken or darken [his]510-her father prestige .

[The Clyde whom [Samuel Griffiths]179-samuel griffiths described as having met at [the Union League Club in [Chicago]5-chicago]21-the union league club in chicago]633-the clyde whom samuel griffiths described as having met at the union league club in chicago , was a somewhat modified version of the one who had fled from [Kansas City]23-kansas city three years before . [He]633-the clyde whom samuel griffiths described as having met at the union league club in chicago was now twenty , a little taller and more firmly but scarcely any more robustly built , and considerably more experienced , of course . For since leaving [[his]633-the clyde whom samuel griffiths described as having met at the union league club in chicago home]634-his home and work in [Kansas City]23-kansas city and coming in contact with some rough usage in [the world]4755-the world — humble tasks , [wretched rooms]636-wretched rooms , no intimates to speak of , plus the compulsion to make [his]633-the clyde whom samuel griffiths described as having met at the union league club in chicago own way as best [he]633-the clyde whom samuel griffiths described as having met at the union league club in chicago might — [he]633-the clyde whom samuel griffiths described as having met at the union league club in chicago had developed a kind of self - reliance and smoothness of address such as [one]578-one would scarcely have credited [him]633-the clyde whom samuel griffiths described as having met at the union league club in chicago with three years before . There was about [him]633-the clyde whom samuel griffiths described as having met at the union league club in chicago now , although [he]633-the clyde whom samuel griffiths described as having met at the union league club in chicago was not nearly so smartly dressed as when [he]633-the clyde whom samuel griffiths described as having met at the union league club in chicago left [Kansas City]23-kansas city , a kind of conscious gentility of manner which pleased , even though it did not at first arrest attention . Also , and this was considerably different from [the Clyde]201-clyde who had crept away from [Kansas City]23-kansas city in [a box car]638-a box car , [he]633-the clyde whom samuel griffiths described as having met at the union league club in chicago had much more of an air of caution and reserve .

For ever since [he]633-the clyde whom samuel griffiths described as having met at the union league club in chicago had fled from [Kansas City]23-kansas city , and by [one humble device]639-one humble device and another forced to make [his]633-the clyde whom samuel griffiths described as having met at the union league club in chicago way , [he]633-the clyde whom samuel griffiths described as having met at the union league club in chicago had been coming to the conclusion that on [himself]633-the clyde whom samuel griffiths described as having met at the union league club in chicago alone depended [his]633-the clyde whom samuel griffiths described as having met at the union league club in chicago future . [[His]633-the clyde whom samuel griffiths described as having met at the union league club in chicago family]521-his family , as [he]633-the clyde whom samuel griffiths described as having met at the union league club in chicago now definitely sensed , could do nothing for [him]633-the clyde whom samuel griffiths described as having met at the union league club in chicago . [They]521-his family were too impractical and too poor — [[his]633-the clyde whom samuel griffiths described as having met at the union league club in chicago mother]587-his mother , [father]435-father , [Esta]219-esta , [all of [them]521-his family]643-all of them .

At the same time , in spite of all [their]521-his family difficulties , [he]633-the clyde whom samuel griffiths described as having met at the union league club in chicago could not now help but feel drawn to [them]521-his family , [[his]633-the clyde whom samuel griffiths described as having met at the union league club in chicago mother]587-his mother in particular , and the old home life that had surrounded [him]633-the clyde whom samuel griffiths described as having met at the union league club in chicago as [a boy]645-a boy — [[his]633-the clyde whom samuel griffiths described as having met at the union league club in chicago brother]646-his brother and sisters , [Esta]219-esta included , since [she]587-his mother , too , as [he]633-the clyde whom samuel griffiths described as having met at the union league club in chicago now saw it , had been brought no lower than [he]633-the clyde whom samuel griffiths described as having met at the union league club in chicago by circumstances over which [she]587-his mother probably had no more control . And often , [his]633-the clyde whom samuel griffiths described as having met at the union league club in chicago thoughts and mood had gone back with a definite and disconcerting pang because of the way in which [he]633-the clyde whom samuel griffiths described as having met at the union league club in chicago had treated [[his]633-the clyde whom samuel griffiths described as having met at the union league club in chicago mother]587-his mother as well as the way in which [his]633-the clyde whom samuel griffiths described as having met at the union league club in chicago career in [Kansas City]23-kansas city had been suddenly interrupted — [his]633-the clyde whom samuel griffiths described as having met at the union league club in chicago loss of [Hortense Briggs]220-hortense briggs — a severe blow ; the troubles that had come to [him]633-the clyde whom samuel griffiths described as having met at the union league club in chicago since ; the trouble that must have come to [[his]633-the clyde whom samuel griffiths described as having met at the union league club in chicago mother]587-his mother and [Esta]219-esta because of [him]633-the clyde whom samuel griffiths described as having met at the union league club in chicago .

On reaching [St. Louis]24-st. louis two days later after [his]633-the clyde whom samuel griffiths described as having met at the union league club in chicago flight , and after having been most painfully bundled out into the snow a hundred miles from [Kansas City]23-kansas city in the gray of a winter morning , and at the same time relieved of [his]633-the clyde whom samuel griffiths described as having met at the union league club in chicago watch and overcoat by [two brakemen who had found [him]633-the clyde whom samuel griffiths described as having met at the union league club in chicago hiding in [the car]650-the car]649-two brakemen who had found him hiding in the car , [he]633-the clyde whom samuel griffiths described as having met at the union league club in chicago had picked up a [Kansas City]23-kansas city paper — The Star — only to realize that [his]633-the clyde whom samuel griffiths described as having met at the union league club in chicago worst fear in regard to all that had occurred had come true . For there , under a two - column head , and with fully a column and a half of reading matter below , was the full story of all that had happened : [a little girl]651-a little girl , [the eleven - year - old daughter of [a well - to - do Kansas City family]653-a well - to - do kansas city family]652-the eleven - year - old daughter of a well - to - do kansas city family , knocked down and almost instantly killed — [she]651-a little girl had died an hour later ; [Sparser]221-sparser and [Miss Sipe]222-miss sipe in [a hospital]654-a hospital and under arrest at the same time , guarded by [a policeman sitting in [the hospital]656-the hospital awaiting [their]657-their recovery]655-a policeman sitting in the hospital awaiting their recovery ; [a splendid car]658-a splendid car very seriously damaged ; [[Sparser]221-sparser 's father]659-sparser 's father , in the absence of [the owner of [the car for whom [he]659-sparser 's father worked]661-the car for whom he worked , at once incensed and made terribly unhappy by the folly and seeming criminality and recklessness of [[his]659-sparser 's father son]4794-his son]660-the owner of the car for whom he worked , at once incensed and made terribly unhappy by the folly and seeming criminality and recklessness of his son .

But what was worse , [the unfortunate Sparser]221-sparser had already been charged with larceny and homicide , and wishing , no doubt , to minimize [his]633-the clyde whom samuel griffiths described as having met at the union league club in chicago own share in this grave catastrophe , had not only revealed the names of all who were with [him]633-the clyde whom samuel griffiths described as having met at the union league club in chicago in [the car]650-the car — [the youths in particular]664-the youths in particular and [[their]657-their hotel address]665-their hotel address — but had charged that [they]657-their along with [him]633-the clyde whom samuel griffiths described as having met at the union league club in chicago were equally guilty , since [they]657-their had urged [him]633-the clyde whom samuel griffiths described as having met at the union league club in chicago to make speed at the time and against [his]633-the clyde whom samuel griffiths described as having met at the union league club in chicago will — a claim which was true enough , as [Clyde]201-clyde knew . And [Mr. Squires]223-mr. squires , on being interviewed at [the hotel]666-the hotel , had furnished [the police]667-the police and the newspapers with the names of [[their]657-their parents]668-their parents and [their]657-their home addresses .

This last was the sharpest blow of all . For there followed disturbing pictures of how [[their]657-their respective parents]669-their respective parents or [relatives]670-relatives had taken it on being informed of [their]657-their sins . [Mrs. Ratterer]224-ratterer , [[Tom]225-tom 's mother]671-tom 's mother , had cried and declared [[her]224-ratterer boy]672-her boy was [a good boy]673-a good boy , and had not meant to do any harm , [she]224-ratterer was sure . And [Mrs. Hegglund]226-hegglund — [[Oscar]227-oscar 's devoted but aged mother]674-oscar 's devoted but aged mother — had said that there was not a more honest or generous soul and that [he]672-her boy must have been drinking . And at [[his]672-her boy own home]675-his own home — [The Star]676-the star had described [[his]672-her boy mother]587-his mother as standing , pale , very startled and very distressed , clasping and unclasping [her]587-his mother hands and looking as though [she]587-his mother were scarcely able to grasp what was meant , unwilling to believe that [[her]587-his mother son]678-her son had been one of [the party]679-the party and assuring all that [he]672-her boy would most certainly return soon and explain all , and that there must be some mistake .

However , [he]672-her boy had not returned . Nor had [he]672-her boy heard anything more after that . For , owing to [his]672-her boy fear of [the police]667-the police , as well as of [[his]672-her boy mother]587-his mother — [her]587-his mother sorrowful , hopeless eyes , [he]672-her boy had not written for months , and then a letter to [[his]672-her boy mother]587-his mother only to say that [he]672-her boy was well and that [she]587-his mother must not worry . [He]672-her boy gave neither name nor address . Later , after that [he]672-her boy had wandered on , essaying one small job and another , in [St. Louis]24-st. louis , [Peoria]25-peoria , [Chicago]5-chicago , [Milwaukee]26-milwaukee — dishwashing in [a restaurant]683-a restaurant , soda - clerking in [a small outlying drug - store]684-a small outlying drug - store , attempting to learn to be [a shoe clerk]685-a shoe clerk , [a grocer 's clerk]686-a grocer 's clerk , and what not ; and being discharged and laid off and quitting because [he]672-her boy did not like it . [He]672-her boy had sent [her]587-his mother ten dollars once — another time five , having , as [he]672-her boy felt , that much to spare . After nearly a year and a half [he]672-her boy had decided that the search must have lessened , [his]672-her boy own part in the crime being forgotten , possibly , or by then not deemed sufficiently important to pursue — and when [he]672-her boy was once more making a moderate living as [the driver of [a delivery wagon]688-a delivery wagon in [Chicago]5-chicago]687-the driver of a delivery wagon in chicago , a job that paid [him]672-her boy fifteen dollars a week , [he]672-her boy resolved that [he]672-her boy would write [[his]672-her boy mother]587-his mother , because now [he]672-her boy could say that [he]672-her boy had a decent place and had conducted [himself]672-her boy respectably for a long time , although not under [his]672-her boy own name .

And accordingly [Clyde]201-clyde , after telephoning [[his]201-clyde department manager]719-his department manager that [he]201-clyde was ill and would not be able to work that day , made [his]201-clyde way to [this hotel]720-this hotel in [his]201-clyde very best clothes . But the tips , as [he]201-clyde now learned , aggregated not more than ten a week — yet that , counting meals was far more than [he]201-clyde was now getting as [he]201-clyde comforted [himself]201-clyde ; and so much easier work , even if it did take [him]201-clyde back into the old line , where [he]201-clyde still feared to be seen and arrested .

It was not so very long after this — not more than three months — before a vacancy occurred in [the Union League staff]721-the union league staff . [Ratterer]224-ratterer , having some time before established [himself]224-ratterer as [day assistant to [the club staff captain]723-the club staff captain]722-day assistant to the club staff captain , and being on good terms with [him]723-the club staff captain , was able to say to [the latter]546-the latter that [he]723-the club staff captain knew exactly [the man for the place — [Clyde Griffiths]201-clyde — then employed at [the Great Northern]34-the great northern]725-the man for the place — clyde griffiths — then employed at the great northern . And here , very different from [the Great Northern]34-the great northern and superior from a social and material point of view , as [Clyde]201-clyde saw it , to even [the Green - Davidson]35-the green - davidson , [he]201-clyde was able once more to view at close range a type of life that most affected , unfortunately , [his]201-clyde bump of position and distinction . Here also , a fact which impressed and even startled [his]201-clyde sense of curiosity and awe , even — there was no faintest trace of that sex element which had characterized most of the phases of life to be seen in [the Green - Davidson]35-the green - davidson , and more recently [the Great Northern]34-the great northern . But here was no sex — no trace of it . [No women]746-no women were admitted to [this club]728-this club . [These various distinguished individuals]748-these various distinguished individuals came and went , singly as a rule , and with the noiseless vigor and reserve that characterizes the ultra successful . [They]748-these various distinguished individuals often ate alone , conferred in pairs and groups , noiselessly — read [their]748-these various distinguished individuals papers or books , or went here and there in [swiftly driven automobiles]749-swiftly driven automobiles — but for the most part seemed to be unaware of , or at least unaffected by , that element of passion , which , to [his]201-clyde immature mind up to this time , had seemed to propel and disarrange so many things in those lesser worlds with which up to now [he]201-clyde had been identified .

Probably [one]578-one could not attain to or retain [one]578-one 's place in so remarkable a world as this unless [one]578-one were indifferent to sex , a disgraceful passion , of course . And hence in the presence or under the eyes of [such people]753-such people [one]578-one had to act and seem as though such thoughts as from time to time swayed [one]578-one were far from [one]578-one 's mind .

After [he]201-clyde had worked [here]4728-here a little while , under the influence of [this organization]758-this organization and [various personalities who came [here]4728-here]759-various personalities who came here , [he]201-clyde had taken on a most gentlemanly and reserved air . And who knows ? What if [he]201-clyde worked very steadily and made only the right sort of contacts and conducted [himself]201-clyde with the greatest care [here]4728-here , one of [these very remarkable men whom [he]201-clyde saw entering or departing from [here]4728-here]766-these very remarkable men whom he saw entering or departing from here might take a fancy to [him]201-clyde and offer [him]201-clyde a connection with something important somewhere , such as [he]201-clyde had never had before , and that might lift [him]201-clyde into [a world such as [he]201-clyde had never known]768-a world such as he had never known .

For to say the truth , [Clyde]201-clyde had [a soul that was not destined to grow up]769-a soul that was not destined to grow up . [He]201-clyde lacked decidedly that mental clarity and inner directing application that in so many permits [them]770-them to sort out from the facts and avenues of life the particular thing or things that make for [their]770-them direct advancement .

However , as [he]201-clyde now fancied , it was because [he]201-clyde lacked an education that [he]201-clyde had done so poorly . [The people who lived in [fine houses]775-fine houses , who stopped at [great hotels]776-great hotels]774-the people who lived in fine houses , who stopped at great hotels , and had [men like [Mr. Squires]223-mr. squires]777-men like mr. squires , and [the manager of the bell - hops here]778-the manager of the bell - hops here , to wait on [them]774-the people who lived in fine houses , who stopped at great hotels and arrange for [their]774-the people who lived in fine houses , who stopped at great hotels comfort . But hold ! What would [[his]201-clyde uncle]692-his uncle think of [him]201-clyde , supposing [he]201-clyde chose to introduce [himself]201-clyde ? What , for instance , might be [[his]201-clyde uncle]692-his uncle 's attitude toward [boys who worked as [bell - boys]800-bell - boys]799-boys who worked as bell - boys , particularly at [his]201-clyde — [Clyde's]238-clyde's — years . For [he]201-clyde was over twenty now , and getting to be pretty old for [a bell - boy]796-a bell - boy , that is , if [one]578-one ever intended to be anything else . [A man of [his]803-a man of his wealth and high position wealth and high position]803-a man of his wealth and high position might look on [bell - hopping]804-bell - hopping as [menial]805-menial , particularly [bell - boys who chanced to be related to [him]803-a man of his wealth and high position]806-bell - boys who chanced to be related to him . [He]803-a man of his wealth and high position might not wish to have anything to do with [him]803-a man of his wealth and high position — might not even wish [him]803-a man of his wealth and high position to address [him]803-a man of his wealth and high position in any way . It was in this state that [he]201-clyde remained for fully twenty - four hours after [he]201-clyde knew that [[his]201-clyde uncle]692-his uncle had arrived at [this club]728-this club .

The following afternoon , however , after [he]201-clyde had seen [him]692-his uncle at least half a dozen times and had been able to formulate the most agreeable impressions of [him]692-his uncle , since [[his]201-clyde uncle]692-his uncle appeared to be so very quick , alert , incisive — so very different from [[his]201-clyde father]539-his father in every way , and so rich and respected by [every one here]811-every one here — [he]201-clyde began to wonder , to fear even at times , whether [he]201-clyde was going to let this remarkable opportunity slip . For after all , [[his]201-clyde uncle]692-his uncle did not look to [him]201-clyde to be at all unkindly — quite the reverse — very pleasant . And when , at the suggestion of [Ratterer]224-ratterer , [he]201-clyde had gone to [[[his]201-clyde uncle]692-his uncle 's room]814-his uncle 's room to secure a letter which was to be sent by [special messenger]815-special messenger , [[his]201-clyde uncle]692-his uncle had scarcely looked at [him]201-clyde , but instead had handed [him]201-clyde the letter and half a dollar . " See that [a boy]645-a boy takes that right away and keep the money for [yourself]201-clyde , "[201-clyde] [he]201-clyde had remarked .

[Clyde]201-clyde 's excitement was so great at the moment that [he]201-clyde wondered that [[his]201-clyde uncle]692-his uncle did not guess that [he]201-clyde was [[his]692-his uncle nephew]606-his nephew . [[His]201-clyde uncle]692-his uncle was writing at the time and merely called : " Come ! "[692-his uncle] Then [Clyde]201-clyde , entering and smiling rather enigmatically , observed : " Here 's some mail for [you]692-his uncle , [Mr. Griffiths]201-clyde . "[201-clyde]

"[692-his uncle]

" [My]692-his uncle name 's [Clyde Griffiths]201-clyde . [[My]692-his uncle father]4874-my father , [Asa Griffiths]216-asa , is [[your]201-clyde brother]4875-your brother , [I]692-his uncle believe . "[692-his uncle]

At the mention of [this particular brother]826-this particular brother , who , to the knowledge of [all the members of [this family]828-this family]827-all the members of this family , was distinctly not a success materially , the face of [Samuel Griffiths]179-samuel griffiths clouded the least trifle . For the mention of [Asa]216-asa brought rather unpleasingly before [him]201-clyde the stocky and decidedly not well - groomed figure of [[his]201-clyde younger brother]590-his younger brother , whom [he]201-clyde had not seen in so many years . [His]201-clyde most recent distinct picture of [him]201-clyde was as a young man of about [Clyde]201-clyde 's age about [[[his]201-clyde father]539-his father 's house near [Bertwick]40-bertwick]831-his father 's house near bertwick , [Vermont]22-vermont . But how different ! [[Clyde]201-clyde 's father]832-clyde 's father was then short , fat and poorly knit mentally as well as physically — oleaginous and a bit mushy , as it were . [His]832-clyde 's father chin was not firm , [his]832-clyde 's father eyes a pale watery blue , and [his]832-clyde 's father hair frizzled . Whereas [this son of [his]832-clyde 's father]833-this son of his was neat , alert , good - looking and seemingly well - mannered and intelligent , as [most bell - hops]834-most bell - hops were inclined to be as [he]201-clyde noted . And [he]201-clyde liked [him]201-clyde .

However , [Samuel Griffiths]179-samuel griffiths , who along with [his]179-samuel griffiths elder brother [Allen]218-allen had inherited the bulk of [[[his]179-samuel griffiths father]539-his father 's moderate property]836-his father 's moderate property , and this because of [Joseph Griffiths]239-joseph griffiths ' prejudice against [[his]179-samuel griffiths youngest son]837-his youngest son , had always felt that perhaps an injustice had been done [Asa]216-asa . For [Asa]216-asa , not having proved very practical or intelligent , [[his]216-asa father]539-his father had first attempted to drive and then later ignore [him]216-asa , and finally had turned [him]216-asa out at about [Clyde]201-clyde 's age , and had afterward left the bulk of [his]539-his father property , some thirty thousand dollars , to [these two elder brothers]839-these two elder brothers , share and share alike — willing [Asa]216-asa but a petty thousand .

It was this thought in connection with [this younger brother]840-this younger brother that now caused [him]539-his father to stare at [Clyde]201-clyde rather curiously . For [Clyde]201-clyde , as [he]201-clyde could see , was in no way like the younger brother who had been harried from [[[his]201-clyde father]539-his father 's home]842-his father 's home so many years before . Rather [he]201-clyde was more like [[his]201-clyde own son]843-his own son , [Gilbert]215-gilbert , whom , as [he]201-clyde now saw [he]201-clyde resembled . " [You]179-samuel griffiths do n't tell [me]179-samuel griffiths ! "[179-samuel griffiths] [he]179-samuel griffiths exclaimed interestedly . " Well , all [you]179-samuel griffiths 'd have to do then would be to discharge [me]201-clyde , "[201-clyde] assured [Clyde]201-clyde . "[201-clyde]

" Very well , "[179-samuel griffiths] [he]179-samuel griffiths said . " [I]179-samuel griffiths wo n't be able to give any more time to this now . "[179-samuel griffiths] And [he]179-samuel griffiths turned quite abruptly to [his]179-samuel griffiths letters .

And [Clyde]201-clyde , feeling that [he]201-clyde had made as good an impression as could be expected under the circumstances and that something might come of it , thanked [him]179-samuel griffiths profusely and beat a hasty retreat .

The next day , having thought it over and deciding that [Clyde]201-clyde , because of [his]201-clyde briskness and intelligence , was likely to prove as useful as another , [Samuel Griffiths]179-samuel griffiths , after due deliberation as to the situation at [home]4793-home , informed [Clyde]201-clyde that in case any small opening in the [home factory]859-home factory occurred [he]179-samuel griffiths would be glad to notify [him]179-samuel griffiths . But [he]179-samuel griffiths would not even go so far as to guarantee [him]179-samuel griffiths that an opening would immediately be forthcoming . [He]179-samuel griffiths must wait .

[Accordingly Clyde]201-clyde was left to speculate as to how soon , if ever , a place in [[[his]201-clyde uncle]692-his uncle 's factory]861-his uncle 's factory would be made for [him]201-clyde .

In the meanwhile [Samuel Griffiths]179-samuel griffiths had returned to [Lycurgus]1-lycurgus . And after a later conference with [[his]179-samuel griffiths son]4794-his son , [he]179-samuel griffiths decided that [Clyde]201-clyde might be inducted into the very bottom of the business at least — [the basement of [the Griffiths plant]864-the griffiths plant , where the shrinking of all fabrics used in connection with the manufacture of collars]863-the basement of the griffiths plant , where the shrinking of all fabrics used in connection with the manufacture of collars was brought about , and where [beginners in this industry who really desired to acquire the technique of it]865-beginners in this industry who really desired to acquire the technique of it were placed , for it was [his]179-samuel griffiths idea that [Clyde]201-clyde by degrees was to be taught the business from top to bottom . And since [he]201-clyde must support [himself]201-clyde in some form not absolutely incompatible with the standing of [the Griffiths family]866-the griffiths family here in [Lycurgus]1-lycurgus , it was decided to pay [him]201-clyde the munificent sum of fifteen dollars to begin .

For while [Samuel Griffiths]179-samuel griffiths , as well as [[his]179-samuel griffiths son]4794-his son [Gilbert]215-gilbert , realized that this was small pay ( not for [an ordinary apprentice]868-an ordinary apprentice but for [Clyde]201-clyde , since [he]201-clyde was [a relative]603-a relative ) yet so inclined were both toward the practical rather than the charitable in connection with [all those who worked for [them]871-them]870-all those who worked for them , that the nearer [the beginner]872-the beginner in [this factory]873-this factory was to the clear mark of necessity and compulsion , the better . Neither could tolerate the socialistic theory relative to capitalistic exploitation . As [both]874-both saw it , there had to be higher and higher social orders to which [the lower social classes]875-the lower social classes could aspire . [One]578-one had to have castes . [One]578-one was foolishly interfering with and disrupting necessary and unavoidable social standards when [one]578-one tried to unduly favor [any one]4764-any one — even [a relative]603-a relative . It was necessary when dealing with the classes and intelligences below one , commercially or financially , to handle [them]881-them according to the standards to which [they]881-them were accustomed . And the best of these standards were those which held [these lower individuals]882-these lower individuals to a clear realization of how difficult it was to come by money — to an understanding of how very necessary it was for [all who were engaged in what both considered the only really important constructive work of the world — that of material manufacture]883-all who were engaged in what both considered the only really important constructive work of the world — that of material manufacture — to understand how very essential it was to be drilled , and that sharply and systematically , in all the details and processes which comprise that constructive work . And so to become inured to a narrow and abstemious life in so doing . It was good for [[their]881-them characters]884-their characters . It informed and strengthened the minds and spirits of [those who were destined to rise]885-those who were destined to rise . And [those who were not]560-those who were not should be kept right where [they]560-those who were not were .

Accordingly , about a week after that , the nature of [Clyde]201-clyde 's work having been finally decided upon , a letter was dispatched to [him]201-clyde to [Chicago]5-chicago by [Samuel Griffiths]179-samuel griffiths [himself]179-samuel griffiths in which [he]179-samuel griffiths set forth that if [he]179-samuel griffiths chose [he]179-samuel griffiths might present [himself]179-samuel griffiths any time now within the next few weeks . But [he]179-samuel griffiths must give due notice in writing of at least ten days in advance of [his]179-samuel griffiths appearance in order that [he]179-samuel griffiths might be properly arranged for . And upon [his]179-samuel griffiths arrival [he]179-samuel griffiths was to seek out [Mr. Gilbert Griffiths]200-gilbert at [the office of [the mill]888-the mill]887-the office of the mill , who would look after [him]179-samuel griffiths .

And upon receipt of this [Clyde]201-clyde was very much thrilled and at once wrote to [[his]201-clyde mother]587-his mother that [he]201-clyde had actually secured a place with [[his]201-clyde uncle]692-his uncle and was going to [Lycurgus]1-lycurgus . Also that [he]201-clyde was going to try to achieve a real success now . Whereupon [she]587-his mother wrote [him]201-clyde a long letter , urging [him]201-clyde to be , oh , so careful of [his]201-clyde conduct and [associates]891-associates . Bad companionship was at the root of nearly all of the errors and failures that befell [an ambitious youth such as [he]201-clyde]892-an ambitious youth such as he . If [he]201-clyde would only avoid [evil - minded or foolish and headstrong boys]893-evil - minded or foolish and headstrong boys and [girls]894-girls , all would be well . It was so easy for [a young man of]895-a young man of [his]201-clyde looks and character to be led astray by [an evil woman]896-an evil woman . [He]201-clyde had seen what had befallen [him]201-clyde in [Kansas City]23-kansas city . But now [he]201-clyde was still young and [he]201-clyde was going to work for [a man who was very rich and who could do so much for [him]201-clyde , if [he]201-clyde would]897-a man who was very rich and who could do so much for him , if he would . And [he]201-clyde was to write [her]896-an evil woman frequently as to the outcome of [his]201-clyde efforts here .

And so , after having notified [[his]201-clyde uncle]692-his uncle as [he]201-clyde had requested , [Clyde]201-clyde finally took [his]201-clyde departure for [Lycurgus]1-lycurgus . But on [his]201-clyde arrival [there]4705-there , since [his]201-clyde original notification from [[his]201-clyde uncle]692-his uncle had called for no special hour at which to call at [the factory]440-the factory , [he]201-clyde did not go at once , but instead sought out [the important hotel of [Lycurgus]1-lycurgus]902-the important hotel of lycurgus , [the Lycurgus House]903-the lycurgus house .

Then finding [himself]201-clyde with ample time on [his]201-clyde hands , and very curious about the character of [this city]904-this city in which [he]201-clyde was to work , and [[his]201-clyde uncle]692-his uncle 's position in it , [he]201-clyde set forth to look it over , [his]201-clyde thought being that once [he]201-clyde reported and began work [he]201-clyde might not soon have the time again . [He]201-clyde now ambled out into [Central Avenue]43-central avenue , [the very heart of [Lycurgus]1-lycurgus]906-the very heart of lycurgus , which in this section was crossed by [several business streets]907-several business streets , which together with [Central Avenue]43-central avenue for a few blocks on either side , appeared to constitute [the business center]908-the business center — all there was to the life and gayety of [Lycurgus]1-lycurgus .

But once in this and walking about , how different it all seemed to [the world to which so recently [he]201-clyde had been accustomed]909-the world to which so recently he had been accustomed . For here , as [he]201-clyde had thus far seen , all was on a so much smaller scale . [The depot]910-the depot , from which only a half hour before [he]201-clyde had stepped down , was so small and dull , untroubled , as [he]201-clyde could plainly see , by much traffic . And [the factory section which lay opposite [the small city]912-the small city — across [the Mohawk]44-the mohawk]911-the factory section which lay opposite the small city — across the mohawk — was little more than [a red and gray assemblage of buildings with here and there a smokestack projecting upward]913-a red and gray assemblage of buildings with here and there a smokestack projecting upward , and connected with [the city]477-the city by [two bridges — a half dozen blocks apart]915-two bridges — a half dozen blocks apart — one of [them]915-two bridges — a half dozen blocks apart directly at [this depot]916-this depot , [a wide traffic bridge across which traveled a car - line following the curves of [Central Avenue]43-central avenue]917-a wide traffic bridge across which traveled a car - line following the curves of central avenue , dotted here and there with [stores]918-stores and [small homes]919-small homes .

But [Central Avenue]43-central avenue was quite alive with traffic , [pedestrians]920-pedestrians and automobiles . " Never worked in [a collar factory]4934-a collar factory before , [Mr. Griffiths]200-gilbert , [I]245-whiggam presume ? [He]200-gilbert marched solemnly on and [Clyde]201-clyde sensed once more that [this man]1044-this man was not looking upon [him]201-clyde as [an ordinary employee]1045-an ordinary employee by any means . [[His]201-clyde [Mr. Griffiths]201-clyde]1046-his mr. griffiths , [his]1046-his mr. griffiths supposition to the effect that [Clyde]201-clyde was to learn all about the manufacturing end of the business , as well as [his]1046-his mr. griffiths condescension in explaining about these webs of cloth , had already convinced [Clyde]201-clyde that [he]201-clyde was looked upon as [one to whom some slight homage at least must be paid]1047-one to whom some slight homage at least must be paid .

[Here]4728-here , by the help of four long rows of incandescent lamps , [he]201-clyde discerned row after row of porcelain tubs or troughs , lengthwise of [the room]489-the room , and end to end , which reached from one exterior wall to the other . And in these , under steaming hot water apparently , were any quantity of those same webs [he]201-clyde had just seen [upstairs]575-upstairs , soaking . And near - by , north and south of these tubs , and paralleling [them]1053-them for the length of [this room]1054-this room , all of a hundred and fifty feet in length , were enormous drying racks or moving skeleton platforms , boxed , top and bottom and sides , with hot steam pipes , between which on rolls , but festooned in such a fashion as to take advantage of these pipes , above , below and on either side , were more of these webs , but unwound and wet and draped as described , yet moving along slowly on these rolls from the east end of [the room]489-the room to the west . This movement , as [Clyde]201-clyde could see , was accompanied by an enormous rattle and clatter of ratchet arms which automatically shook and moved these lengths of cloth forward from east to west . And as [they]1056-they moved they dried , and were then automatically re - wound at the west end of [these racks]1057-these racks into bolt form once more upon a wooden spool and then lifted off by [a youth whose duty it was to " take "[1059-one youth] from these moving platforms]1058-a youth whose duty it was to " take " from these moving platforms . "[201-clyde] That is , [he]201-clyde took bolts of this now partially shrunk yet still wet cloth and attaching one end of it to some moving hooks , saw that it slowly and properly unwound and fed itself over the drying racks for the entire length of these tracks . As fast as it had gone the way of all webs , another was attached .

Between each two rows of tubs in the center of [the room]489-the room were enormous whirling separators or dryers , into which these webs of cloth , as they came from the tubs in which [they]1056-they had been shrinking for twenty - four hours , were piled and as much water as possible centrifugally extracted before they were spread out on the drying racks .

[Primarily]247-primarily little more than this mere physical aspect of [the room]489-the room was grasped by [Clyde]201-clyde — its noise , its heat , its steam , the energy with which [a dozen men]1063-a dozen men and [boys]465-boys were busying [themselves]1063-a dozen men with various processes . [They]1063-a dozen men were , without exception , clothed only in armless undershirts , a pair of old trousers belted in at the waist , and with canvas - topped and rubber - soled sneakers on [their]1063-a dozen men bare feet . The water and the general dampness and the heat of [the room]489-the room seemed obviously to necessitate some such dressing as this .

It was thus that , strolling west along [River Street]45-river street on which were a number of other kinds of [factories]1088-factories , and then north through [a few other streets that held more factories]1089-a few other streets that held more factories — tinware , wickwire , a big vacuum carpet cleaning plant , [a rug manufacturing company]1090-a rug manufacturing company , and the like — that [he]201-clyde came finally upon [a miserable slum]1091-a miserable slum , the like of which , small as it was , [he]201-clyde had not seen outside of [Chicago]5-chicago or [Kansas City]23-kansas city . And [Clyde]201-clyde , walking to and fro , from eight until ten , when as though by pre - arrangement , [the crowd in [the more congested streets]1175-the more congested streets]1174-the crowd in the more congested streets seemed suddenly to fade away , leaving [them]1174-the crowd in the more congested streets quite vacant . And throughout this time contrasting it all with [Chicago]5-chicago and [Kansas City]23-kansas city . ( What would [Ratterer]224-ratterer think if [he]201-clyde could see [him]201-clyde now — [[[his]201-clyde uncle]692-his uncle 's great house and [factory]1178-factory]1177-his uncle 's great house and factory ? ) And perhaps because of [its]1179-it smallness , liking [it]1179-it — [the Lycurgus Hotel]1180-the lycurgus hotel , neat and bright and with a brisk local life seeming to center about [it]1179-it . And in [the shrinking room]4916-the shrinking room when [he]1228-he entered , as on the day before , [he]1228-he found [Kemerer]248-mr. kemerer as respectful and evasive as ever . The days that followed were diverting and yet troublesome enough to [Clyde]201-clyde , who to begin with was puzzled and disturbed at times by the peculiar social and workaday worlds and position in which [he]201-clyde found [himself]201-clyde . For one thing , [those by whom now [he]201-clyde found [himself]201-clyde immediately surrounded at [the factory]440-the factory]1237-those by whom now he found himself immediately surrounded at the factory were [not such individuals as [he]201-clyde would ordinarily select for [companions]1240-companions]1239-not such individuals as he would ordinarily select for companions — [far below [bell - boys]800-bell - boys or [drivers]1243-drivers or [clerks]1244-clerks anywhere]1241-far below bell - boys or drivers or clerks anywhere . [They]1237-those by whom now he found himself immediately surrounded at the factory were , one and all , as [he]201-clyde could now clearly see , meaty or stodgy mentally and physically . [They]1237-those by whom now he found himself immediately surrounded at the factory wore such clothes as [only the most common laborers]1245-only the most common laborers would wear — such clothes as are usually worn by [those who count [their]1246-those who count their personal appearance among the least of their troubles personal appearance among the least of [their]1246-those who count their personal appearance among the least of their troubles troubles]1246-those who count their personal appearance among the least of their troubles — [their]1246-those who count their personal appearance among the least of their troubles work and [their]1246-those who count their personal appearance among the least of their troubles heavy material existence being all . After a week or two , however , coming to understand that [Clyde]201-clyde was [a nephew of [the president]1248-the president]1247-a nephew of the president , [a cousin of [the secretary of [the company]990-the company]1250-the secretary of the company]1249-a cousin of the secretary of the company , and hence not likely to remain [here]4728-here long in any menial capacity , [they]1237-those by whom now he found himself immediately surrounded at the factory grew more friendly , but inclined in the face of the sense of subserviency which this inspired in [them]1237-those by whom now he found himself immediately surrounded at the factory , to become jealous and suspicious of [him]201-clyde in another way . For , after all , [Clyde]201-clyde was not one of [them]1237-those by whom now he found himself immediately surrounded at the factory , and under such circumstances could not be . [He]201-clyde might smile and be civil enough — yet [he]201-clyde would always be in touch with [those who were above [them]1237-those by whom now he found himself immediately surrounded at the factory]1253-those who were above them , would [he]201-clyde not — or so [they]1237-those by whom now he found himself immediately surrounded at the factory thought . [He]201-clyde was , as [they]1237-those by whom now he found himself immediately surrounded at the factory saw it , part of [the rich and superior class]1254-the rich and superior class and [every poor man]1255-every poor man knew what that meant . [The poor]1256-the poor must stand together everywhere .

For [his]201-clyde part , however , and sitting about for the first few days in [this particular room]1257-this particular room eating [his]201-clyde lunch , [he]201-clyde wondered how [these men]773-these men could interest [themselves]773-these men in what were to [him]201-clyde such dull and uninteresting items — the quality of the cloth that was coming down in the webs — some minute flaws in the matter of weight or weave — the last twenty webs had n't looked so closely shrunk as the preceding sixteen ; or [the Cranston Wickwire Company]15-the cranston wickwire company was not carrying as many [men]445-men as [it]15-the cranston wickwire company had the month before — or [the Anthony Woodenware Company]1260-the anthony woodenware company had posted a notice that the Saturday half - holiday would not begin before June first this year as opposed to the middle of May last year . [They]773-these men all appeared to be lost in the humdrum and routine of [their]773-these men work .

In consequence [his]201-clyde mind went back to happier scenes . [He]201-clyde wished at times [he]201-clyde were back in [Chicago]5-chicago or [Kansas City]23-kansas city . [He]201-clyde though of [Ratterer]224-ratterer , [Hegglund]226-hegglund , [Higby]230-higby , [Louise]234-louise , [Larry Doyle]255-larry doyle , [Mr. Squires]223-mr. squires , [Hortense]220-hortense briggs — all of [the young and thoughtless company of which [he]201-clyde had been a part]1261-the young and thoughtless company of which he had been a part , and wondered what [they]773-these men were doing . What had become of [Hortense]220-hortense briggs ? [She]220-hortense briggs had got that fur coat after all — probably from [that cigar clerk]1262-that cigar clerk and then had gone away with [him]201-clyde after [she]220-hortense briggs had protested so much feeling for [him]201-clyde — the little beast . To whom was [she]220-hortense briggs being nice now ? How had [she]220-hortense briggs found things since leaving [Kansas City]23-kansas city ? And what would [she]220-hortense briggs think if [she]220-hortense briggs saw [him]201-clyde here now or knew of [his]201-clyde present high connections ? [Gee]205-gee ! That would cool [her]220-hortense briggs a little . But [she]220-hortense briggs would not think much of [his]201-clyde present position . That was true . But [she]220-hortense briggs might respect [him]201-clyde more if [she]220-hortense briggs could see [[his]201-clyde uncle]692-his uncle and [[his]201-clyde cousin]622-his cousin and [this factory]873-this factory and [[their]1267-their big house]1268-their big house . Well , [he]201-clyde would show [her]220-hortense briggs , if [he]201-clyde ever ran into [her]220-hortense briggs again — snub [her]220-hortense briggs , of course , as no doubt [he]201-clyde very well could by then .

In so far as [his]201-clyde life at [Mrs. Cuppy]256-mrs. cuppy 's went , [he]201-clyde was not so very happily placed [there]4705-there , either . For that was but [a commonplace rooming and [boarding house]1271-boarding house]1270-a commonplace rooming and boarding house , which drew to [it]1270-a commonplace rooming and boarding house , at best , [such conservative mill and business types as looked on work]1272-such conservative mill and business types as looked on work and [their]1272-such conservative mill and business types as looked on work wages , and the notions of [the middle class religious world of [Lycurgus]1-lycurgus]1273-the middle class religious world of lycurgus as most essential to the order and well being of [the world]4755-the world . From the point of view of entertainment or gayety , [it]1275-it was in the main a very dull place .

At the same time , because of the presence of one [Walter Dillard]257-dillard — [a brainless sprig who had recently come here from [Fonda]47-fonda]1276-a brainless sprig who had recently come here from fonda , it was not wholly devoid of interest for [Clyde]201-clyde . [The latter]546-the latter — [a youth of about [Clyde]201-clyde 's own age]1278-a youth of about clyde 's own age and equally ambitious socially — but without [Clyde]201-clyde 's tact or discrimination anent the governing facts of life , was connected with [[the men]1279-the men 's furnishing department of [Stark and Company]923-stark and company]1280-the men 's furnishing department of stark and company . [He]201-clyde was spry , avid , attractive enough physically , with very light hair , a very light and feeble mustache , and the delicate airs and ways of [a small town Beau Brummell]1282-a small town beau brummell . Never having had any social standing or the use of any means whatsoever — [[his]201-clyde father]539-his father having been [a small town dry goods merchant]1284-a small town dry goods merchant before [him]201-clyde , who had failed — [he]201-clyde was , because of some atavistic spur or fillip in [his]201-clyde own blood , most anxious to attain some sort of social position .

But failing that so far , [he]201-clyde was interested in and envious of [those who had it]1285-those who had it — much more so than [Clyde]201-clyde , even . The glory and activity of [the leading families of [this particular city]1287-this particular city]1286-the leading families of this particular city had enormous weight with [him]201-clyde — [the Nicholsons]193-the nicholsons , [the Starks]258-the starks , [the Harriets]196-the harriets , [Griffiths]201-clyde , [Finchleys]184-the finchleys , et cetera . And learning a few days after [Clyde]201-clyde 's arrival of [his]201-clyde somewhat left - handed connection with [this world]1288-this world , [he]201-clyde was most definitely interested . What ? [A Griffiths]201-clyde ! [The nephew of [the rich Samuel Griffiths]179-samuel griffiths]1289-the nephew of the rich samuel griffiths ! And in [this boarding house]1290-this boarding house ! Beside [him]201-clyde at this table ! At once [his]201-clyde interest rose to where [he]201-clyde decided that [he]201-clyde must cultivate [this stranger]1291-this stranger as speedily as possible . Here was a real social opportunity knocking at [his]201-clyde very door — a connecting link to one of [the very best families]1292-the very best families ! And besides was [he]201-clyde not young , attractive and probably ambitious like [himself]201-clyde — a fellow to play around with if one could ? [He]201-clyde proceeded at once to make overtures to [Clyde]201-clyde . It seemed almost too good to be true .

In consequence [he]201-clyde was quick to suggest a walk , the fact that there was a certain movie just on at [the Mohawk]44-the mohawk , which was excellent — very snappy . Did n't [Clyde]201-clyde want to go ? And because of [his]201-clyde neatness , smartness — a touch of something that was far from humdrum or the heavy practicality of [the mill]888-the mill and the remainder of [this boarding house]1290-this boarding house world , [Clyde]201-clyde was inclined to fall in with [him]1291-this stranger .

But , as [he]201-clyde now thought , here were [[his]201-clyde great relatives]1295-his great relatives and [he]201-clyde must watch [his]201-clyde step here . Who knew but that [he]201-clyde might be making a great mistake in holding such free and easy contacts as this . [The Griffiths]201-clyde — as well as the entire world of which [they]1296-they were a part — as [he]201-clyde guessed from the general manner of [all those who even contacted [him]201-clyde]1297-all those who even contacted him , must be very removed from the commonalty here . There formulated [itself]1316-itself in [Clyde]201-clyde 's mind the question as to what , in regard to just such proposals as this , [his]201-clyde course here was to be . In [Chicago]5-chicago , and recently — because of what happened in [Kansas City]23-kansas city — [he]201-clyde had sought to be as retiring and cautious as possible . For — after that and while connected with [the club]714-the club , [he]201-clyde had been taken with the fancy of trying to live up to the ideals with which the seemingly stern face of [that institution]1318-that institution had inspired [him]201-clyde — conservatism — hard work — saving [one]578-one 's money — looking neat and gentlemanly . "[257-dillard] [And Clyde]201-clyde , who realized how shallow was this pretense , was still not a little pleased and impressed by the effect of it all . This [Dillard]257-dillard 's effrontery . The brassy way in which , because of [Clyde]201-clyde , [he]257-dillard presumed to patronize [these people]1401-these people . On this occasion , [he]257-dillard kept guiding [Clyde]201-clyde here and there , refusing for the most part to leave [him]201-clyde alone for an instant . In fact [he]257-dillard was determined that [all whom [he]257-dillard knew and liked among [the girls]5027-the girls and [young men]983-young men]1402-all whom he knew and liked among the girls and young men should know who and what [Clyde]201-clyde was and that [he]257-dillard was presenting [him]201-clyde . Also that [those whom [he]257-dillard did not like]1405-those whom he did not like should see as little of [him]201-clyde as possible — not be introduced at all . " [She]5027-the girls do n't amount to anything . [[Her]5027-the girls father]510-her father only keeps [a small garage]5055-a small garage [here]4728-here . Just [a clerk in [[our]5059-our store]5060-our store]5058-a clerk in our store . "[201-clyde] At the same time , in regard to [some others]1406-some others , [he]201-clyde was all smiles and compliments , or at worst apologetic for [their]1406-some others social lacks .

And then [he]201-clyde was introduced to [Zella Shuman]259-zella and [Rita Dickerman]260-rita , who , for reasons of [their]1406-some others own , not the least among which was a desire to appear a little wise and more sophisticated than [the others here]1407-the others here , came a little late . And it was true , as [Clyde]201-clyde was to find out afterwards , that [they]1406-some others were different , too — less simple and restricted than quite all of [the girls whom [Dillard]257-dillard had thus far introduced [him]201-clyde to]1408-the girls whom dillard had thus far introduced him to . [They]1406-some others were not as sound religiously and morally as were [these others]1409-these others . The way [she]259-zella said " [Walter]257-dillard , "[259-zella] together with something intimate and possessive in the tone of [her]259-zella voice , caused [Clyde]201-clyde to feel at once that [she]259-zella must feel rather closer to and freer with [Dillard]257-dillard than [he]201-clyde [himself]201-clyde had indicated . A small scarlet bow of velvet ribbon at [her]259-zella throat , two small garnet earrings in [her]259-zella ears , a very trim and tight - fitting black dress , with a heavily flounced skirt , seemed to indicate that [she]259-zella was not opposed to showing [her]259-zella figure , and prized it , a mood which except for a demure and rather retiring poise which [she]259-zella affected , would most certainly have excited comment in such a place as this .

[Rita Dickerman]260-rita , on the other hand , was lush and blonde , with pink cheeks , light chestnut hair , and bluish gray eyes . Lacking the aggressive smartness which characterized [Zella Shuman]259-zella , [she]259-zella still radiated a certain something which to [Clyde]201-clyde seemed to harmonize with the liberal if secret mood of [[her]259-zella friend]1413-her friend . [Her]259-zella manner , as [Clyde]201-clyde could see , while much less suggestive of masked bravado was yielding and to [him]201-clyde designedly so , as well as naturally provocative . It had been arranged that [she]259-zella was to intrigue [him]201-clyde . Very much fascinated by [Zella Shuman]259-zella and in tow of [her]259-zella , [they]1414-they were inseparable . And when [Clyde]201-clyde was introduced to [her]259-zella , [she]259-zella beamed upon [him]201-clyde in a melting and sensuous way which troubled [him]201-clyde not a little . For here in [Lycurgus]1-lycurgus , as [he]201-clyde was telling [himself]201-clyde at the time , [he]201-clyde must be very careful with whom [he]201-clyde became familiar . And yet , unfortunately , as in the case of [Hortense Briggs]220-hortense briggs , [she]259-zella evoked thoughts of intimacy , however unproblematic or distant , which troubled [him]201-clyde . [He]257-dillard was so fascinated by [his]257-dillard own skill as [a dancer]1436-a dancer , however , as well as [his]257-dillard natural joy in the art , that [he]257-dillard could scarcely wait to begin another , but must take [Rita]260-rita by the arms before putting on another record , gliding here and there , doing steps and executing figures which [Clyde]201-clyde could not possibly achieve and which at once established [Dillard]257-dillard as [the superior dancer]1437-the superior dancer . But as [Clyde]201-clyde could see after dancing with [Zella]259-zella once , this was planned to be a happy companionship of [two mutually mated couples who would not interfere with [each other]1439-each other in any way , but rather would aid [each other]1439-each other in [their]1438-two mutually mated couples who would not interfere with each other in any way , but rather would aid each other in their various schemes to enjoy one another 's society various schemes to enjoy [one another]702-one another 's society]1438-two mutually mated couples who would not interfere with each other in any way , but rather would aid each other in their various schemes to enjoy one another 's society .
