Then [he]201-clyde 'll understand it 's something private and it 'll be easier . "[302-roberta]

[He]201-clyde went on with more advice of the same kind , and [she]302-roberta , realizing from [his]201-clyde lack of spontaneous enthusiasm for [her]302-roberta at this moment how desperate was [her]302-roberta state , drew [herself]302-roberta together as vigorously as [she]302-roberta could , and saying : " Well , wait here , then , will [you]201-clyde ? Do n't go very far away , will [you]201-clyde ? [I]201-clyde may be right back , "[201-clyde] hurried along in the shadow through the gate and up a walk which led to the front door .

In answer to [her]302-roberta ring the door was opened by [one of [those exteriorly as well as mentally sober , small - town practitioners who , [Clyde]201-clyde 's and [Short]398-short 's notion to the contrary notwithstanding]3652-those exteriorly as well as mentally sober , small - town practitioners who , clyde 's and short 's notion to the contrary notwithstanding , was [the typical and fairly conservative physician of [the countryside]3654-the countryside]3653-the typical and fairly conservative physician of the countryside — solemn , cautious , moral , semi - religious to a degree , holding some views which [he]201-clyde considered liberal and others which [a fairly liberal person]3655-a fairly liberal person would have considered narrow and stubborn into the bargain]3651-one of those exteriorly as well as mentally sober , small - town practitioners who , clyde 's and short 's notion to the contrary notwithstanding , was the typical and fairly conservative physician of the countryside — solemn , cautious , moral , semi - religious to a degree , holding some views which he considered liberal and others which a fairly liberal person would have considered narrow and stubborn into the bargain . Yet because of the ignorance and stupidity of [so many of those about [him]201-clyde]3656-so many of those about him , [he]201-clyde was able to consider [himself]201-clyde at least fairly learned . In constant touch with all phases of ignorance and dereliction as well as sobriety , energy , conservatism , success and the like , [he]201-clyde was more inclined , where fact appeared to nullify [his]201-clyde early conclusion in regard to many things , to suspend judgment between the alleged claims of heaven and hell and leave it there suspended and undisturbed . Physically [he]201-clyde was short , stocky , bullet - headed and yet interestingly - featured , with quick gray eyes and a pleasant mouth and smile . [His]201-clyde short iron - gray hair was worn " bangs "[201-clyde] fashion , a bit of rural vanity . And [his]201-clyde arms and hands , the latter fat and pudgy , yet sensitive , hung limply at [his]201-clyde sides . [He]201-clyde was fifty - eight , married , [the father of three children]3657-the father of three children , one of [them]3658-them a son already studying medicine in order to succeed to [[[his]201-clyde father]539-his father 's practice]3660-his father 's practice .

After showing [Roberta]302-roberta into [a littered and commonplace waiting room]3661-a littered and commonplace waiting room and asking [her]302-roberta to remain until [he]201-clyde had finished [his]201-clyde dinner , [he]201-clyde presently appeared in the door of [an equally commonplace inner room]3662-an equally commonplace inner room , or [office]1081-office , where were [his]201-clyde desk , two chairs , some medical instruments , books and apparently an ante - chamber containing other medical things , and motioned [her]302-roberta to a chair . And because of [his]201-clyde grayness , solidity , stolidity , as well as an odd habit [he]201-clyde had of blinking [his]201-clyde eyes , [Roberta]302-roberta was not a little overawed , though by no means so unfavorably impressed as [she]302-roberta had feared [she]302-roberta might be . At least [he]201-clyde was old and [he]201-clyde seemed intelligent and conservative , if not exactly sympathetic or warm in [his]201-clyde manner . And after looking at [her]302-roberta curiously a moment , as though seeking to recognize [some one of the immediate vicinity]3664-some one of the immediate vicinity , [he]201-clyde began : " Well , now who is this , please ? And what can [I]302-roberta do for [you]302-roberta ? "[302-roberta] [His]201-clyde voice was low and quite reassuring — a fact for which [Roberta]302-roberta was deeply grateful .

At the same time , startled by the fact that at last [she]302-roberta had reached the place and the moment when , if ever , [she]302-roberta must say the degrading truth about [herself]302-roberta , [she]302-roberta merely sat there , [her]302-roberta eyes first upon [him]201-clyde , then upon the floor , [her]302-roberta fingers beginning to toy with the handle of the small bag [she]302-roberta carried .

" [You]201-clyde see , well , "[302-roberta] [she]302-roberta began , earnestly and nervously , [her]302-roberta whole manner suddenly betraying the terrific strain under which [she]302-roberta was laboring . "[302-roberta] [She]302-roberta paused and moved back in [her]302-roberta chair as though to rise , at the same time that [she]302-roberta added : " Oh , [dear]5356-dear , how very dreadful it all is . [I]3665-he 'm so nervous and ... "[3665-he]

[He]3668-he was decidedly pleasant , as [she]302-roberta now thought , and yet so sober and reserved and probably conventional withal that what [she]302-roberta was holding in mind to tell [him]3668-he would probably shock [him]3668-he not a little — and then what ? [She]302-roberta could not leave without . Once more [she]302-roberta moved and twisted , seizing nervously on a large button of [her]302-roberta coat to turn between [her]302-roberta thumb and forefinger , and then went on chokingly .

" But this is ... this is ... well , something different , [you]302-roberta know , maybe not what [you]302-roberta think ... [I]3610-the doctor ... [I]3610-the doctor ... well ... "[3610-the doctor]

Again [she]302-roberta paused , unable to proceed , shading from white to red and back as [she]302-roberta spoke . And because of the troubled modesty of [her]302-roberta approach , as well as a certain clarity of eye , whiteness of forehead , sobriety of manner and dress , [the doctor]3610-the doctor could scarcely bring [himself]3610-the doctor to think for a moment that this was anything other than one of those morbid exhibitions of innocence , or rather inexperience , in connection with everything relating to [the human body]3671-the human body — so characteristic of [the young and unsophisticated in some instances]3672-the young and unsophisticated in some instances . And so [he]3610-the doctor was about to repeat [his]3610-the doctor customary formula in such cases that all could be told to [him]3610-the doctor without fear or hesitation , whatever it might be , when a secondary thought , based on [Roberta]302-roberta 's charm and vigor , as well as [her]302-roberta own thought waves attacking [his]3610-the doctor cerebral receptive centers , caused [him]3610-the doctor to decide that [he]3610-the doctor might be wrong . After all , why might not this be another of those troublesome youthful cases in which possibly immorality and illegitimacy was involved . [She]302-roberta was so young , healthy and attractive , besides , [they]3673-they were always cropping up , these cases,—in connection with [the most respectable - looking girls]3674-the most respectable - looking girls at times . And invariably [they]3673-they spelled trouble and distress for [doctors]5791-doctors . And , for various reasons connected with [his]3610-the doctor own temperament , which was retiring and recessive , as well as the nature of this local social world , [he]3610-the doctor disliked and hesitated to even trifle with [them]3673-they . [They]3673-they were illegal , dangerous , involved little or no pay as a rule , and the sentiment of [this local world]3156-this local world was all against [them]3673-they as [he]3610-the doctor knew . Besides [he]3610-the doctor personally was more or less irritated by [these young scamps of [boys]465-boys and girls who were so free to exercise the normal functions of [their]3677-these young scamps of boys and girls who were so free to exercise the normal functions of their natures in the first instance , but so ready to refuse the social obligations which went with them — marriage afterwards natures in the first instance , but so ready to refuse the social obligations which went with [them]3677-these young scamps of boys and girls who were so free to exercise the normal functions of their natures in the first instance , but so ready to refuse the social obligations which went with them — marriage afterwards — marriage afterwards]3677-these young scamps of boys and girls who were so free to exercise the normal functions of their natures in the first instance , but so ready to refuse the social obligations which went with them — marriage afterwards . And so , although in several cases in the past ten years where family and other neighborhood and religious considerations had made it seem quite advisable , [he]3610-the doctor had assisted in extricating from the consequences of [their]3677-these young scamps of boys and girls who were so free to exercise the normal functions of their natures in the first instance , but so ready to refuse the social obligations which went with them — marriage afterwards folly [several young girls of [good family who had fallen from grace and could not otherwise be rescued]3680-good family who had fallen from grace and could not otherwise be rescued]3679-several young girls of good family who had fallen from grace and could not otherwise be rescued , still [he]3610-the doctor was opposed to aiding , either by [his]3610-the doctor own countenance or skill , any lapses or tangles not heavily sponsored by [others]561-others . It was too dangerous . Ordinarily it was [his]3610-the doctor custom to advise immediate and unconditional marriage . Or , where that was not possible , [the perpetrator of the infamy]3682-the perpetrator of the infamy having decamped , it was [his]3610-the doctor general and self - consciously sanctioned practice to have nothing at all to do with the matter . It was too dangerous and ethically and socially wrong and criminal into the bargain .

In consequence [he]3610-the doctor now looked at [Roberta]302-roberta in an extremely sober manner . By no means , [he]3610-the doctor now said to [himself]3610-the doctor , must [he]3610-the doctor allow [himself]3610-the doctor to become emotionally or otherwise involved here . And so in order to help [himself]3610-the doctor as well as [her]302-roberta to attain and maintain a balance which would permit of both extricating [themselves]3683-themselves without too much trouble , [he]3610-the doctor drew toward [him]3610-the doctor [his]3610-the doctor black leather case record book and , opening it , said : " Now , let 's see if [we]5822-we ca n't find out what the trouble is here . What is [your]302-roberta name ? "[302-roberta]

" [Ruth Howard]400-ruth howard . [Mrs. Howard]401-mrs. howard , "[3610-the doctor] replied [Roberta]302-roberta nervously and tensely , at once fixing upon a name which [Clyde]201-clyde had suggested for [her]302-roberta use . And now , interestingly enough , at mention of the fact that [she]302-roberta was married , [he]3610-the doctor breathed easier . But why the tears then ? What reason could [a young married woman]3684-a young married woman have for being so intensely shy and nervous ?

" And [[your]302-roberta husband]5823-your husband 's first name ? "[302-roberta] [he]3610-the doctor went on .

" [You]302-roberta live around [her]302-roberta , [I]3610-the doctor presume ? "[3610-the doctor]

" In [Fonda]47-fonda . "[3610-the doctor]

" Yes . And how old are [you]302-roberta ? "[3610-the doctor]

" Twenty - two . "[3610-the doctor]

" How long have [you]302-roberta been married ? "[302-roberta]

This inquiry being so intimately connected with the problem before [her]302-roberta , [she]302-roberta again hesitated before saying , " Let [me]402-dr. glenn see — three months . "[402-dr. glenn]

At once [Dr. Glenn]402-dr. glenn became dubious again , though [he]402-dr. glenn gave [her]302-roberta no sign . [Her]302-roberta hesitancy arrested [him]402-dr. glenn . Why the uncertainty ? [He]402-dr. glenn was wondering now again whether [he]402-dr. glenn was dealing with [a truthful girl]3686-a truthful girl or whether [his]402-dr. glenn first suspicions were being substantiated . In consequence [he]402-dr. glenn now asked : " Well , now what seems to be the trouble , [Mrs. Howard]401-mrs. howard ? " Well , "[302-roberta] began [Roberta]302-roberta , nervously once more , this terrible confession drying [her]302-roberta throat and thickening [her]302-roberta tongue almost , while once more [she]302-roberta turned the same button of [her]302-roberta coat and gazed at the floor . " It 's like this ... [You]402-dr. glenn see ... [we]5826-us ca n't afford to ... to have ... well , [any ... children]5827-any ... children , [you]3610-the doctor see , so soon , anyhow , and ... "[434-the husband]

[She]302-roberta paused , [her]302-roberta breath catching , and really unable to proceed further with this wholesale lying .

[The doctor]3610-the doctor realizing from this , as [he]3610-the doctor thought , what the true problem was — that [she]302-roberta was [a newly - married girl who was probably faced by just such a problem as [she]302-roberta was attempting to outline — yet not wishing to enter upon any form of malpractice and at the same time not wishing to appear too discouraging to [a young couple just starting out in life]3689-a young couple just starting out in life]3688-a newly - married girl who was probably faced by just such a problem as she was attempting to outline — yet not wishing to enter upon any form of malpractice and at the same time not wishing to appear too discouraging to a young couple just starting out in life , gazed at [her]302-roberta somewhat more sympathetically , the decidedly unfortunate predicament of [these young people]3690-these young people , as well as [her]302-roberta appropriate modesty in the face of such a conventionally delicate situation , appealing to [him]3610-the doctor . It was too bad . [Young people]3691-young people these days did have a rather hard time of it , getting started in some cases , anyhow . And [they]3691-young people were no doubt faced by some pressing financial situations . [Nearly all young people]3692-nearly all young people were . Nevertheless , this business of a contraceptal operation or interference with the normal or God - arranged life processes , well , that was a ticklish and unnatural business at best which [he]3610-the doctor wanted as little as possible to do with . Besides , [young , healthy people]3693-young , healthy people , even though poor , when [they]3693-young , healthy people undertook marriage , knew what [they]3693-young , healthy people were about . And it was not impossible for [them]3693-young , healthy people to work , [the husband]434-the husband anyhow , and hence manage in some way .

And now straightening [himself]434-the husband around in [his]434-the husband chair very soberly and authoritatively , [he]434-the husband began : " [I]434-the husband think [I]434-the husband understand what [you]5828-you want to say to [me]434-the husband , [Mrs. Howard]401-mrs. howard . "[302-roberta]

Something about the tone of [his]434-the husband voice , the manner in which [he]434-the husband asked the question — the caution of it as well as the possibly impending resentment in case it should turn out that [any one]4764-any one suspected [him]434-the husband of a practice of this sort — caused [Roberta]302-roberta to hesitate and to feel that any statement to the effect that [she]302-roberta had heard of or been sent by [any one else]5282-any one else — Clyde to the contrary notwithstanding — might be dangerous . Perhaps [she]302-roberta had better not say that [she]302-roberta had been sent by [any one]4764-any one . [He]434-the husband might resent it as an insult to [his]434-the husband character as [a reputable physician]3699-a reputable physician . "[434-the husband]

[His]434-the husband uncertainty allayed , [he]434-the husband now continued : " In the first place , the thing [you]302-roberta want done is something [my]302-roberta conscience would not permit [me]302-roberta to advise . [I]302-roberta understand , of course , that [you]302-roberta consider it necessary . [You]302-roberta and [[your]302-roberta husband]5823-your husband are both young and [you]302-roberta probably have n't very much money to go on , and [you]302-roberta both feel that an interruption of this kind will be a great strain in every way . And no doubt it will be . Still , as [I]302-roberta see it , marriage is a very sacred thing , and [children]3224-children are a blessing — not a curse . And when [you]302-roberta went to the altar three months ago [you]302-roberta were probably not unaware that [you]302-roberta might have to face just such a situation as this . [All young married people]5833-all young married people are , [I]302-roberta think . "[302-roberta] ( " The altar , "[434-the husband] thought [Roberta]302-roberta sadly . If only it were so . ) " Now [I]302-roberta know that the tendency of the day in some quarters is very much in this direction , [I]302-roberta am sorry to say . There are those who feel it quite all right if [they]5833-all young married people can shirk the normal responsibilities in such cases as to perform these operations , but it 's very dangerous , [Mrs. Howard]401-mrs. howard , very dangerous legally and ethically as well as medically very wrong . [Many women who seek to escape childbirth]5834-many women who seek to escape childbirth die in this way . Besides it is a prison offense for [any doctor]3443-any doctor to assist [them]5834-many women who seek to escape childbirth , whether there are bad consequences or not . [You]302-roberta know that , [I]302-roberta suppose . At any rate , [I]302-roberta , for one , am heartily opposed to this sort of thing from every point of view . The only excuse [I]302-roberta have ever been able to see for it is when the life of [the mother]5836-the mother , for instance , depends upon such an operation . Not otherwise . And in such cases the medical profession is in accord . But in this instance [I]302-roberta 'm sure the situation is n't one which warrants anything like that . [You]302-roberta seem to [me]302-roberta to be [a strong , healthy girl]5837-a strong , healthy girl . Motherhood should hold no serious consequences for [you]302-roberta . [You]302-roberta say [[your]302-roberta husband]5823-your husband is [an electrician]5841-an electrician ? "[302-roberta]

" Yes , "[3700-he] replied [Roberta]302-roberta , nervously , not a little overawed and subdued by [his]3700-he solemn moralizing .

" Well , now , there [you]302-roberta are , "[3700-he] [he]3700-he went on . " That 's not such an unprofitable profession . At least [all electricians]5842-all electricians charge enough . "[3700-he] [he]3700-he paused in order to let the substance of what [he]3700-he was saying sink in—"well , then , [I]3700-he think [you]302-roberta might feel called upon to stop and consider — both [you]302-roberta and [[your]302-roberta husband]5823-your husband . "[302-roberta] [He]3700-he almost beamed cheerfully as , fancying [he]3700-he had captured [Roberta]302-roberta in some purely nervous and feminine economy as well as dread , [he]3700-he decided that if so [he]3700-he could easily extract [her]302-roberta from [her]302-roberta present mood . " Well , then , "[3700-he] [he]3700-he went on , slightly reduced by the fact that [his]3700-he surmise was incorrect , but none the less resolved to dissuade [her]302-roberta and [him]3700-he , too : " [I]302-roberta think [you]302-roberta two should really consider very seriously before [you]302-roberta go further in this matter . "[302-roberta] [He]3700-he ceased , feeling reasonably sure that [he]3700-he had dispelled the fear , as well as the determination that had brought [Roberta]302-roberta to [him]3700-he — that , being [a sensible , ordinary wife]3701-a sensible , ordinary wife , [she]302-roberta would now desist of course — think nothing more of [her]302-roberta plan and leave .

But instead of either acquiescing cheerfully or rising to go , as [he]3700-he thought [she]302-roberta might , [she]302-roberta gave [him]3700-he a wide - eyed terrified look and then as instantly burst into tears . For the total effect of [his]3700-he address had been to first revive more clearly than ever the normal social or conventional aspect of the situation which all along [she]302-roberta was attempting to shut out from [her]302-roberta thoughts and which , under ordinary circumstances , assuming that [she]302-roberta was really married , was exactly the attitude [she]302-roberta would have taken . But now the realization that [her]302-roberta problem was not to be solved at all , by [this man]1044-this man at least , caused [her]302-roberta to be seized with what might best be described as morbid panic .

Suddenly beginning to open and shut [her]302-roberta fingers and at the same time beating [her]302-roberta knees , while [her]302-roberta face contorted itself with pain and terror , [she]302-roberta exclaimed : " But [you]3700-he do n't understand , [doctor]3442-doctor , [you]3700-he do n't understand ! "[402-dr. glenn] [She]3703-she began to rock backward and forward , at the same time swaying from side to side as in a trance .

And [Glenn]402-dr. glenn , surprised and startled by this sudden demonstration as well as emotionally affected , and yet at the same time advised thereby that [his]402-dr. glenn original surmise had been correct , and hence that [Roberta]302-roberta had been lying , as well as that if [he]402-dr. glenn wished to keep [himself]402-dr. glenn out of this [he]402-dr. glenn must now assume a firm and even heartless attitude , asked solemnly : " [You]302-roberta are not married , [you]302-roberta say ? "[402-dr. glenn]

For answer now [Roberta]302-roberta merely shook [her]302-roberta head negatively and continued to cry . "[402-dr. glenn] But fearing to commit [himself]402-dr. glenn in any way , [he]402-dr. glenn merely paused , adding after a time soothingly and dubiously : " [You]302-roberta must n't cry . " Yes . "[3704-his]

" Well , in the first place , "[3704-his] [his]3704-his tone was more comfortable and pleasant than before — [he]3704-his seemed to be snatching at a plausible excuse for extricating [himself]3704-his from a case which promised little other than danger and difficulty , " this may not be as serious as [you]302-roberta think . [He]402-dr. glenn was very grave and felt very righteous as [he]402-dr. glenn said this . "[402-dr. glenn]

[She]302-roberta shook [her]302-roberta head and clenched [her]302-roberta fingers and rocked to and fro while [Glenn]402-dr. glenn , impressed by [her]302-roberta own terrors , the pity of the folly which , as [he]402-dr. glenn saw it , had led [her]302-roberta to this dreadful pass , yet professionally alienated by a type of case that spelled nothing but difficulty for [him]402-dr. glenn stood determinedly before [her]302-roberta and added : " As [I]402-dr. glenn told [you]302-roberta before , [Miss]5861-miss — "[402-dr. glenn] ( [he]402-dr. glenn paused ) " [Howard]401-mrs. howard , if that is [your]401-mrs. howard name , [I]3705-i am seriously opposed to operations of this kind , just as [I]3705-i am to the folly that brings [girls]894-girls and [young men]983-young men to the point where [they]5864-they seem to think [they]5864-they are necessary . [A physician]3559-a physician may not interfere in a case of this kind unless [he]3559-a physician is willing to spend ten years in [prison]5866-prison , and [I]3705-i think that law is fair enough . Not that [I]3705-i do n't realize how painful [your]401-mrs. howard present situation appears to [you]401-mrs. howard . But there are always [those who are willing to help [a girl in [your]401-mrs. howard state]5868-a girl in your state]5867-those who are willing to help a girl in your state , providing [she]5868-a girl in your state does n't wish to do something which is morally and legally wrong . And so the very best advice [I]3705-i can give [you]401-mrs. howard now is that [you]401-mrs. howard do nothing at all now or at any time . Better go [home]4793-home and see [[your]401-mrs. howard parents]5382-your parents and confess . It will be much better — much better , [I]3705-i assure [you]401-mrs. howard . Not nearly as hard as [you]401-mrs. howard think or as wicked as this other way . Do n't forget there is a life there — [a human]5871-a human — if it is really as [you]401-mrs. howard think . A human life which [you]401-mrs. howard are seeking to end and that [I]3705-i can not help [you]401-mrs. howard to do . [I]3705-i really can not . There may be [doctors]5791-doctors — [I]3705-i know there are — men here and there who take [their]5791-doctors professional ethics a little less seriously than [I]3705-i do ; but [I]3705-i can not let [myself]3705-i become one of [them]5791-doctors . [I]3705-i am sorry — very .[3705-i]

" So now the best [I]201-clyde can say is — go [home]4793-home to [[your]401-mrs. howard parents]5382-your parents and tell [them]5382-your parents . It may look hard now but [you]401-mrs. howard are going to feel better about it in the long run . If it will make [you]401-mrs. howard or [them]5382-your parents feel any better about it , let [them]5382-your parents come and talk to [me]201-clyde . [I]201-clyde will try and make [them]5382-your parents see that this is not the worst thing in [the world]4755-the world , either . But as for doing what [you]401-mrs. howard want — [I]201-clyde am very , very sorry , but [I]201-clyde can not . [My]201-clyde conscience will not permit [me]201-clyde . "[201-clyde]

[He]3705-i paused and gazed at [her]3706-her sympathetically , yet with a determined and concluded look in [his]3705-i eye . And [Roberta]302-roberta , dumbfounded by this sudden termination of all [her]302-roberta hopes in connection with [him]3705-i and realizing at last that not only had [she]302-roberta been misled by [Clyde]201-clyde 's information in regard to [this doctor]5798-this doctor , but that [her]302-roberta technical as well as emotional plea had failed , now walked unsteadily to the door , the terrors of the future crowding thick upon [her]302-roberta . And once outside in the dark , after [the doctor]3610-the doctor had most courteously and ruefully closed the door behind [her]302-roberta , [she]302-roberta paused to lean against a tree that was there — [her]302-roberta nervous and physical strength all but failing [her]302-roberta . [He]3705-i had refused to help [her]302-roberta . [He]3705-i had refused to help [her]302-roberta . And now what ?

The first effect of [the doctor]3610-the doctor 's decision was to shock and terrify [them]3710-them both — [Roberta]302-roberta and [Clyde]201-clyde — beyond measure . For apparently now here was illegitimacy and disgrace for [Roberta]302-roberta . Exposure and destruction for [Clyde]201-clyde . And this had been [their]3710-them one solution seemingly . Then , by degrees , for [Clyde]201-clyde at least , there was a slight lifting of the heavy pall . Perhaps , after all , as [the doctor]3610-the doctor had suggested — and once [she]302-roberta had recovered [her]302-roberta senses sufficiently to talk , [she]302-roberta had told [him]3705-i — the end had not been reached . There was the bare possibility , as suggested by [the druggist]3451-the druggist , [Short]398-short and [the doctor]3610-the doctor , that [she]302-roberta might be mistaken . And this , while not producing a happy reaction in [her]302-roberta , had the unsatisfactory result of inducing in [Clyde]201-clyde a lethargy based more than anything else on the ever - haunting fear of inability to cope with this situation as well as the certainty of social exposure in case [he]201-clyde did not which caused [him]201-clyde , instead of struggling all the more desperately , to defer further immediate action . For , such was [his]201-clyde nature that , although [he]201-clyde realized clearly the probably tragic consequences if [he]201-clyde did not act , still it was so hard to think to whom else to apply to without danger to [himself]201-clyde . To think that [the doctor]3610-the doctor had " turned [her]302-roberta down , "[3722-an associate foreman] as [he]201-clyde phrased it , and that [Short]398-short 's advice should have been worth as little as that !

But apart from nervous thoughts as to whom to turn to next , [no particular individual]3715-no particular individual occurred to [him]201-clyde before the two weeks were gone , or after . It was so hard to just ask anywhere . [One]578-one just could n't do it . Besides , of whom could [he]201-clyde ask now ? Of whom ? These things took time , did n't they ? Yet in the meantime , the days going by , both [he]201-clyde and [Roberta]302-roberta had ample time to consider what , if any , steps [they]3717-they must take — the one in regard to the other — in case no medical or surgical solution was found . For [Roberta]302-roberta , while urging and urging , if not so much by words as by expression and mood at [her]302-roberta work , was determined that [she]302-roberta must not be left to fight this out alone — [she]302-roberta could not be . On the other hand , as [she]302-roberta could see , [Clyde]201-clyde did nothing . For apart from what [he]201-clyde had already attempted to do , [he]201-clyde was absolutely at a loss how to proceed . [He]201-clyde had no intimates and in consequence [he]201-clyde could only think of presenting the problem as an imaginary one to [one individual]3718-one individual and another here or there in the hope of extracting some helpful information . At the same time , and as impractical and evasive as it may seem , there was the call of that diverting world of which [Sondra]186-sondra was a part , evenings and Sundays , when , in spite of [Roberta]302-roberta 's wretched state and mood , [he]201-clyde was called to go here and there , and did , because in so doing [he]201-clyde was actually relieving [his]201-clyde own mind of the dread specter of disaster that was almost constantly before it . If only [he]201-clyde could get [her]302-roberta out of this ! If only [he]201-clyde could . But how , without money , intimates , a more familiar understanding of the medical or if not that exactly , then the sub rosa world of sexual free - masonry which some at times — the bell - hops of [the Green - Davidson]35-the green - davidson , for instance , seemed to understand . [He]201-clyde had written to [Ratterer]224-ratterer , of course , but there had been no answer , since [Ratterer]224-ratterer had removed to [Florida]118-florida and as yet [Clyde]201-clyde 's letter had not reached [him]201-clyde . And locally [all those [he]201-clyde knew best]3719-all those he knew best were either connected with [the factory or society]3720-the factory or society — [individuals on the one hand too inexperienced or dangerous]3721-individuals on the one hand too inexperienced or dangerous , or on the other hand , too remote and dangerous , since [he]201-clyde was not sufficiently intimate with any of [them]3719-all those he knew best as yet to command [their]3719-all those he knew best true confidence and secrecy .

At the same time [he]201-clyde must do something — [he]201-clyde could not just rest and drift . Assuredly [Roberta]302-roberta could not long permit [him]201-clyde to do that — faced as [she]302-roberta was by exposure . And so from time to time [he]201-clyde actually racked [himself]201-clyde — seized upon straws and what would have been looked upon by most as forlorn chances . Thus , for instance , [an associate foreman]3722-an associate foreman , chancing to reminisce one day concerning [a certain girl in [his]3722-an associate foreman department who had " gotten in trouble "[2842-such a girl] and had been compelled to leave]3723-a certain girl in his department who had " gotten in trouble " and had been compelled to leave , [he]3722-an associate foreman had been given the opportunity to inquire what [he]3722-an associate foreman thought [such a girl]2842-such a girl did in case [she]2842-such a girl could not afford or did not want to have [a child]3395-a child . But [this particular foreman]3726-this particular foreman , being as uninformed as [himself]3722-an associate foreman , merely observed that [she]2842-such a girl probably had to see [a doctor]3432-a doctor if [she]2842-such a girl knew [one]578-one or " go through with it"—which[2842-such a girl] left [Clyde]201-clyde exactly where [he]201-clyde was . On another occasion , in connection with a conversation in [a barber shop]3729-a barber shop , relating to a local case reported in The Star where [a girl]2278-a girl was suing [a local ne'er - do - well]3731-a local ne'er - do - well for breach of promise , the remark was made that [she]2842-such a girl would " never have sued [that guy]5876-that guy , [you]5877-you bet , unless [she]2842-such a girl had to . "[403-clyde] [Whereupon Clyde]403-clyde seized the opportunity to remark hopefully , " But would n't [you]5877-you think that [she]2842-such a girl could find some way of getting out of trouble without marrying [a fellow [she]2842-such a girl did n't like]5878-a fellow she did n't like ? "[2842-such a girl]

" Well , that 's not so easy as [you]5877-you may think , particularly around here , "[2842-such a girl] elucidated the wiseacre who was trimming [his]201-clyde hair . " In the first place it 's agin ' the law . And next it takes a lotta money . An ' in case [you]5877-you ai n't got it , well , money makes [the mare]5879-the mare go , [you]5877-you know . "[302-roberta] [He]201-clyde snip - snipped with [his]201-clyde scissors while [Clyde]403-clyde , confronted by [his]403-clyde own problem , meditated on how true it was . If [he]403-clyde had a lot of money — even a few hundred dollars — [he]403-clyde might take it now and possibly persuade [her]2842-such a girl — who could tell — to go somewhere by [herself]2842-such a girl and have an operation performed .

Yet each day , as on the one before , [he]403-clyde was saying to [himself]403-clyde that [he]403-clyde must find some one . And [Roberta]302-roberta was saying to [herself]302-roberta that [she]302-roberta too must act — must not really depend on [Clyde]403-clyde any longer if [he]403-clyde were going to act so . [One]578-one could not trifle or compromise with a terror of this kind . It was a cruel imposition on [her]302-roberta . It must be that [Clyde]403-clyde did not realize how terribly this affected [her]302-roberta and even [him]403-clyde . For certainly , if [he]403-clyde were not going to help [her]302-roberta out of it , as [he]403-clyde had distinctly said [he]403-clyde would do at first , then decidedly [she]302-roberta could not be expected to weather the subsequent storm alone . Never , never , never ! For , after all , as [Roberta]302-roberta saw it , [Clyde]403-clyde was [a man]4740-a man — [he]403-clyde had a good position — it was not [he]403-clyde , but [she]302-roberta , who was in this treacherous position and unable to extricate [herself]302-roberta alone .

And beginning with the second day after the second period , when [she]302-roberta discovered for once and all that [her]302-roberta worst suspicions were true , [she]302-roberta not only emphasized the fact in every way that [she]302-roberta could that [she]302-roberta was distressed beyond all words , but on the third day announced to [him]403-clyde in a note that [she]302-roberta was again going to see [the doctor]3610-the doctor near [Gloversville]52-gloversville that evening , regardless of [his]403-clyde previous refusal — so great was [her]302-roberta need — and also asking [Clyde]403-clyde whether [he]403-clyde would accompany [her]302-roberta — a request which , since [he]403-clyde had not succeeded in doing anything , and although [he]403-clyde had an engagement with [Sondra]186-sondra , [he]403-clyde instantly acceded to — feeling it to be of greater importance than anything else . [He]403-clyde must excuse [himself]403-clyde to [Sondra]186-sondra on the ground of work .

And accordingly this second trip was made , a long and nervous conversation between [himself]403-clyde and [Roberta]302-roberta on the way resulting in nothing more than some explanations as to why thus far [he]403-clyde had not been able to achieve anything , plus certain encomiums addressed to [her]302-roberta concerning [her]302-roberta courage in acting for [herself]302-roberta in this way .

Yet [the doctor]3610-the doctor again would not and did not act . After waiting nearly an hour for [his]403-clyde return from somewhere , [she]302-roberta was merely permitted to tell [him]403-clyde of [her]302-roberta unchanged state and [her]302-roberta destroying fears in regard to [herself]302-roberta , but with no hint from [him]403-clyde that [he]403-clyde could be induced to act as indeed [he]403-clyde could act . It was against [his]403-clyde prejudices and ethics .

And so once more [Roberta]302-roberta returned , this time not crying , actually too sad to cry , choked with the weight of [her]302-roberta impending danger and the anticipatory fears and miseries that attended it .

And [Clyde]403-clyde , hearing of this defeat , was at last reduced to a nervous , gloomy silence , absolutely devoid of a helpful suggestion . [He]403-clyde could not think what to say and was chiefly fearful lest [Roberta]302-roberta now make some demand with which socially or economically [he]403-clyde could not comply . However , in regard to this [she]302-roberta said little on the way [home]4793-home . Instead [she]302-roberta sat and stared out of the window — thinking of [her]302-roberta defenseless predicament that was becoming more real and terrible to [her]302-roberta hourly . By way of excuse [she]302-roberta pleaded that [she]302-roberta had a headache . [She]302-roberta wanted to be alone — only to think more — to try to work out a solution . [She]302-roberta must work out some way . That [she]302-roberta knew . But what ? How ? What could [she]302-roberta do ? How could [she]302-roberta possibly escape ? [She]302-roberta felt like a cornered animal fighting for its life with all odds against it , and [she]302-roberta thought of a thousand remote and entirely impossible avenues of escape , only to return to the one and only safe and sound solution that [she]302-roberta really felt should be possible — and that was marriage . And why not ? Had n't [she]302-roberta given [him]403-clyde all , and that against [her]302-roberta better judgment ? Had n't [he]403-clyde overpersuaded [her]302-roberta ? Who was [he]403-clyde anyway to so cast [her]302-roberta aside ? For decidedly at times , and especially since this latest crisis had developed , [his]403-clyde manner , because of [Sondra]186-sondra and [the Griffiths]201-clyde and what [he]403-clyde felt to be the fatal effect of all this on [his]403-clyde dreams here , was sufficient to make plain that love was decidedly dead , and that [he]403-clyde was not thinking nearly so much of the meaning of [her]302-roberta state to [her]302-roberta , as [he]403-clyde was of its import to [him]403-clyde , the injury that was most certain to accrue to [him]403-clyde . And when this did not completely terrify [her]302-roberta , as mostly it did , it served to irritate and slowly develop the conclusion that in such a desperate state as this , [she]302-roberta was justified in asking more than ordinarily [she]302-roberta would have dreamed of asking , marriage itself , since there was no other door . And why not ? Was n't [her]302-roberta life as good as [his]403-clyde ? And had n't [he]403-clyde joined [his]403-clyde to [hers]302-roberta , voluntarily ? Then , why should n't [he]403-clyde strive to help [her]302-roberta now — or , failing that , make this final sacrifice which was the only one by which [she]302-roberta could be rescued apparently . For who were [all the society people with whom [he]403-clyde was concerned anyhow]3737-all the society people with whom he was concerned anyhow ? And why should [he]403-clyde ask [her]302-roberta in such a crisis to sacrifice [herself]302-roberta , [her]302-roberta future and good name , just because of [his]403-clyde interest in [them]3738-them ? [They]3738-them had never done anything very much for [him]403-clyde , certainly not as much as had [she]302-roberta . And , just because [he]403-clyde was wearying now , after persuading [her]302-roberta to do [his]403-clyde bidding — was that any reason why now , in this crisis , [he]403-clyde should be permitted to desert [her]302-roberta ? After all , would n't [all of [these society people in whom [he]403-clyde was so much interested]3740-these society people in whom he was so much interested feel that whatever [his]403-clyde relationship to [them]3740-these society people in whom he was so much interested , [she]302-roberta would be justified in taking the course which [she]302-roberta might be compelled to take]3739-all of these society people in whom he was so much interested feel that whatever his relationship to them , she would be justified in taking the course which she might be compelled to take ?

[She]302-roberta brooded on this much , more especially on the return from this second attempt to induce [Dr. Glenn]402-dr. glenn to help [her]302-roberta . In fact , at moments , [her]302-roberta face took on a defiant , determined look which was seemingly new to [her]302-roberta , but which only developed suddenly under such pressure . [Her]302-roberta jaw became a trifle set . [She]302-roberta had made a decision . [He]403-clyde would have to marry [her]302-roberta . [She]302-roberta must make [him]403-clyde if there were no other way out of this . [She]302-roberta must — [she]302-roberta must . Think of [[her]302-roberta home]1450-her home , [[her]302-roberta mother]447-her mother , [Grace Marr]310-grace , [the Newtons]313-the newtons , all who knew [her]302-roberta in fact — the terror and pain and shame with which this would sear [all those in any way identified with [her]302-roberta]3743-all those in any way identified with her — [[her]302-roberta father]510-her father , [brothers]1544-brothers , [sisters]1025-sisters . Impossible ! Impossible ! It must not and could not be ! Impossible . It might seem a little severe to [her]302-roberta , even now , to have to insist on this , considering all the emphasis [Clyde]201-clyde had hitherto laid upon [his]201-clyde prospects here . But how , how else was [she]302-roberta to do ?

Accordingly the next day , and not a little to [his]201-clyde surprise , since for so many hours the night before [they]3747-they had been together , [Clyde]201-clyde received another note telling [him]201-clyde that [he]201-clyde must come again that night . [She]302-roberta had something to say to [him]201-clyde , and there was something in the tone of the note that seemed to indicate or suggest a kind of defiance of a refusal of any kind , hitherto absent in any of [her]302-roberta communications to [him]201-clyde . And at once the thought that this situation , unless cleared away , was certain to prove disastrous , so weighed upon [him]201-clyde that [he]201-clyde could not but put the best face possible on it and consent to go and hear what it was that [she]302-roberta had to offer in the way of a solution — or — on the other hand , of what [she]302-roberta had to complain .

Going to [[her]302-roberta room]4766-her room at a late hour , [he]201-clyde found [her]302-roberta in what seemed to [him]201-clyde a more composed frame of mind than at any time since this difficulty had appeared , a state which surprised [him]201-clyde a little , since [he]201-clyde had expected to find [her]302-roberta in tears . But now , if anything , [she]302-roberta appeared more complacent , [her]302-roberta nervous thoughts as to how to bring about a satisfactory conclusion for [herself]302-roberta having called into play a native shrewdness which was now seeking to exercise itself .

And so directly before announcing what was in [her]302-roberta mind , [she]302-roberta began by asking : " [You]201-clyde have n't found out about [another doctor]5880-another doctor , have [you]201-clyde , [Clyde]201-clyde , or thought of anything ? "[201-clyde]

" No , [I]201-clyde have n't , [Roberta]302-roberta , "[201-clyde] [he]201-clyde replied most dismally and wearisomely , [his]201-clyde own mental tether - length having been strained to the breaking point . " [I]201-clyde 've been trying to , as [you]201-clyde know , but it 's so darn hard to find [any one who is n't afraid to monkey with a case like this]5881-any one who is n't afraid to monkey with a case like this . Honest , to tell the truth , [Roberta]302-roberta , [I]201-clyde 'm about stumped . [I]201-clyde do n't know what [we]5882-we are going to do unless [you]302-roberta can think of something . [You]302-roberta have n't thought or heard of [any one else [you]302-roberta could go to]5883-any one else you could go to , have [you]302-roberta ? "[201-clyde] For , during the conversation that had immediately followed [her]3749-she first visit to [the doctor]3610-the doctor , [he]201-clyde had hinted to [her]3749-she that by striking up a fairly intimate relationship with [one of [the foreign family girls]3752-the foreign family girls]3751-one of the foreign family girls , [she]3749-she might by degrees extract some information there which would be of use to [both]874-both . But [Roberta]302-roberta was not of a temperament that permitted of any such facile friendships , and nothing had come of it .

However , [his]201-clyde stating that [he]201-clyde was " stumped "[3749-she] now gave [her]3749-she the opportunity [she]3749-she was really desiring , to present the proposition which [she]3749-she felt to be unavoidable and not longer to be delayed . Yet being fearful of how [Clyde]201-clyde would react , [she]3749-she hesitated as to the form in which [she]3749-she would present it , and , after shaking [her]3749-she head and manifesting a nervousness which was real enough , [she]3749-she finally said : " Well , [I]201-clyde 'll tell [you]201-clyde , [Clyde]201-clyde . [I]201-clyde 've been thinking about it and [I]201-clyde do n't see any way out of it unless — unless [you]201-clyde , well , marry [me]201-clyde . It 's two months now , [you]201-clyde know , and unless [we]5884-we get married right away , everybody'll know , wo n't [they]5885-they ? "[201-clyde]

[Her]3749-she manner as [she]3749-she said this was a mixture of outward courage born out of [her]3749-she conviction that [she]3749-she was in the right and an inward uncertainty about [Clyde]201-clyde 's attitude , which was all the more fused by a sudden look of surprise , resentment , uncertainty and fear that now transformation - wise played over [his]201-clyde countenance ; a variation and play which , if it indicated anything definite , indicated that [she]3749-she was seeking to inflict an unwarranted injury on [him]201-clyde . For since [he]201-clyde had been drawing closer and closer to [Sondra]186-sondra , [his]201-clyde hopes had heightened so intensely that , hearkening to this demand on the part of [Roberta]302-roberta now , [his]201-clyde brow wrinkled and [his]201-clyde manner changed from one of comparatively affable , if nervous , consideration to that of mingled fear , opposition as well as determination to evade drastic consequence . For this would spell complete ruin for [him]201-clyde , the loss of [Sondra]186-sondra , [his]201-clyde job , [his]201-clyde social hopes and ambitions in connection with the Griffiths — all — a thought which sickened and at the same time caused [him]201-clyde to hesitate about how to proceed . But [he]201-clyde would not ! [he]201-clyde would not ! [He]201-clyde would not do this ! Never ! Never ! ! Never ! ! !

Yet after a moment [he]201-clyde exclaimed equivocally : " Well , gee , that 's all right , too , [Roberta]302-roberta , for [you]302-roberta , because that fixes everything without any trouble at all . But what about [me]201-clyde ? [You]302-roberta do n't want to forget that that is n't going to be easy for [me]201-clyde , the way things are now . [You]302-roberta know [I]201-clyde have n't any money . All [I]201-clyde have is [my]201-clyde job . And besides , [the family]433-the family do n't know anything about [you]302-roberta yet — not a thing . And if it should suddenly come out now that [we]5887-we 've been going together all this time , and that this has happened , and that [I]201-clyde was going to have to get married right away , well , gee , [they]433-the family 'll know [I]201-clyde 've been fooling ['em]5888-'em and [they]433-the family 're sure to get sore . And then what ? [They]433-the family might even fire [me]201-clyde . "[201-clyde]

[He]201-clyde paused to see what effect this explanation would have , but noting the somewhat dubious expression which of late characterized [Roberta]302-roberta 's face whenever [he]201-clyde began excusing [himself]201-clyde , [he]201-clyde added hopefully and evasively , seeking by any trick that [he]201-clyde could to delay this sudden issue : " Besides , [I]201-clyde 'm not so sure that [I]201-clyde ca n't find [a doctor]3432-a doctor yet , either . [I]201-clyde have n't had much luck so far , but that 's not saying that [I]201-clyde wo n't . And there 's a little time yet , is n't there ? Sure there is . It 's all right up to three months anyway . "[201-clyde] ( [He]201-clyde had since had a letter from [Ratterer]224-ratterer who had commented on this fact . ) " And [I]302-roberta did hear something the other day of [a doctor over in [Albany]4-albany who might do it]5890-a doctor over in albany who might do it . Anyway , [I]302-roberta thought [I]302-roberta 'd go over and see before [I]302-roberta said anything about [him]5890-a doctor over in albany who might do it . "[302-roberta]

[His]201-clyde manner , when [he]201-clyde said this , was so equivocal that [Roberta]302-roberta could tell [he]201-clyde was merely lying to gain time . There was [no doctor]5753-no doctor in [Albany]4-albany . Besides it was so plain that [he]201-clyde resented [her]302-roberta suggestion and was only thinking of some way of escaping it . And [she]302-roberta knew well enough that at no time had [he]201-clyde said directly that [he]201-clyde would marry [her]302-roberta . And while [she]302-roberta might urge , in the last analysis [she]302-roberta could not force [him]201-clyde to do anything . [He]201-clyde might just go away alone , as [he]201-clyde had once said in connection with inadvertently losing [his]201-clyde job because of [her]302-roberta . And how much greater might not [his]201-clyde impulse in that direction now be , if [this world here in which [he]201-clyde was so much interested]3755-this world here in which he was so much interested were taken away from [him]201-clyde , and [he]201-clyde were to face the necessity of taking [her]302-roberta and [a child]3395-a child , too . It made [her]302-roberta more cautious and caused [her]302-roberta to modify [her]302-roberta first impulse to speak out definitely and forcefully , however great [her]302-roberta necessity might be . And so disturbed was [he]201-clyde by the panorama of the bright world of which [Sondra]186-sondra was the center and which was now at stake , that [he]201-clyde could scarcely think clearly . Should [he]201-clyde lose all this for such a world as [he]201-clyde and [Roberta]302-roberta could provide for [themselves]3757-themselves — [a small home]2063-a small home — [a baby]2313-a baby , such a routine work - a - day life as taking care of [her]302-roberta and [a baby]2313-a baby on such a salary as [he]201-clyde could earn , and from which most likely [he]201-clyde would never again be freed ! God ! A sense of nausea seized [him]201-clyde . [He]201-clyde could not and would not do this . And yet , as [he]201-clyde now saw , all [his]201-clyde dreams could be so easily tumbled about [his]201-clyde ears by [her]302-roberta and because of one false step on [his]201-clyde part . It made [him]201-clyde cautious and for the first time in [his]201-clyde life caused tact and cunning to visualize itself as a profound necessity .

And at the same time , [Clyde]201-clyde was sensing inwardly and somewhat shamefacedly all of this profound change in [himself]201-clyde .

But [Roberta]302-roberta was saying : " Oh , [I]3762-she know , [Clyde]201-clyde , but [you]201-clyde [yourself]201-clyde said just now that [you]201-clyde were stumped , did n't [you]201-clyde ? And every day that goes by just makes it so much the worse for [me]3762-she , if [we]5891-we 're not going to be able to get [a doctor]3432-a doctor . [You]201-clyde ca n't get married and have [a child born within a few months]5893-a child born within a few months — [you]201-clyde know that . [Every one in [the world]4755-the world]5894-every one in the world would know . Besides [I]3762-she have [myself]3762-she to consider as well as [you]201-clyde , [you]201-clyde know . And [the baby]5896-the baby , too . "[3762-she] ( At the mere mention of [a coming child]3761-a coming child [Clyde]201-clyde winced and recoiled as though [he]201-clyde had been slapped . [She]3762-she noted it . ) " [I]3762-she just must do one of two things right away , [Clyde]201-clyde — get married or get out of this and [you]201-clyde do n't seem to be able to get [me]3762-she out of it , do [you]201-clyde ? If [you]201-clyde 're so afraid of what [[your]201-clyde uncle]4868-your uncle might think or do in case [we]5898-we get married , "[3762-she] [she]3762-she added nervously and yet suavely , " why could n't [we]5898-we get married right away and then keep it a secret for a while — as long as [we]5898-we could , or as long as [you]201-clyde thought [we]5898-we ought to , "[3762-she] [she]3762-she added shrewdly . " Meanwhile [I]3762-she could go [home]4793-home and tell [[my]3762-she parents]5376-my parents about it — that [I]3762-she am married , but that it must be kept a secret for a while . Then when the time came , when things got so bad that [we]5898-we could n't stay [here]4728-here any longer without telling , why [we]5898-we could either go away somewhere , if [we]5898-we wanted to — that is , if [you]201-clyde did n't want [[your]201-clyde uncle]4868-your uncle to know , or [we]5898-we could just announce that [we]5898-we were married some time ago . [Lots of young couples]5903-lots of young couples do that nowadays . And as for getting along , "[3762-she] [she]3762-she went on , noting a sudden dour shadow that passed over [Clyde]201-clyde 's face like a cloud , " why [we]5898-we could always find something to do — [I]3764-he know [I]3764-he could , anyhow , once [the baby]5896-the baby is born . "[3764-he]

When first [she]3762-she began to speak , [Clyde]201-clyde had seated [himself]201-clyde on the edge of the bed , listening nervously and dubiously to all [she]3762-she had to offer . However , when [she]3762-she came to that part which related to marriage and going away , [he]201-clyde got up — an irresistible impulse to move overcoming [him]201-clyde . And when [she]3762-she concluded with the commonplace suggestion of going to work as soon as [the baby]5896-the baby was born , [he]201-clyde looked at [her]3762-she with little less than panic in [his]201-clyde eyes . To think of marrying and being in a position where it would be necessary to do that , when with a little luck and without interference from [her]3762-she , [he]201-clyde might marry [Sondra]186-sondra .

" Oh , yes , that 's all right for [you]3762-she , [Roberta]302-roberta . That fixes everything up for [you]3762-she , but how about [me]302-roberta ? Why , gee whiz , [I]302-roberta 've only got started [here]4728-here now as it is , and if [I]302-roberta have to pack up and get out , and [I]302-roberta would have to , if ever [they]5906-they found out about this , why [I]302-roberta do n't know what [I]302-roberta 'd do . [I]302-roberta have n't any business or trade that [I]302-roberta could turn [my]302-roberta hand to . It might go hard with [both of [us]5759-both of us]5759-both of us . Besides [[my]302-roberta uncle]4905-my uncle gave [me]302-roberta this chance because [I]302-roberta begged [him]4905-my uncle to , and if [I]302-roberta walked off now [he]4905-my uncle never would do anything for [me]302-roberta . "[302-roberta]

In [his]3764-he excitement [he]3764-he was forgetting that at one time and another in the past [he]3764-he had indicated to [Roberta]302-roberta that the state of [[his]3764-he own parents]1122-his own parents was not wholly unprosperous and that if things did not go just to [his]3764-he liking here , [he]3764-he could return [west]3766-west and perhaps find something to do out there . And it was some general recollection of this that now caused [her]302-roberta to ask : " Could n't [we]5909-we go out to [Denver]20-denver or something like that ? Would n't [[your]201-clyde father]4720-your father be willing to help [you]201-clyde get something for a time , anyhow ? "[201-clyde]

[Her]302-roberta tone was very soft and pleading , an attempt to make [Clyde]201-clyde feel that things could not be as bad as [he]3764-he was imagining . But the mere mention of [[his]201-clyde father]539-his father in connection with all this — the assumption that [he]3764-he , of [all people]3768-all people , might prove an escape from drudgery for [[them]1122-his own parents both]3769-them both , was a little too much . It showed how dreadfully incomplete was [her]302-roberta understanding of [his]201-clyde true position in [this world]1288-this world . Worse , [she]302-roberta was looking for help from that quarter . And , not finding it , later might possibly reproach [him]201-clyde for that — who could tell — for [his]201-clyde lies in connection with it . It made so very clear now the necessity for frustrating , if possible , and that at once , any tendency toward this idea of marriage . It could not be — ever .

And yet how was [he]201-clyde to oppose this idea with safety , since [she]302-roberta felt that [she]302-roberta had this claim on [him]201-clyde — how say to [her]302-roberta openly and coldly that [he]201-clyde could not and would not marry [her]302-roberta ? And unless [he]201-clyde did so now [she]302-roberta might think it would be fair and legitimate enough for [her]302-roberta to compel [him]201-clyde to do so . [She]302-roberta might even feel privileged to go to [[his]201-clyde uncle]692-his uncle — [[his]201-clyde cousin]622-his cousin ( [he]692-his uncle could see [Gilbert]200-gilbert 's cold eyes ) and expose [him]201-clyde ! And then destruction ! Ruin ! The end of all [his]201-clyde dreams in connection with [Sondra]186-sondra and everything else here . But all [he]201-clyde could think of saying now was : " But [I]201-clyde ca n't do this , [Roberta]302-roberta , not now , anyway , "[201-clyde] a remark which at once caused [Roberta]302-roberta to assume that the idea of marriage , as [she]302-roberta had interjected it here , was not one which , under the circumstances , [he]201-clyde had the courage to oppose — [his]201-clyde saying , " not now , anyway . "[201-clyde] Yet even as [she]302-roberta was thinking this , [he]201-clyde went swiftly on with : " Besides [I]302-roberta do n't want to get married so soon . It means too much to [me]302-roberta at this time . In the first place [I]302-roberta 'm not old enough and [I]302-roberta have n't got anything to get married on . And [I]302-roberta ca n't leave here . [I]302-roberta could n't do half as well anywhere else . [You]302-roberta do n't realize what this chance means to [me]302-roberta . [[My]302-roberta father]4874-my father 's all right , but [he]4874-my father could n't do what [[my]302-roberta uncle]4905-my uncle could and [he]4874-my father would n't . [You]302-roberta do n't know or [you]302-roberta would n't ask [me]302-roberta to do this . "[302-roberta]

[He]201-clyde paused , [his]201-clyde face a picture of puzzled fear and opposition . [He]201-clyde was not unlike [a harried animal , deftly pursued by hunter and hound]3773-a harried animal , deftly pursued by hunter and hound . But [Roberta]302-roberta , imagining that [his]201-clyde total defection had been caused by the social side of [Lycurgus]1-lycurgus as opposed to [her]302-roberta own low state and not because of the superior lure of [any particular girl]3774-any particular girl , now retorted resentfully , although [she]302-roberta desired not to appear so : " Oh , yes , [I]302-roberta know well enough why [you]201-clyde ca n't leave . It is n't [your]201-clyde position here , though , half as much as it is [those society people [you]201-clyde are always running around with]5913-those society people you are always running around with . [I]302-roberta know . [You]201-clyde do n't care for [me]302-roberta any more , [Clyde]201-clyde , that 's it , and [you]201-clyde do n't want to give [these other people]5914-these other people up for [me]302-roberta . [I]302-roberta know that 's it and nothing else . But just the same it was n't so very long ago that [you]201-clyde did , although [you]201-clyde do n't seem to remember it now . "[302-roberta] [Her]302-roberta cheeks burned and [her]302-roberta eyes flamed as [she]302-roberta said this . [She]302-roberta paused a moment while [he]3775-you gazed at [her]302-roberta wondering about the outcome of all this . " But [you]3775-you ca n't leave [me]302-roberta to make out any way [I]302-roberta can , just the same , because [I]302-roberta wo n't be left this way , [Clyde]201-clyde . [I]302-roberta ca n't ! [I]302-roberta ca n't ! [I]302-roberta tell [you]3775-you . "[302-roberta] [She]302-roberta grew tense and staccato , " It means too much to [me]302-roberta . [I]302-roberta do n't know how to do alone and [I]302-roberta , besides , have [no one]4713-no one to turn to but [you]3775-you and [you]3775-you must help [me]302-roberta . [I]302-roberta 've got to get out of this , that 's all , [Clyde]201-clyde , [I]302-roberta 've got to . [I]302-roberta 'm not going to be left to face [[my]302-roberta people]5916-my people and [everybody]1330-everybody without any help or marriage or anything . "[302-roberta] As [she]302-roberta said this , [her]302-roberta eyes turned appealingly and yet savagely toward [him]3776-him and [she]302-roberta emphasized it all with [her]302-roberta hands , which [she]302-roberta clinched and unclinched in a dramatic way . " And if [you]3775-you ca n't help [me]302-roberta out in the way [you]3775-you thought , "[302-roberta] [she]302-roberta went on most agonizedly as [Clyde]201-clyde could see , " then [you]3775-you 've got to help [me]302-roberta out in this other , that 's all . At least until [I]302-roberta can do for [myself]302-roberta [I]302-roberta just wo n't be left . [I]302-roberta do n't ask [you]3775-you to marry [me]302-roberta forever , "[302-roberta] [she]302-roberta now added , the thought that if by presenting this demand in some modified form , [she]302-roberta could induce [Clyde]201-clyde to marry [her]302-roberta , it might be possible afterwards that [his]201-clyde feeling toward [her]302-roberta would change to a much more kindly one . " [You]3775-you can leave [me]302-roberta after a while if [you]3775-you want to . After [I]302-roberta 'm out of this . [I]302-roberta ca n't prevent [you]3775-you from doing that and [I]302-roberta would n't want to if [I]302-roberta could . But [you]3775-you ca n't leave [me]302-roberta now . [You]3775-you ca n't . [You]3775-you ca n't ! Besides , "[302-roberta] [she]302-roberta added , " [I]302-roberta did n't want to get [myself]302-roberta in this position and [I]302-roberta would n't have , but for [you]3775-you . But [you]3775-you made [me]302-roberta and made [me]302-roberta let [you]3775-you come in here . And now [you]3775-you want to leave [me]302-roberta to shift for [myself]302-roberta , just because [you]3775-you think [you]3775-you wo n't be able to go in society any more , if [they]5918-they find out about [me]302-roberta . "[302-roberta]

[She]302-roberta paused , the strain of this contest proving almost too much for [her]302-roberta tired nerves . At the same time [she]302-roberta began to sob nervously and yet not violently — a marked effort at self - restraint and recovery marking [her]302-roberta every gesture . And after a moment or two in which [both]874-both stood there , [he]3778-he gazing dumbly and wondering what else [he]3778-he was to say in answer to all this , [she]302-roberta struggling and finally managing to recover [her]302-roberta poise , [she]302-roberta added : " Oh , what is it about [me]201-clyde that 's so different to what [I]201-clyde was a couple of months ago , [Clyde]201-clyde ? Will [you]201-clyde tell [me]201-clyde that ? [I]201-clyde 'd like to know . What is it that has caused [you]201-clyde to change so ? Up to Christmas , almost , [you]3775-you were as nice to [me]201-clyde as [any human being]5919-any human being could be . [You]3775-you were with [me]201-clyde nearly all the time [you]3775-you had , and since then [I]201-clyde 've scarcely had an evening that [I]201-clyde did n't beg for . Who is it ? What is it ? [Some other girl]5920-some other girl , or what , [I]201-clyde 'd like to know — that [Sondra Finchley]186-sondra or [Bertine Cranston]197-bertine , or who ? "[201-clyde]

[Her]302-roberta eyes as [she]302-roberta said this were a study . For even to this hour , as [Clyde]201-clyde could now see to [his]201-clyde satisfaction , since [he]201-clyde feared the effect on [Roberta]302-roberta of definite and absolute knowledge concerning [Sondra]186-sondra , [she]302-roberta had no specific suspicion , let alone positive knowledge concerning [any girl]2440-any girl . And coward - wise , in the face of [her]302-roberta present predicament and [her]302-roberta assumed and threatened claims on [him]201-clyde , [he]201-clyde was afraid to say what or who the real cause of this change was . Instead [he]201-clyde merely replied and almost unmoved by [her]302-roberta sorrow , since [he]201-clyde no longer really cared for [her]302-roberta : " Oh , [you]302-roberta 're all wrong , [Roberta]302-roberta . [You]302-roberta do n't see what the trouble is . It 's [my]201-clyde future here — if [I]201-clyde leave [here]4728-here [I]201-clyde certainly will never find such an opportunity . And if [I]201-clyde have to marry in this way or leave here it will all go flooey . [I]201-clyde want to wait and get some place first before [I]201-clyde marry , see — save some money and if [I]201-clyde do this [I]201-clyde wo n't have a chance and [you]302-roberta wo n't either , "[201-clyde] [he]201-clyde added feebly , forgetting for the moment that up to this time [he]201-clyde had been indicating rather clearly that [he]201-clyde did not want to have anything more to do with [her]302-roberta in any way .

" Besides , "[201-clyde] [he]201-clyde continued , " if [you]302-roberta could only find [some one]4723-some one , or if [you]302-roberta would go away by [yourself]302-roberta somewhere for a while , [Roberta]302-roberta , and go through with this alone , [I]302-roberta could send [you]302-roberta the money to do it on , [I]302-roberta know . [I]302-roberta could have it between now and the time [you]302-roberta had to go . "[302-roberta]

[His]201-clyde face , as [he]201-clyde said this , and as [Roberta]302-roberta clearly saw , mirrored the complete and resourceless collapse of all [his]201-clyde recent plans in regard to [her]302-roberta . And [she]302-roberta , realizing that [his]201-clyde indifference to [her]302-roberta had reached the point where [he]201-clyde could thus dispose of [her]302-roberta and [[their]3780-their prospective baby]3781-their prospective baby in this casual and really heartless manner , was not only angered in part , but at the same time frightened by the meaning of it all .

" Oh , [Clyde]201-clyde , "[3782-me] [she]302-roberta now exclaimed boldly and with more courage and defiance than at any time since [she]302-roberta had known [him]201-clyde , " how [you]201-clyde have changed ! And how hard [you]201-clyde can be . To want [me]3782-me to go off all by [myself]3782-me and just to save [you]201-clyde — so [you]201-clyde can stay here and get along and marry [some one here]5923-some one here when [I]3782-me am out of the way and [you]201-clyde do n't have to bother about [me]3782-me any more . Well , [I]3782-me wo n't do it . It 's not fair . And [I]3782-me wo n't , that 's all . [I]3782-me wo n't . And that 's all there is to it . [You]201-clyde can get [some one]4723-some one to get [me]3782-me out of this or [you]201-clyde can marry [me]3782-me and come away with [me]3782-me , at least long enough for [me]3782-me to have [the baby]5896-the baby and place [myself]3782-me right before [[my]3782-me people]5916-my people and [every one else that knows [me]3782-me]5927-every one else that knows me . [I]3782-me do n't care if [you]201-clyde leave [me]3782-me afterwards , because [I]3782-me see now that [you]201-clyde really do n't care for [me]3782-me any more , and if that 's the way [you]201-clyde feel , [I]3782-me do n't want [you]201-clyde any more than [you]201-clyde want [me]3782-me . But just the same , [you]201-clyde must help [me]3782-me now — [you]201-clyde must . But , oh , [dear]5356-dear , "[3782-me] [she]3782-me began whimpering again , and yet only slightly and bitterly . " To think that all [our]5929-our love for each other should have come to this — that [I]302-roberta am asked to go away by [myself]302-roberta — all alone — with [no one]4713-no one — while [you]201-clyde stay here , oh , dear ! oh , [dear]5356-dear ! And with [a baby]2313-a baby on [my]302-roberta hands afterwards . And [no husband]5933-no husband . "[302-roberta]

[She]3782-me clinched [her]3782-me hands and shook [her]3782-me head bleakly . [Clyde]201-clyde , realizing well enough that [his]201-clyde proposition certainly was cold and indifferent but , in the face of [his]201-clyde intense desire for [Sondra]186-sondra , the best or at least safest that [he]201-clyde could devise , now stood there unable for the moment to think of anything more to say .

And although there was some other discussion to the same effect , the conclusion of this very difficult hour was that [Clyde]201-clyde had another week or two at best in which to see if [he]201-clyde could find [a physician]3559-a physician or [any one who would assist [him]201-clyde]3784-any one who would assist him . After that — well after that the implied , if not openly expressed , threat which lay at the bottom of this was , unless so extricated and speedily , that [he]201-clyde would have to marry [her]3782-me , if not permanently , then at least temporarily , but legally just the same , until once again [she]3782-me was able to look after [herself]3782-me — a threat which was as crushing and humiliating to [Roberta]302-roberta as it was torturing to [him]201-clyde .

Opposing views such as these , especially where no real skill to meet such a situation existed , could only spell greater difficulty and even eventual disaster unless chance in some form should aid . And chance did not aid . And the presence of [Roberta]302-roberta in [the factory]440-the factory was something that would not permit [him]201-clyde to dismiss it from [his]201-clyde mind . If only [he]201-clyde could persuade [her]302-roberta to leave and go somewhere else to live and work so that [he]201-clyde should not always see [her]302-roberta , [he]201-clyde might then think more calmly . For with [her]302-roberta asking continuously , by [her]302-roberta presence if no more , what [he]201-clyde intended to do , it was impossible for [him]201-clyde to think . And the fact that [he]201-clyde no longer cared for [her]302-roberta as [he]201-clyde had , tended to reduce [his]201-clyde normal consideration of what was [her]302-roberta due . [He]201-clyde was too infatuated with , and hence disarranged by [his]201-clyde thoughts of [Sondra]186-sondra .

For in the very teeth of this grave dilemma [he]201-clyde continued to pursue the enticing dream in connection with [Sondra]186-sondra — the dark situation in connection with [Roberta]302-roberta seeming no more at moments than a dark cloud which shadowed this other . And hence nightly , or as often as the exigencies of [his]201-clyde still unbroken connection with [Roberta]302-roberta would permit , [he]201-clyde was availing [himself]201-clyde of such opportunities as [his]201-clyde flourishing connections now afforded . Now , and to [his]201-clyde great pride and satisfaction , it was a dinner at [the Harriets]196-the harriets ' or [Taylors]194-the taylors ' to which [he]201-clyde was invited ; or a party at [the Finchleys ']184-the finchleys or [the Cranstons]195-the cranstons ' , to which [he]201-clyde would either escort [Sondra]186-sondra or be animated by the hope of encountering [her]302-roberta . And now , also without so many of the former phases or attempts at subterfuge , which had previously characterized [her]302-roberta curiosity in regard to [him]201-clyde , [she]302-roberta was at times openly seeking [him]201-clyde out and making opportunities for social contact . And , of course , these contacts being identical with this typical kind of group gathering , they seemed to have no special significance with [the more conservative elders]3786-the more conservative elders .

For although [Mrs. Finchley]404-mrs. finchley , who was of an especially shrewd and discerning turn socially , had at first been dubious over the attentions being showered upon [Clyde]201-clyde by [[her]404-mrs. finchley daughter]488-her daughter and [others]561-others , still observing that [Clyde]201-clyde was more and more being entertained , not only in [[her]404-mrs. finchley own home]2685-her own home by [the group of which [[her]404-mrs. finchley daughter]488-her daughter was a part , but elsewhere , everywhere]3790-the group of which her daughter was a part , but elsewhere , everywhere , was at last inclined to imagine that [he]201-clyde must be more solidly placed in [this world]1288-this world than [she]404-mrs. finchley had heard , and later to ask [[her]404-mrs. finchley son]678-her son and even [Sondra]186-sondra concerning [him]201-clyde . But receiving from [Sondra]186-sondra only the equivocal information that , since [he]201-clyde was [Gil]189-gil and [[Bella Griffiths]183-bella ' cousin]3794-bella griffiths ' cousin , and was being taken up by [everybody]1330-everybody because [he]201-clyde was so charming — even if [he]201-clyde did n't have any money — [she]404-mrs. finchley could n't see why [she]404-mrs. finchley and [Stuart]188-stuart should not be allowed to entertain [him]201-clyde also , [[her]404-mrs. finchley mother]447-her mother rested on that for the time being — only cautioning [[her]404-mrs. finchley daughter]488-her daughter under no circumstances to become too friendly . And [Sondra]186-sondra , realizing that in part [[her]404-mrs. finchley mother]447-her mother was right , yet being so drawn to [Clyde]201-clyde was now determined to deceive [her]404-mrs. finchley , at least to the extent of being as clandestinely free with [Clyde]201-clyde as [she]404-mrs. finchley could contrive . And was , so much so that [every one who was privy to the intimate contacts between [Clyde]201-clyde and [Sondra]186-sondra]3799-every one who was privy to the intimate contacts between clyde and sondra might have reported that the actual understanding between [them]3800-they was assuming an intensity which most certainly would have shocked [the elder Finchleys]3801-the elder finchleys , could [they]3800-they have known . For apart from what [Clyde]201-clyde had been , and still was dreaming in regard to [her]404-mrs. finchley , [Sondra]186-sondra was truly being taken with thoughts and moods in regard to [him]201-clyde which were fast verging upon the most destroying aspects of the very profound chemistry of love . Indeed , in addition to handclasps , kisses and looks of intense admiration always bestowed when presumably [no one]4713-no one was looking , there were those nebulous and yet strengthening and lengthening fantasies concerning a future which in some way or other , not clear to either as yet , was still always to include each other .

Summer days perhaps , and that soon , in which [he]201-clyde and [she]404-mrs. finchley would be in [a canoe]3803-a canoe at [Twelfth Lake]8-twelfth lake , the long shadows of the trees on the bank lengthening over the silvery water , the wind rippling the surface while [he]201-clyde paddled and [she]404-mrs. finchley idled and tortured [him]201-clyde with hints of the future ; a certain forest path , grass - sodden and sun - mottled to [the south and west of [the Cranston]197-bertine and [Phant estates]121-phant estates]3804-the south and west of the cranston and phant estates , near [theirs]3800-they , through which [they]3800-they might canter in June and July to a wonderful view known as [Inspiration Point some seven miles west]3805-inspiration point some seven miles west ; [the country fair at [Sharon]10-sharon]3806-the country fair at sharon , at which , in a gypsy costume , the essence of romance itself , [she]404-mrs. finchley would superintend a booth , or , in [her]404-mrs. finchley smartest riding habit , give an exhibition of [her]404-mrs. finchley horsemanship — teas , dances in the afternoon and in the moonlight at which , languishing in [his]201-clyde arms , [their]3800-they eyes would speak .

None of the compulsion of the practical . None of the inhibitions which the dominance and possible future opposition of [[her]404-mrs. finchley parents]453-her parents might imply . Just love and summer , and idyllic and happy progress toward an eventual secure and unopposed union which should give [him]201-clyde to [her]404-mrs. finchley forever .

And in the meantime , in so far as [Roberta]302-roberta was concerned , two more long , dreary , terrifying months going by without that meditated action on [her]302-roberta part which must result once it was taken in [Clyde]201-clyde 's undoing . For , as convinced as [she]302-roberta was that apart from meditating and thinking of some way to escape [his]201-clyde responsibility , [Clyde]201-clyde had no real intention of marrying [her]302-roberta , still , like [Clyde]201-clyde , [she]302-roberta drifted , fearing to act really . For in several conferences following that in which [she]302-roberta had indicated that [she]302-roberta expected [him]201-clyde to marry [her]302-roberta , [he]201-clyde had reiterated , if vaguely , a veiled threat that in case [she]302-roberta appealed to [[his]201-clyde uncle]692-his uncle [he]201-clyde would not be compelled to marry [her]302-roberta , after all , for [he]201-clyde could go elsewhere .
