" Oh , [[my]4118-he darling baby girl]5943-my darling baby girl , "[4118-he] [he]4118-he exclaimed . " [[My]4117-she beautiful , beautiful [Sondra]186-sondra]5944-my beautiful , beautiful sondra ! If [you]186-sondra only knew how much [I]4117-she love [you]186-sondra ! If [you]186-sondra only knew ! [I]4117-she wish [I]4117-she could tell [you]186-sondra all . [I]4117-she wish [I]4117-she could . "[4117-she]

But [he]4118-he could not now — or ever . [He]4118-he would never dare to speak to [her]4117-she of even so much as a phase of the black barrier that now lay between [them]4120-them . For , with [her]4117-she training , the standards of love and marriage that had been set for [her]4117-she , [she]4117-she would never understand , never be willing to make so great a sacrifice for love , as much as [she]4117-she loved [him]4118-he . And [he]4118-he would be left , abandoned on the instant , and with what horror in [her]4117-she eyes !

Yet looking into [his]4118-he eyes , [his]4118-he face white and tense , and the glow of the moon above making small white electric sparks in [his]4118-he eyes , [she]4117-she exclaimed as [he]4118-he gripped [her]4117-she tightly : " Does [he]4118-he love [Sondra]186-sondra so much ? Oh , [sweetie boy]5945-sweetie boy ! [Sondra]186-sondra loves [him]4118-he , too . "[4117-she] [She]4117-she seized [his]4118-he head between [her]4117-she hands and held it tight , kissing [him]4118-he swiftly and ardently a dozen times . " And [Sondra]186-sondra wo n't give [her]4117-she [Clydie]410-clydie up either . [She]4117-she wo n't . [You]5945-sweetie boy just wait and see ! It does n't matter what happens now . It may not be so very easy , but [she]4117-she wo n't . "[4117-she] Then as suddenly and practically , as so often was [her]4117-she way , [she]4117-she exclaimed : " But [we]5946-we must go now , right away . No , not another kiss now . No , no , [Sondra]186-sondra says no , now . [They]5947-they 'll be missing [us]5946-we . "[4117-she] And straightening up and pulling [him]4118-he by the arm [she]4117-she hurried [him]4118-he back to [the house]532-the house in time to meet [Palmer Thurston]411-palmer thurston , who was looking for [her]4117-she .

The next morning , true to [her]4117-she promise , there was the canter to [Inspiration Point]140-inspiration point , and that before seven — [Bertine]197-bertine and [Sondra]186-sondra in bright red riding coats and white breeches and black boots , [their]4124-them hair unbound and loose to the wind , and riding briskly on before for the most part ; then racing back to where [he]4118-he was . Or [Sondra]186-sondra halloing gayly for [him]4118-he to come on , or the two of [them]4124-them laughing and chatting a hundred yards ahead in [some concealed chapel of the aisled trees where [he]4118-he could not see [them]4124-them]4125-some concealed chapel of the aisled trees where he could not see them . And because of the interest which [Sondra]186-sondra was so obviously manifesting in [him]4118-he these days — an interest which [Bertine]197-bertine [herself]197-bertine had begun to feel might end in marriage , if no family complications arose to interfere — [she]4117-she , [Bertine]197-bertine , was all smiles , the very soul of cordiality , winsomely insisting that [he]4118-he should come up and stay for the summer and [she]4117-she would chaperon [them]4124-them both so that [no one]4713-no one would have a chance to complain . And [Clyde]201-clyde thrilling , and yet brooding too — by turns — occasionally — and in spite of [himself]201-clyde drifting back to the thought that the item in the paper had inspired — and yet fighting it — trying to shut it out entirely .

And then at one point , [Sondra]186-sondra , turning down a steep path which led to [a stony and moss - lipped spring between the dark trees]4127-a stony and moss - lipped spring between the dark trees , called to [Clyde]201-clyde to " Come on down . [Jerry]287-jerry knows the way . [He]287-jerry wo n't slip . Come and get a drink . If [you]4118-he do , [you]4118-he 'll come back again soon — so [they]5948-they say . "[4117-she]

And once [he]4118-he was down and had dismounted to drink , [she]4117-she exclaimed : " [I]201-clyde 've been wanting to tell [you]4118-he something . [You]4118-he should have seen [Mamma]185-mamma 's face last night when [she]185-mamma heard [you]4118-he were up [here]4728-here . [She]185-mamma ca n't be sure that [I]201-clyde had anything to do with it , of course , because [she]185-mamma thinks that [Bertine]197-bertine likes [you]4118-he , too . [I]201-clyde made [her]185-mamma think that . But just the same [she]185-mamma suspects that [I]201-clyde had a hand in it , [I]201-clyde guess , and [she]185-mamma does n't quite like it . But [she]185-mamma ca n't say anything more than [she]185-mamma has before . And [I]201-clyde had a talk with [Bertine]197-bertine just now and [she]185-mamma 's agreed to stick by [me]201-clyde and help [me]201-clyde all [she]185-mamma can . But [we]5950-we 'll have to be even more careful than ever now , because [I]201-clyde think if [Mamma]185-mamma got too suspicious [I]201-clyde do n't know what [she]185-mamma might do — want [us]5950-we to leave here , even now maybe , just so [I]201-clyde could n't see [you]5951-you . [You]5951-you know [she]185-mamma feels that [I]201-clyde should n't be interested in any one yet except some one [she]185-mamma likes . [You]5951-you know how it is . [She]185-mamma 's that way with [Stuart]188-stuart , too . But if [you]5951-you 'll take care not to show that [you]5951-you care for [me]201-clyde so much whenever [we]5950-we 're around [any one of [[our]5950-we crowd]5953-our crowd]5952-any one of our crowd , [I]201-clyde do n't think [she]185-mamma 'll do anything — not now , anyhow . Later on , in the fall , when [we]5950-we 're back in [Lycurgus]1-lycurgus , things will be different . [I]201-clyde 'll be of age then , and [I]201-clyde 'm going to see what [I]201-clyde can do . [I]201-clyde never loved [any one]4764-any one before , but [I]201-clyde do love [you]4128-she , and , well , [I]201-clyde wo n't give [you]4128-she up , that 's all . [I]201-clyde wo n't . And [they]5955-they ca n't make [me]201-clyde , either ! "[201-clyde]

[She]4128-she stamped [her]4128-she foot and struck [her]4128-she boot , the while the two horses looked idly and vacantly about . And [Clyde]201-clyde , enthused and astonished by this second definite declaration in [his]201-clyde behalf , as well as fired by the thought that now , if ever , [he]201-clyde might suggest the elopement and marriage and so rid [himself]201-clyde of the sword that hung so threateningly above [him]201-clyde , now gazed at [Sondra]186-sondra , [his]201-clyde eyes filled with a nervous hope and a nervous fear . For [she]4128-she might refuse , and change , too , shocked by the suddenness of [his]201-clyde suggestion . And [he]201-clyde had no money and no place in mind where [they]4129-we might go either , in case [she]4128-she accepted [his]201-clyde proposal . But [she]4128-she had , perhaps , or [she]4128-she might have . And having once consented , might [she]4128-she not help [him]201-clyde ? Of course . At any rate , [he]201-clyde felt that [he]201-clyde must speak , leaving luck or ill luck to the future .

And so [he]201-clyde said : " Why could n't [you]186-sondra run away with [me]4131-her now , [Sondra]186-sondra , [darling]5692-darling ? It 's so long until fall and [I]4131-her want [you]186-sondra so much . Why could n't [we]4129-we ? [[Your]186-sondra mother]4765-your mother 's not likely to want to let [you]186-sondra marry [me]4131-her then , anyhow . But if [we]4129-we went away now , [she]4765-your mother could n't help [herself]4765-your mother , could [she]4765-your mother ? And afterwards , in a few months or so , [you]186-sondra could write [her]4765-your mother and then [she]4765-your mother would n't mind . Why could n't [we]4129-we , [Sondra]186-sondra ? "[4131-her] [His]4130-him voice was very pleading , [his]4130-him eyes full of a sad dread of refusal — and of the future that lay unprotected behind that .

And by now so caught was [she]4131-her by the tremor with which [his]4130-him mood invested [him]4130-him , that [she]4131-her paused — not really shocked by the suggestion at all — but decidedly moved , as well as flattered by the thought that [she]4131-her was able to evoke in [Clyde]201-clyde so eager and headlong a passion . [He]4130-him was so impetuous — so blazing now with a flame of [her]4131-her own creating , as [she]4131-her felt , yet which [she]4131-her was incapable of feeling as much as [he]4130-him , as [she]4131-her knew — such a flame as [she]4131-her had never seen in [him]4130-him or [any one else]5282-any one else before . And would it not be wonderful if [she]4131-her could run away with [him]4130-him now — secretly — to [Canada]144-canada or [New York]2-new york or [Boston]145-boston , or anywhere ? The excitement [her]4131-her elopement would create here and elsewhere — in [Lycurgus]1-lycurgus , [Albany]4-albany , [Utica]3-utica ! The talk and feeling in [[her]4131-her own family]4133-her own family as well as elsewhere ! And [Gilbert]200-gilbert would be related to [her]4131-her in spite of [him]4130-him — and [the Griffiths]555-the griffiths , too , whom [[her]4131-her mother]447-her mother and [father]435-father so much admired .

For a moment there was written in [her]4131-her eyes the desire and the determination almost , to do as [he]4130-him suggested — run away — make a great lark of this , [her]4131-her intense and true love . For , once married , what could [[her]4131-her parents]453-her parents do ? And was not [Clyde]201-clyde worthy of [her]4131-her and [them]453-her parents , too ? Of course — even though [nearly all in [her]4131-her set]4138-nearly all in her set fancied that [he]201-clyde was not quite all [he]201-clyde should be , just because [he]201-clyde did n't have as much money as [they]453-her parents had . But [he]201-clyde would have — would [he]201-clyde not — after [he]201-clyde was married to [her]4131-her — and get as good a place in [[her]4131-her father]510-her father 's business as [Gil Griffiths]189-gil had in [[his]189-gil father]539-his father 's ?

Yet a moment later , thinking of [her]4131-her life here and what [her]4131-her going off in such a way would mean to [[her]4131-her father]510-her father and [mother]4884-mother just then — in the very beginning of the summer season — as well as how it would disrupt [her]4131-her own plans and cause [[her]4131-her mother]447-her mother to feel especially angry , and perhaps even to bring about the dissolution of the marriage on the ground that [she]4131-her was not of age , [she]4131-her paused — that gay light of adventure replaced by a marked trace of the practical and the material that so persistently characterized [her]4131-her . What difference would a few months make , anyhow ? It might , and no doubt would , save [Clyde]201-clyde from being separated from [her]4131-her forever , whereas [their]4144-their present course might insure [their]4144-their separation .

Accordingly [she]4131-her now shook [her]4131-her head in a certain , positive and yet affectionate way , which by now [Clyde]201-clyde had come to know spelled defeat — the most painful and irremediable defeat that had yet come to [him]201-clyde in connection with all this . [She]4131-her would not go ! Then [he]201-clyde was lost — lost — and [she]4131-her to [him]201-clyde forever maybe . Oh , [God]306-god ! For while [her]4131-her face softened with a tenderness which was not usually there — even when [she]4131-her was most moved emotionally — [she]4131-her said : " [I]4131-her would , [honey]5354-honey , if [I]4131-her did not think it best not to , now . It 's too soon . [Mamma]185-mamma is n't going to do anything right now . [I]4131-her know [she]185-mamma is n't . Besides [she]185-mamma has made all [her]185-mamma plans to do a lot of entertaining here this summer , and for [my]4131-her particular benefit . [She]185-mamma wants [me]4131-her to be nice to — well , [you]5354-honey know who [I]4131-her mean . And [I]4131-her can be , without doing anything to interfere with [us]5959-our in any way , [I]4131-her 'm sure — so long as [I]4131-her do n't do anything to really frighten [her]185-mamma . "[4131-her] [She]4131-her paused to smile a reassuring smile . " But [you]5354-honey can come up here as often as [you]5354-honey choose , do n't [you]5354-honey see , and [she]185-mamma and [these others]1409-these others wo n't think anything of it , because [you]5354-honey wo n't be [[our]5959-our guest]5961-our guest , do n't [you]5354-honey see ? [I]4145-she 've fixed all that with [Bertine]197-bertine . And that means that [we]5959-our can see [each other]1439-each other all summer long up here , just about as much as [we]5959-our want to , do n't [you]5354-honey see ? Then in the fall , when [I]4145-she come back , and if [I]4145-she find that [I]4145-she ca n't make [her]185-mamma be nice to [you]5354-honey at all , or consider [our]5959-our being engaged , why , [I]4145-she will run away with [you]5354-honey . Yes , [I]4145-she will , [darling]5692-darling — really and truly . "[4145-she]

[Darling]412-darling ! The fall !

[She]4145-she stopped , [her]4145-she eyes showing a very shrewd conception of all the practical difficulties before [them]4146-them , while [she]4145-she took both of [his]4147-his hands in [hers]4145-she and looked up into [his]4147-his face . Then , impulsively and conclusively , [she]4145-she threw both arms about [his]4147-his neck and , pulling [his]4147-his head down , kissed [him]4147-his .

" Ca n't [you]4147-his see , [dearie]5964-dearie ? Please do n't look so sad , [darling]5692-darling . [Sondra]186-sondra loves [her]4145-she [Clyde]201-clyde so much . And [she]4145-she 'll do anything and everything to make things come out right . Yes , [she]4145-she will . And [they]5966-they will , too . Now [you]4147-his wait and see . [She]4145-she wo n't give [him]4147-his up ever — ever ! "[4145-she]

And [Clyde]201-clyde , realizing that [he]201-clyde had not one moving argument wherewith to confront [her]4145-she , really — not one that might not cause [her]4145-she to think strangely and suspiciously of [his]4147-his intense anxiety , and that this , because of [Roberta]302-roberta 's demand , and unless — unless — well — , unless [Roberta]302-roberta let [him]4147-his go it all spelled defeat for [him]4147-his , now looked gloomily and even desperately upon [her]4145-she face . The beauty of [her]4145-she ! The completeness of [this world]1288-this world ! And yet not to be allowed to possess [her]4145-she or it , ever . And [Roberta]302-roberta with [her]302-roberta demand and [his]4147-his promise in the immediate background ! And no way of escape save by flight ! God !

At this point it was that a nervous and almost deranged look — never so definite or powerful at any time before in [his]4147-his life — the border - line look between reason and unreason , no less — so powerful that the quality of it was even noticeable to [Sondra]186-sondra — came into [his]4147-his eyes . [He]4147-his looked sick , broken , unbelievably despairing . So much so that [she]4145-she exclaimed , " Why , what is it , [Clyde]201-clyde , [dearie]5964-dearie — [you]201-clyde look so — oh , [I]4149-he ca n't say just how — forlorn or — Does [he]4147-his love [me]4149-he so much ? And ca n't [he]4147-his wait just three or four months ? But , oh , yes [he]4147-his can , too . It is n't as bad as [he]4147-his thinks . [He]4147-his 'll be with [me]4149-he most of the time — the lovekins will . And when [he]4147-his is n't , [Sondra'll]413-sondra'll write [him]4147-his every day — every day . "[4149-he]

" But , [Sondra]186-sondra ! [Sondra]186-sondra ! If [I]4149-he could just tell [you]186-sondra . If [you]186-sondra knew how much it were going to mean to [me]4149-he — "[4149-he]

[He]4149-he paused here , for as [he]4149-he could see at this point , into the expression of [Sondra]186-sondra came a practical inquiry as to what it was that made it so urgent for [her]4150-her to leave with [him]4149-he at once . And immediately , on [his]4149-he part , [Clyde]201-clyde sensing how enormous was the hold of [this world]1288-this world on [her]4150-her — how integral a part of it [she]4150-her was — and how , by merely too much insistence here and now , [he]4149-he might so easily cause [her]4150-her to doubt the wisdom of [her]4150-her primary craze for [him]4149-he , was moved to desist , sure that if [he]4149-he spoke it would lead [her]4150-her to questioning [him]4149-he in such a way as might cause [her]4150-her to change — or at least to modify [her]4150-her enthusiasm to the point where even the dream of the fall might vanish .

And so , instead of explaining further why [he]4149-he needed a decision on [her]4150-her part , [he]4149-he merely desisted , saying : " It 's because [I]302-roberta need [you]4150-her so much now , [dear]5356-dear — all of the time . That 's it , just that . It seems at times as though [I]302-roberta could never be away from [you]4150-her another minute any more . Oh , [I]302-roberta 'm so hungry for [you]4150-her all of the time . "[302-roberta]

And yet [Sondra]186-sondra , flattered as [she]4150-her was by this hunger , and reciprocating it in part at least , merely repeated the various things [she]4150-her had said before . [They]4152-they must wait . All would come out all right in the fall . And [Clyde]201-clyde , quite numb because of [his]201-clyde defeat , yet unable to forego or deny the delight of being with [her]4150-her now , did [his]201-clyde best to recover [his]201-clyde mood — and think , think , think that in some way — somehow — maybe via that plan of [that boat]4153-that boat or in some other way !

But what other way ?

But no , no , no — not that . [He]201-clyde was not [a murderer]4154-a murderer and never could be . [He]201-clyde was not [a murderer]4154-a murderer — never — never — never .

And yet this loss .

This impending disaster .

This impending disaster .

How to avoid that and win to [Sondra]186-sondra after all .

How , how , how ?

And then on [his]201-clyde return to [Lycurgus]1-lycurgus early Monday morning , the following letter from [Roberta]302-roberta .

But the day this letter arrived in [Lycurgus]1-lycurgus [Clyde]201-clyde was not there to answer it at once . And because of that , [Roberta]302-roberta being in the darkest and most hysterical mood and thought , sat down on Saturday afternoon and , half - convinced as [she]302-roberta was that [he]201-clyde might already have departed for some distant point without any word to [her]302-roberta , almost shrieked or screamed , if one were to properly characterize the mood that animated the following .

This letter , coupled as it was with a threat to come to [Lycurgus]1-lycurgus , was sufficient to induce in [Clyde]201-clyde a state not unlike [Roberta]302-roberta 's . To think that [he]201-clyde had no additional , let alone plausible , excuse to offer [Roberta]302-roberta whereby [she]302-roberta could be induced to delay [her]302-roberta final and imperative demand . [He]201-clyde racked [his]201-clyde brains . [He]201-clyde must not write [her]302-roberta any long and self - incriminating letters . That would be foolish in the face of [his]201-clyde determination not to marry [her]302-roberta . Besides [his]201-clyde mood at the moment , so fresh from the arms and kisses of [Sondra]186-sondra , was not for anything like that . [He]201-clyde could not , even if [he]201-clyde would .

At the same time , something must be done at once , as [he]201-clyde could see , in order to allay [her]302-roberta apparently desperate mood . And ten minutes after [he]201-clyde had finished reading the last of these two letters , [he]201-clyde was attempting to reach [Roberta]302-roberta over the telephone . And finally getting [her]302-roberta after a troublesome and impatient half - hour , [he]201-clyde heard [her]302-roberta voice , thin and rather querulous as it seemed to [him]201-clyde at first , but really only because of a poor connection , saying : " Hello , [Clyde]201-clyde , hello . Oh , [I]201-clyde 'm so glad [you]201-clyde called . [I]201-clyde 've been terribly nervous . Did [you]201-clyde get [my]201-clyde two letters ? [I]201-clyde was just about to leave [here]4728-here in the morning if [I]201-clyde did n't hear from [you]201-clyde by then . [I]201-clyde just could n't stand not to hear anything . Where have [you]201-clyde been , [dear]5356-dear ? Did [you]201-clyde read what [I]201-clyde said about [[my]201-clyde parents]5376-my parents going away ? That 's true . Why do n't [you]201-clyde write , [Clyde]201-clyde , or call [me]201-clyde up anyhow ? What about what [I]201-clyde said in [my]201-clyde letter about the third ? Will [you]201-clyde be sure and come then ? Or shall [I]201-clyde meet [you]201-clyde somewhere ? [I]201-clyde 've been so nervous the last three or four days , but now that [I]201-clyde hear [you]201-clyde again , maybe [I]201-clyde 'll be able to quiet down some . But [I]201-clyde do wish [you]201-clyde would write [me]201-clyde a note every few days anyhow . Why wo n't [you]201-clyde , [Clyde]201-clyde ? [You]201-clyde have n't even written [me]201-clyde one since [I]201-clyde 've been [here]4728-here . [I]201-clyde ca n't tell [you]201-clyde what a state [I]201-clyde 'm in and how hard it is to keep calm now . "[201-clyde]

Plainly [Roberta]302-roberta was very nervous and fearsome as [she]302-roberta talked . As a matter of fact , except that [the home in which [she]302-roberta was telephoning]4156-the home in which she was telephoning was deserted at the moment [she]302-roberta was talking very indiscreetly , it seemed to [Clyde]201-clyde . And it aided but little in [his]201-clyde judgment for [her]302-roberta to explain that [she]302-roberta was all alone and that [no one]4713-no one could hear [her]302-roberta . [He]201-clyde did not want [her]302-roberta to use [his]201-clyde name or refer to letters written to [him]201-clyde .

Without talking too plainly , [he]201-clyde now tried to make it clear that [he]201-clyde was very busy and that it was hard for [him]201-clyde to write as much as [she]302-roberta might think necessary . Had [he]201-clyde not said that [he]201-clyde was coming on the 28th or thereabouts if [he]201-clyde could ? Well , [he]201-clyde would if [he]201-clyde could , only it looked now as though it might be necessary for [him]201-clyde to postpone it for another week or so , until the seventh or eighth of July — long enough for [him]201-clyde to get together an extra fifty for which [he]201-clyde had a plan , and which would be necessary for [him]201-clyde to have . But really , which was the thought behind this other , long enough for [him]201-clyde to pay one more visit to [Sondra]186-sondra as [he]201-clyde was yearning to do , over the next week - end . But this demand of [hers]302-roberta , now ! Could n't [she]302-roberta go with [[her]302-roberta parents]453-her parents for a week or so and then let [him]201-clyde come for [her]302-roberta [there]4705-there or [she]302-roberta come to [him]201-clyde ? It would give [him]201-clyde more needed time , and —

But at this [Roberta]302-roberta , bursting forth in a storm of nervous disapproval — saying that most certainly if that were the case [she]302-roberta was going back to [[her]302-roberta room]4766-her room at [the Gilpins ']395-the gilpins , if [she]302-roberta could get it , and not waste [her]302-roberta time up there getting ready and waiting for [him]201-clyde when [he]201-clyde was not coming — [he]201-clyde suddenly decided that [he]201-clyde might as well say that [he]201-clyde was coming on the third , or that if [he]201-clyde did not , that at least by then [he]201-clyde would have arranged with [her]302-roberta where to meet [him]201-clyde . For even by now , [he]201-clyde had not made up [his]201-clyde mind as to how [he]201-clyde was to do . [He]201-clyde must have a little more time to think — more time to think .

And so now [he]201-clyde altered [his]201-clyde tone greatly and said : " But listen , [Roberta]302-roberta . Please do n't be angry with [me]302-roberta . [You]302-roberta talk as though [I]302-roberta did n't have any troubles in connection with all this , either . [You]302-roberta do n't know what this may be going to cost [me]302-roberta before [I]302-roberta 'm through with it , and [you]302-roberta do n't seem to care much . [I]302-roberta know [you]302-roberta 're worried and all that , but what about [me]302-roberta ? [I]302-roberta 'm doing the very best [I]302-roberta can now , [Roberta]302-roberta , with all [I]302-roberta have to think about . And wo n't [you]302-roberta just be patient now until the third , anyhow ? Please do . [I]302-roberta promise to write [you]302-roberta and if [I]302-roberta do n't , [I]302-roberta 'll call [you]302-roberta up every other day . Will that be all right ? But [I]302-roberta certainly do n't want [you]302-roberta to be using [my]302-roberta name like [you]302-roberta did a while ago . That will lead to trouble , sure . Please do n't . And when [I]302-roberta call again , [I]302-roberta 'll just say it 's [Mr. Baker]414-mr. baker asking , see , and [you]302-roberta can say it 's any one [you]302-roberta like afterwards . And then , if by any chance anything should come up that would stop [our]5973-our starting exactly on the third , why [you]302-roberta can come back here if [you]302-roberta want to , see , or somewhere near here , and then [we]5973-our can start as soon as possible after that . "[302-roberta]

[His]4161-his tone was so pleading and soothing , infused as it was — but because of [his]4161-his present necessity only with a trace of that old tenderness and seeming helplessness which , at times , had quite captivated [Roberta]302-roberta , that even now it served to win [her]302-roberta to a bizarre and groundless gratitude . So much so that at once [she]302-roberta had replied , warmly and emotionally , even : " Oh , no , [dear]5356-dear . [I]201-clyde do n't want to do anything like that . [You]5356-dear know [I]201-clyde do n't . It 's just because things are so bad as they are with [me]201-clyde and [I]201-clyde ca n't help [myself]201-clyde now . [You]5356-dear know that , [Clyde]201-clyde , do n't [you]201-clyde ? [I]201-clyde ca n't help loving [you]201-clyde . [I]201-clyde always will , [I]201-clyde suppose . And [I]201-clyde do n't want to do anything to hurt [you]201-clyde , [dear]5356-dear , really [I]201-clyde do n't if [I]201-clyde can help it . "[201-clyde]

And [Clyde]201-clyde , hearing the ring of genuine affection , and sensing anew [his]201-clyde old - time power over [her]4162-her , was disposed to reenact the role of [lover]4163-lover again , if only in order to dissuade [Roberta]302-roberta from being too harsh and driving with [him]201-clyde now . For while [he]201-clyde could not like [her]4162-her now , [he]201-clyde told [himself]201-clyde , and could not think of marrying [her]4162-her , still in view of this other dream [he]201-clyde could at least be gracious to [her]4162-her — could [he]201-clyde not?—Pretend ! And so this conversation ended with a new peace based on this agreement .

The preceding day — a day of somewhat reduced activities on [the lakes from which [he]201-clyde had just returned]4164-the lakes from which he had just returned — [he]201-clyde and [Sondra]186-sondra and [Stuart]188-stuart and [Bertine]197-bertine , together with [Nina Temple]362-nina temple and [a youth named [Harley Baggott]415-harley baggott , then visiting [the Thurstons]416-the thurstons]4165-a youth named harley baggott , then visiting the thurstons , had motored first from [Twelfth Lake]8-twelfth lake to [Three Mile Bay]147-three mile bay , [a small lakeside resort some twenty - five miles north]4166-a small lakeside resort some twenty - five miles north , and from thence , between towering walls of pines , to [Big Bittern]148-big bittern and some other smaller lakes lost in [the recesses of the tall pines of [the region]481-the region to the north of [Trine Lake]149-trine lake]4167-the recesses of the tall pines of the region to the north of trine lake . And en route , [Clyde]201-clyde , as [he]201-clyde now recalled , had been most strangely impressed at moments and in spots by the desolate and for the most part lonely character of [the region]481-the region . The narrow and rain - washed and even rutted nature of the dirt roads that wound between [tall , silent and darksome trees]4170-tall , silent and darksome trees — forests in the largest sense of the word — that extended for miles and [miles apparently on either hand]4171-miles apparently on either hand . The decadent and weird nature of some of the bogs and tarns on either side of [the only comparatively passable dirt roads]4172-the only comparatively passable dirt roads which [here and there were festooned with funereal or viperous vines]4173-here and there were festooned with funereal or viperous vines , and strewn like deserted battlefields with soggy and decayed piles of fallen and crisscrossed logs — in places as many as four deep — one above the other — in the green slime that an undrained depression in the earth had accumulated . The eyes and backs of occasional frogs that , upon lichen or vine or moss - covered stumps and rotting logs in this warm June weather , there sunned themselves apparently undisturbed ; the spirals of gnats , the solitary flick of a snake 's tail as disturbed by the sudden approach of the machine , one made off into the muck and the poisonous grasses and water - plants which were thickly imbedded in it .

And in seeing one of these [Clyde]201-clyde , for some reason , had thought of the accident at [Pass Lake]133-pass lake . [He]201-clyde did not realize it , but at the moment [his]201-clyde own subconscious need was contemplating the loneliness and the usefulness at times of such a lone spot as this . And at one point it was that a wier - wier , [one of the solitary water - birds of [this region]503-this region]4174-one of the solitary water - birds of this region , uttered its ouphe and barghest cry , flying from somewhere near into [some darker recess within [the woods]2501-the woods]4176-some darker recess within the woods . And at this sound it was that [Clyde]201-clyde had stirred nervously and then sat up in [the car]650-the car . It was so very different to any bird - cry [he]201-clyde had ever heard anywhere .

" What was that ? "[415-harley baggott] [he]201-clyde asked of [Harley Baggott]415-harley baggott , who sat next [him]201-clyde .

" What ? "[201-clyde]

" Why , that bird or something that just flew away back there just now ? "[415-harley baggott]

" [I]201-clyde did n't hear any bird . "[201-clyde]

" Gee ! That was a queer sound . It makes [me]4207-a guide who was lounging upon the low veranda of the small inn feel creepy . "[4207-a guide who was lounging upon the low veranda of the small inn]

As interesting and impressive as anything else to [him]201-clyde in [this almost tenantless region]4179-this almost tenantless region had been the fact that there were so many [lonesome lakes]4180-lonesome lakes , not one of which [he]201-clyde had ever heard of before . [The territory through which [they]4182-they were speeding as fast as [the dirt roads]4183-the dirt roads would permit]4181-the territory through which they were speeding as fast as the dirt roads would permit , was dotted with them in [these deep forests of pine]4184-these deep forests of pine . And only occasionally in passing near one , were there any signs indicating [a camp]4185-a camp or [lodge]4186-lodge , and those to be reached only by some half - blazed trail or rutty or sandy road disappearing through darker trees . In the main , [the shores of [the more remote lakes]4188-the more remote lakes]4187-the shores of the more remote lakes passed , were all but untenanted , or so sparsely that [a cabin]4189-a cabin or [a distant lodge]4190-a distant lodge to be seen across the smooth waters of [some pine - encircled gem]4191-some pine - encircled gem was an object of interest to all .

Why must [he]201-clyde think of [that other lake in [Massachusetts]150-massachusetts]4192-that other lake in massachusetts ! [That boat]4153-that boat ! The body of [that girl]4850-that girl found — but not that of [the man who accompanied [her]4850-that girl]4195-the man who accompanied her ! How terrible , really !

[He]201-clyde recalled afterwards,—here in [[his]201-clyde room]530-his room , after the last conversation with [Roberta]302-roberta — that [the car]650-the car , after a few more miles , had finally swung into an open space at [the north end of [a long narrow lake]4199-a long narrow lake]4198-the north end of a long narrow lake — [the south prospect of which appeared to be divided by a point or an island]4200-the south prospect of which appeared to be divided by a point or an island suggesting a greater length and further windings or curves than were visible from where [the car]650-the car had stopped . And except for [the small lodge and boathouse at this upper end]4202-the small lodge and boathouse at this upper end [it]4202-the small lodge and boathouse at this upper end had appeared so very lonesome — not a launch or canoe on [it]4202-the small lodge and boathouse at this upper end at the time [[their]4203-their party]4204-their party arrived . And as in the case of [all the other lakes seen this day]4205-all the other lakes seen this day , the banks to the very shore line were sentineled with those same green pines — tall , spear - shaped — [their]4206-their arms widespread like one outside [his]201-clyde window here in [Lycurgus]1-lycurgus . And beyond [them]4206-their in the distance , to the south and west , rose the humped and still smooth and green backs of [the nearer Adirondacks]57-the adirondacks . And the water before [them]4203-their , now ruffled by a light wind and glowing in the afternoon sun , was of an intense Prussian blue , almost black , which suggested , as was afterwards confirmed by [a guide who was lounging upon [the low veranda of [the small inn]4209-the small inn]4208-the low veranda of the small inn]4207-a guide who was lounging upon the low veranda of the small inn — that it was very deep—"all of seventy feet not more than a hundred feet out from [that boathouse]5976-that boathouse . "[4215-the guide]

And at this point [Harley Baggott]415-harley baggott , who was interested to learn more about the fishing possibilities of [this lake]2275-this lake in behalf of [[his]415-harley baggott father]539-his father , who contemplated coming to [this region]503-this region in a few days , had inquired of [the guide who appeared not to look at the others in [the car]650-the car]4213-the guide who appeared not to look at the others in the car :

" How long is [this lake]2275-this lake , anyhow ? "[4215-the guide]

" Oh , about seven miles . "[4215-the guide]

" Any fish in it ? "[4215-the guide]

" Throw a line in and see . The best place for black bass and the like of that almost anywhere around here . Off [the island down yonder]5978-the island down yonder , or just to the south of [it]5978-the island down yonder round on the other side there , there 's a little bay that 's said to be one of the best fishin ' holes in [any of [the lakes up this way]5980-the lakes up this way]5979-any of the lakes up this way . " Well , [they]5987-accommodations ai n't what [they]5987-accommodations are down to [Racquette]79-racquette , of course , but then the fish down there ai n't what [they]5987-accommodations are up here , either . "[188-stuart] [He]4215-the guide visited all with a sly and wry and knowing smile .

[Clyde]201-clyde had never seen [the type]4218-the type before . [He]201-clyde was interested by all the anomalies and contrarities of this lonesome world as contrasted with [cities]4219-cities [he]201-clyde had known almost exclusively , as well as the decidedly exotic and material life and equipment with which , at [the Cranstons ']195-the cranstons and elsewhere , [he]201-clyde was then surrounded . The strange and comparatively deserted nature of [this region]503-this region as contrasted with the brisk and vigorous life of [Lycurgus]1-lycurgus , [less than a hundred miles to the south]4221-less than a hundred miles to the south .

" [The country up here]5988-the country up here kills [me]188-stuart , "[188-stuart] commented [Stuart Finchley]188-stuart at this point . " It 's so near [the Chain]138-the chain and yet it 's so different , scarcely any one living up here at all , it seems . "[4215-the guide]

" Well , except for [the camps]5989-the camps in summer and [the fellows that come up to hunt moose and deer]5990-the fellows that come up to hunt moose and deer in the fall , there ai n't much of [anybody]1510-anybody or anything around here after September first , "[4215-the guide] commented [the guide]4215-the guide . " [I]201-clyde 've been guidin ' and trappin ' for nigh onto seventeen years now around here and ' cept for more and more people around some of [the lakes below here]5992-the lakes below here — the Chain principally in summer — [I]201-clyde ai n't seen much change . [You]5993-you need to know [this country]5994-this country purty well if [yer]5993-you goin't strike out anywhere away from [the main roads]5995-the main roads , though o ' course about five miles to the west o ' here is [the railroad]5996-the railroad . [Gun Lodge]152-gun lodge is [the station]5997-the station . [We]5998-we bring ['em]5999-'em by [bus]6000-bus from there in the summer . And from the south end down there is [a sorta road leadin ' down to [Greys Lake]153-greys lake and [Three Mile Bay]147-three mile bay]6001-a sorta road leadin ' down to greys lake and three mile bay . [They]6003-they 're talkin ' of cuttin ' one through to [Long Lake]154-long lake sometime , but so far it 's mostly talk . But , oh , say , the fishin ' and moose and deer come right down to [the shore]2281-the shore in places to drink . See ['em]6012-'em as plain as that stump across [the lake]4706-the lake . "[201-clyde]

[And Clyde]201-clyde remembered that , along with [the others]629-the others , [he]201-clyde had carried away the impression that for solitude and charm — or at least mystery — [this region]503-this region could scarcely be matched . And to think it was all so comparatively near [Lycurgus]1-lycurgus — not more than a hundred miles by [road]4225-road ; not more than seventy by rail , as [he]201-clyde eventually came to know .

But now once more in [Lycurgus]1-lycurgus and back in [[his]201-clyde room]530-his room after just explaining to [Roberta]302-roberta , as [he]201-clyde had , [he]201-clyde once more encountered on [his]201-clyde writing desk , the identical paper containing the item concerning the tragedy at [Pass Lake]133-pass lake . And in spite of [himself]201-clyde , [his]201-clyde eye once more followed nervously and yet unwaveringly to the last word all the suggestive and provocative details . The uncomplicated and apparently easy way in which [the lost couple]4227-the lost couple had first arrived at [the boathouse]4756-the boathouse ; the commonplace and entirely unsuspicious way in which [they]4227-the lost couple had hired [a boat]2206-a boat and set forth for a row ; the manner in which [they]4227-the lost couple had disappeared to [the north end]4230-the north end ; and then [the upturned boat]4231-the upturned boat , the floating oars and hats near [the shore]2281-the shore . [He]201-clyde stood reading in the still strong evening light . Outside the windows were the dark boughs of the fir tree of which [he]201-clyde had thought the preceding day and which now suggested all those firs and pines about [the shores of [Big Bittern]148-big bittern]4233-the shores of big bittern .

But , good [God]306-god ! What was [he]201-clyde thinking of anyhow ? [He]201-clyde , [Clyde Griffiths]201-clyde ! [The nephew of [Samuel Griffiths]179-samuel griffiths]5049-the nephew of samuel griffiths ! What was " getting into "[4276-the genie of his darkest and weakest side] [him]201-clyde ? Murder ! That 's what it was . This terrible item — [this devil]4235-this devil 's accident or machination that was constantly putting it before [him]201-clyde ! A most horrible crime , and one for which [they]4227-the lost couple electrocuted [people]4823-people if [they]4227-the lost couple were caught . Besides , [he]201-clyde could not murder [anybody]1510-anybody — not [Roberta]302-roberta , anyhow . Oh , no ! Surely not after all that had been between [them]4238-them . And yet — this other world!—Sondra — which [he]201-clyde was certain to lose now unless [he]201-clyde acted in some way —

[His]201-clyde hands shook , [his]201-clyde eyelids twitched — then [his]201-clyde hair at the roots tingled and over [his]201-clyde body ran chill nervous titillations in waves . Murder ! Or upsetting [a boat]2206-a boat at any rate in [deep water]4240-deep water , which of course might happen anywhere , and by accident , as at [Pass Lake]133-pass lake . And [Roberta]302-roberta could not swim . [He]201-clyde knew that . But [she]302-roberta might save [herself]302-roberta at that — scream — cling to [the boat]2311-the boat — and then — if there were any to hear — and [she]302-roberta told afterwards ! An icy perspiration now sprang to [his]201-clyde forehead ; [his]201-clyde lips trembled and suddenly [his]201-clyde throat felt parched and dry . To prevent a thing like that [he]201-clyde would have to — to — but no — [he]201-clyde was not like that . [He]201-clyde could not do a thing like that — hit [any one]4764-any one — [a girl]2278-a girl — [Roberta]302-roberta — and when drowning or struggling . Oh , no , no — no such thing as that ! Impossible .

[He]201-clyde took [his]201-clyde straw hat and went out , almost before [any one]4764-any one heard [him]201-clyde think , as [he]201-clyde would have phrased it to [himself]201-clyde , such horrible , terrible thoughts . [He]201-clyde could not and would not think them from now on . [He]201-clyde was [no such person]4245-no such person . And yet — and yet — these thoughts . The solution — if [he]201-clyde wanted one . The way to stay here — not leave — marry [Sondra]186-sondra — be rid of [Roberta]302-roberta and all — all — for the price of a little courage or daring . But no !

[He]201-clyde walked and walked — away from [Lycurgus]1-lycurgus — out on [a road to [the southeast]4247-the southeast which passed through [a poor and decidedly unfrequented rural section]4248-a poor and decidedly unfrequented rural section]4246-a road to the southeast which passed through a poor and decidedly unfrequented rural section , and so left [him]201-clyde alone to think — or , as [he]201-clyde felt , not to be heard in [his]201-clyde thinking .

Day was fading into dark . Lamps were beginning to glow in [the cottages]4249-the cottages here and there . Trees in groups in [fields]4250-fields or along [the road]3893-the road were beginning to blur or smokily blend . And although it was warm — the air lifeless and lethargic — [he]201-clyde walked fast , thinking , and perspiring as [he]201-clyde did so , as though [he]201-clyde were seeking to outwalk and outthink or divert some inner self that preferred to be still and think .

[That gloomy , lonely lake up there]4252-that gloomy , lonely lake up there !

[That island]5301-that island to the south !

Who would see ?

[Who could hear]4254-who could hear ?

[That station at [Gun Lodge]152-gun lodge with [a bus]4256-a bus running to it at this season of the year]4255-that station at gun lodge with a bus running to it at this season of the year . ( Ah , [he]201-clyde remembered that , did [he]201-clyde ? The deuce ! ) A terrible thing , to remember a thing like that in connection with such a thought as this ! But if [he]201-clyde were going to think of such a thing as this at all , [he]201-clyde had better think well — [he]201-clyde could tell [himself]201-clyde that — or stop thinking about it now — once and forever — forever . But [Sondra]186-sondra ! [Roberta]302-roberta ! If ever [he]201-clyde were caught — electrocuted ! And yet the actual misery of [his]201-clyde present state . The difficulty ! The danger of losing [Sondra]186-sondra . And yet , murder —

[He]201-clyde wiped [his]201-clyde hot and wet face , and paused and gazed at a group of trees across a field which somehow reminded [him]201-clyde of the trees of ... well ... [he]201-clyde did n't like [this road]3873-this road . It was getting too dark out here . [He]201-clyde had better turn and go back . But [that road at the south and leading to [Three Mile Bay]147-three mile bay and [Greys Lake]153-greys lake]4258-that road at the south and leading to three mile bay and greys lake — if one chose to go that way — to [Sharon]10-sharon and [the Cranston Lodge]158-the cranston lodge — whither [he]201-clyde would be going afterwards if [he]201-clyde did go that way . [God]306-god ! [Big Bittern]148-big bittern — the trees along there after dark would be like that — blurred and gloomy . It would have to be toward evening , of course . [No one]4713-no one would think of trying to ... well ... in the morning , when there was so much light . Only [a fool]3609-a fool would do that . But at night , toward dusk , as it was now , or a little later . But , damn it , [he]201-clyde would not listen to such thoughts . Yet [no one]4713-no one would be likely to see [him]201-clyde or [Roberta]302-roberta either — would [they]4262-they — there ? It would be so easy to go to [a place like [Big Bittern]148-big bittern]4263-a place like big bittern — for an alleged wedding trip — would it not — over the Fourth , say — or after the fourth or fifth , when there would be [fewer people]4264-fewer people . And to register as [some one else]5814-some one else — not [himself]201-clyde — so that [he]201-clyde could never be traced that way . And then , again , it would be so easy to get back to [Sharon]10-sharon and [the Cranstons]195-the cranstons ' by midnight , or the morning of the next day , maybe , and then , once [there]4705-there [he]201-clyde could pretend also that [he]201-clyde had come north on [that early morning train]4267-that early morning train that arrived about ten o'clock . And then [...]418-...

Confound it — why should [his]201-clyde mind keep dwelling on this idea ? Was [he]201-clyde actually planning to do a thing like this ? But [he]201-clyde was not ! [He]201-clyde could not be ! [He]201-clyde , [Clyde Griffiths]201-clyde , could not be serious about a thing like this . That was not possible . [He]201-clyde could not be . Of course ! It was all too impossible , too wicked , to imagine that [he]201-clyde , [Clyde Griffiths]201-clyde , could bring [himself]201-clyde to execute a deed like that . And yet ...

And forthwith an uncanny feeling of wretchedness and insufficiency for so dark a crime insisted on thrusting itself forward . [He]201-clyde decided to retrace [his]201-clyde steps toward [Lycurgus]1-lycurgus , where at least [he]201-clyde could be among [people]4823-people .

There are moments when in connection with the sensitively imaginative or morbidly anachronistic — the mentality assailed and the same not of any great strength and the problem confronting [it]4269-it of sufficient force and complexity — the reason not actually toppling from its throne , still totters or is warped or shaken — the mind befuddled to the extent that for the time being , at least , unreason or disorder and mistaken or erroneous counsel would appear to hold against all else . In such instances the will and the courage confronted by some great difficulty which it can neither master nor endure , appears in some to recede in precipitate flight , leaving only panic and temporary unreason in its wake .

And in this instance , the mind of [Clyde]201-clyde might well have been compared to [a small and routed army in full flight before a major one]4270-a small and routed army in full flight before a major one , yet at various times in its precipitate departure , pausing for a moment to meditate on some way of escaping complete destruction and in the coincident panic of such a state , resorting to the weirdest and most haphazard of schemes of escaping from an impending and yet wholly unescapable fate . The strained and bedeviled look in [his]201-clyde eyes at moments — the manner in which , from moment to moment and hour to hour , [he]201-clyde went over and over [his]201-clyde hitherto poorly balanced actions and thoughts but with no smallest door of escape anywhere . And yet again at moments the solution suggested by the item in The Times - Union again thrusting itself forward , psychogenetically , born of [his]201-clyde own turbulent , eager and disappointed seeking . And hence persisting .

Indeed , it was now as though from the depths of [some lower or higher world]4271-some lower or higher world never before guessed or plumbed by [him]201-clyde ... [a region otherwhere than in life or death and peopled by creatures otherwise than [himself]201-clyde]4272-a region otherwhere than in life or death and peopled by creatures otherwise than himself ... there had now suddenly appeared , as [the genie at the accidental rubbing of]4273-the genie at the accidental rubbing of [Aladdin]419-aladdin 's lamp — as the efrit emerging as smoke from the mystic jar in [the net of [the fisherman]4275-the fisherman]4274-the net of the fisherman — the very substance of some leering and diabolic wish or wisdom concealed in [his]201-clyde own nature , and that now abhorrent and yet compelling , leering and yet intriguing , friendly and yet cruel , offered [him]201-clyde a choice between an evil which threatened to destroy [him]201-clyde ( and against [his]201-clyde deepest opposition ) and a second evil which , however it might disgust or sear or terrify , still provided for freedom and success and love .

Indeed the center or mentating section of [his]201-clyde brain at this time might well have been compared to a sealed and silent hall in which alone and undisturbed , and that in spite of [himself]201-clyde , [he]201-clyde now sat thinking on the mystic or evil and terrifying desires or advice of some darker or primordial and unregenerate nature of [his]201-clyde own , and without the power to drive the same forth or [himself]201-clyde to decamp , and yet also without the courage to act upon anything .

For now [the genie of [his]201-clyde darkest and weakest side]4276-the genie of his darkest and weakest side was speaking . And it said : " And would [you]201-clyde escape from the demands of [Roberta]302-roberta that but now and unto this hour have appeared unescapable to [you]201-clyde ? Behold ! [I]201-clyde bring [you]201-clyde a way . It is the way of [the lake]4706-the lake — [Pass Lake]133-pass lake . This item that [you]201-clyde have read — do [you]201-clyde think it was placed in [your]201-clyde hands for nothing ? Remember [Big Bittern]148-big bittern , the deep , blue - black water , [the island]6015-the island to the south , [the lone road to [Three Mile Bay]147-three mile bay]6016-the lone road to three mile bay ? How suitable to [your]201-clyde needs ! [A row - boat]6017-a row - boat or [a canoe]3803-a canoe upset in [such a lake and]6019-such a lake and [Roberta]302-roberta would pass forever from [your]201-clyde life . [She]302-roberta can not swim ! [The lake]4706-the lake — [the lake]4706-the lake — that [you]201-clyde have seen — that [I]201-clyde have shown [you]201-clyde — is it not ideal for the purpose ? So removed and so little frequented and yet comparatively near — but a hundred miles from here . And how easy for [you]201-clyde and [Roberta]302-roberta to go [there]4705-there — not directly but indirectly — on this purely imaginative marriage - trip that [you]201-clyde have already agreed to . And all that [you]201-clyde need do now is to change [your]201-clyde name — and [hers]302-roberta — or let [her]302-roberta keep [her]302-roberta own and [you]201-clyde use [yours]201-clyde . [You]201-clyde have never permitted [her]302-roberta to speak of [you]201-clyde and this relationship , and [she]302-roberta never has . [You]201-clyde have written [her]302-roberta but formal notes . And now if [you]201-clyde should meet [her]302-roberta somewhere as [you]201-clyde have already agreed to , and without [any one]4764-any one seeing [you]201-clyde , [you]201-clyde might travel with [her]302-roberta , as in the past to [Fonda]47-fonda , to [Big Bittern]148-big bittern — or some point near there . "[201-clyde]

" But there is [no hotel at [Big Bittern]148-big bittern]6024-no hotel at big bittern , "[201-clyde] at once corrected [Clyde]201-clyde . " [A mere shack]6025-a mere shack that entertains but [few people]6026-few people and that not very well . "[4276-the genie of his darkest and weakest side]

" All the better . [The less people]6027-the less people are likely to be [there]4705-there . "[201-clyde]

" But [we]6029-we might be seen on [the train]3121-the train going up together . [I]4276-the genie of his darkest and weakest side would be identified as having been with [her]302-roberta . "[4276-the genie of his darkest and weakest side]

" Were [you]201-clyde seen at [Fonda]47-fonda , [Gloversville]52-gloversville , [Little Falls]159-little falls ? Have [you]201-clyde not ridden in [separate cars]6031-separate cars or seats before and could [you]201-clyde not do so now ? Is it not presumably to be a secret marriage ? Then why not a secret honeymoon ? "[201-clyde]

" True enough — true enough . "[4276-the genie of his darkest and weakest side]

" And once [you]201-clyde have arranged for that and arrive at [Big Bittern]148-big bittern or [some lake like it]6032-some lake like it — there are so many there — how easy to row out on [such a lake]6033-such a lake ? No questions . [No registry under [your]201-clyde own name or [hers]302-roberta]6034-no registry under your own name or hers . [A boat]2206-a boat rented for an hour or half - day or day . [You]201-clyde saw [[the island]6015-the island far to the south on [that lone lake]6038-that lone lake]6037-the island far to the south on that lone lake . Is it not beautiful ? It is well worth seeing . Why should [you]201-clyde not go [there]4705-there on such a pleasure trip before marriage ? Would [she]302-roberta not be happy so to do — as weary and distressed as [she]302-roberta is now — an outing — a rest before the ordeal of the new life ? Is not that sensible — plausible ? And neither of [you]201-clyde will ever return presumably . [You]201-clyde will both be drowned , will [you]201-clyde not ? [Who is to see]6040-who is to see ? [A guide or two]6041-a guide or two — [the man who rents [you]201-clyde [the boat]2311-the boat]6042-the man who rents you the boat — [the innkeeper]6044-the innkeeper once , as [you]201-clyde go . But how are [they]6041-a guide or two to know who [you]201-clyde are ? Or who [she]302-roberta is ? And [you]201-clyde heard the depth of the water . "[201-clyde]

" But [I]4276-the genie of his darkest and weakest side do not want to kill [her]302-roberta . [I]4276-the genie of his darkest and weakest side do not want to kill [her]302-roberta . [I]4276-the genie of his darkest and weakest side do not want to injure [her]302-roberta in any way . If [she]302-roberta will but let [me]4276-the genie of his darkest and weakest side go and [she]302-roberta go [her]302-roberta own way , [I]4276-the genie of his darkest and weakest side will be so glad and so happy never to see [her]302-roberta more . "[4276-the genie of his darkest and weakest side]

" But [she]302-roberta will not let [you]201-clyde go or go [her]302-roberta way unless [you]201-clyde accompany [her]302-roberta . And if [you]201-clyde go [yours]201-clyde , it will be without [Sondra]186-sondra and all that [she]302-roberta represents , as well as all this pleasant life here — [your]201-clyde standing with [[your]201-clyde uncle]4868-your uncle , [[his]4868-your uncle friends]6046-his friends , [[their]6046-his friends cars]6047-their cars , the dances , visits to [the lodges on [the lakes]6049-the lakes]6048-the lodges on the lakes . And what then ? A small job ! Small pay ! Another such period of wandering as followed that accident at [Kansas City]23-kansas city . Never another chance like this anywhere . Do [you]201-clyde prefer that ? "[201-clyde]

" But might there not be some accident here , destroying all [my]4276-the genie of his darkest and weakest side dreams — [my]4276-the genie of his darkest and weakest side future — as there was in [Kansas City]23-kansas city ? "[4276-the genie of his darkest and weakest side]

" An accident , to be sure — but not the same . In this instance the plan is in [your]201-clyde hands . [You]201-clyde can arrange it all as [you]201-clyde will . And how easy ! So many boats upsetting every summer — [the occupants of [them]6051-them]6050-the occupants of them drowning , because in most cases [they]6050-the occupants of them can not swim . And will it ever be known whether [the man who was with [Roberta Alden]302-roberta on [Big Bittern]148-big bittern]6052-the man who was with roberta alden on big bittern could swim ? And of all deaths , drowning is the easiest — no noise — no outcry — perhaps the accidental blow of an oar — the side of [a boat]2206-a boat . And then silence ! Freedom — a body that [no one]4713-no one may ever find . Or if found and identified , will it not be easy , if [you]201-clyde but trouble to plan , to make it appear that [you]201-clyde were elsewhere , visiting at [one of [the other lakes]6056-the other lakes before [you]201-clyde decided to go to [Twelfth Lake]8-twelfth lake]6055-one of the other lakes before you decided to go to twelfth lake . What is wrong with it ? Where is the flaw ? "[201-clyde]

" But assuming that [I]4276-the genie of his darkest and weakest side should upset [the boat]2311-the boat and that [she]2311-the boat should not drown , then what ? Should cling to it , cry out , be saved and relate afterward that ... But no , [I]4276-the genie of his darkest and weakest side can not do that — will not do it . [I]4276-the genie of his darkest and weakest side will not hit [her]2311-the boat . That would be too terrible ... too vile . "[4276-the genie of his darkest and weakest side]

" But a little blow — any little blow under such circumstances would be sufficient to confuse and complete [her]2311-the boat undoing . Sad , yes , but [she]2311-the boat has an opportunity to go [her]2311-the boat own way , has [she]2311-the boat not ? And [she]2311-the boat will not , nor let [you]201-clyde go [yours]201-clyde . Well , then , is this so terribly unfair ? And do not forget that afterwards there is [Sondra]186-sondra — the beautiful — [a home with [her]2311-the boat in [Lycurgus]1-lycurgus]6058-a home with her in lycurgus — wealth , a high position such as elsewhere [you]201-clyde may never obtain again — never — never . Love and happiness — the equal of any one here — superior even to [[your]201-clyde cousin]5061-your cousin [Gilbert]200-gilbert . "[201-clyde]

The voice ceased temporarily , trailing off into shadow,—silence , dreams .

And [Clyde]201-clyde , contemplating all that had been said , was still unconvinced . Darker fears or better impulses supplanted the counsel of the voice in [the great hall]4277-the great hall . But presently thinking of [Sondra]186-sondra and all that [she]4278-she represented , and then of [Roberta]302-roberta , the dark personality would as suddenly and swiftly return and with amplified suavity and subtlety .

" Ah , still thinking on the matter . And [you]201-clyde have not found a way out and [you]201-clyde will not . [I]201-clyde have truly pointed out to [you]201-clyde and in all helpfulness the only way — the only way — It is [a long lake]6060-a long lake . And would it not be easy in rowing about to eventually find [some secluded spot]6061-some secluded spot — [some invisible nook near [that south shore]6063-that south shore where the water is deep]6062-some invisible nook near that south shore where the water is deep ? And from there how easy to walk through [the woods]2501-the woods to [Three Mile Bay]6065-three mile bay and [Upper Greys Lake]161-upper greys lake ? And from there to [the Cranstons]195-the cranstons ' ? There is [a boat from]6066-a boat from [there]4705-there , as [you]201-clyde know . [Pah]420-pah — how cowardly — how lacking in courage to win the thing that above all things [you]201-clyde desire — beauty — wealth — position — the solution of [your]201-clyde every material and spiritual desire . And with poverty , commonplace , hard and poor work as the alternative to all this .[201-clyde]

" But [you]201-clyde must choose — choose ! And then act . [You]201-clyde must ! [You]201-clyde must ! [You]201-clyde must ! "[201-clyde]

Thus the voice in parting , echoing from some remote part of [the enormous chamber]4279-the enormous chamber .

And [Clyde]201-clyde , listening at first with horror and in terror , later with a detached and philosophic calm as one who , entirely apart from what [he]201-clyde may think or do , is still entitled to consider even the wildest and most desperate proposals for [his]201-clyde release , at last , because of [his]201-clyde own mental and material weakness before pleasures and dreams which [he]201-clyde could not bring [himself]201-clyde to forego , psychically intrigued to the point where [he]201-clyde was beginning to think that it might be possible . Why not ? Was it not even as the voice said — a possible and plausible way — all [his]201-clyde desires and dreams to be made real by this one evil thing ? Yet in [his]201-clyde case , because of flaws and weaknesses in [his]201-clyde own unstable and highly variable will , the problem was not to be solved by thinking thus — then — nor for the next ten days for that matter .

[He]201-clyde could not really act on such a matter for [himself]201-clyde and would not . It remained as usual for [him]201-clyde to be forced either to act or to abandon this most wild and terrible thought . Yet during this time a series of letters — seven from [Roberta]302-roberta , five from [Sondra]186-sondra — in which in somber tones in so far as [Roberta]302-roberta was concerned — in gay and colorful ones in those which came from [Sondra]186-sondra — was painted the now so sharply contrasting phases of the black rebus which lay before [him]201-clyde . To [Roberta]302-roberta 's pleadings , argumentative and threatening as they were , [Clyde]201-clyde did not trust [himself]201-clyde to reply , not even by telephone . For now [he]201-clyde reasoned that to answer would be only to lure [Roberta]302-roberta to [her]302-roberta doom — or to the attempted drastic conclusion of [his]201-clyde difficulties as outlined by the tragedy at [Pass Lake]133-pass lake .

At the same time , in several notes addressed to [Sondra]186-sondra , [he]201-clyde gave vent to the most impassioned declarations of love — [[his]201-clyde darling]4280-his darling — [[his]201-clyde wonder girl]4281-his wonder girl — how eager [he]201-clyde was to be at [Twelfth Lake]8-twelfth lake by the morning of the Fourth , if [he]201-clyde could , and so thrilled to see [her]302-roberta there again . Yet , alas , as [he]201-clyde also wrote now , so uncertain was [he]201-clyde , even now , as to how [he]201-clyde was to do , there were certain details in connection with [his]201-clyde work here that might delay [him]201-clyde a day or two or three — [he]201-clyde could not tell as yet — but would write [her]302-roberta by the second at the latest , when [he]201-clyde would know positively . Yet saying to [himself]201-clyde as [he]201-clyde wrote this , if [she]302-roberta but knew what those details were — if [she]302-roberta but knew . Yet in penning this , and without having as yet answered the last importunate letter from [Roberta]302-roberta , [he]201-clyde was also saying to [himself]201-clyde that this did not mean that [he]201-clyde was planning to go to [Roberta]302-roberta at all , or that if [he]201-clyde did , it did not mean that [he]201-clyde was going to attempt to kill [her]302-roberta . Never once did [he]201-clyde honestly , or to put it more accurately , forthrightly and courageously or coldly face the thought of committing so grim a crime . On the contrary , the nearer [he]201-clyde approached a final resolution or the need for one in connection with all this , the more hideous and terrible seemed the idea — hideous and difficult , and hence the more improbable it seemed that [he]201-clyde should ever commit it . It was true that from moment to moment — arguing with [himself]201-clyde as [he]201-clyde constantly was — sweating mental sweats and fleeing from moral and social terrors in connection with it all , [he]201-clyde was thinking from time to time that [he]201-clyde might go to [Big Bittern]148-big bittern in order to quiet [her]302-roberta in connection with these present importunities and threats and hence ( once more evasion — tergiversation with [himself]201-clyde ) give [himself]201-clyde more time in which to conclude what [his]201-clyde true course must be .

The way of [the Lake]162-the lake .

The way of [the Lake]162-the lake .

But once there — whether it would then be advisable so to do — or not — well who could tell . [He]201-clyde might even yet be able to convert [Roberta]302-roberta to some other point of view . For , say what [you]4282-you would , [she]302-roberta was certainly acting very unfairly and captiously in all this . [She]302-roberta was , as [he]201-clyde saw it in connection with [his]201-clyde very vital dream of [Sondra]186-sondra , making a mountain — an immense terror — out of a state that when all was said and done , was not so different from [Esta]219-esta 's . And [Esta]219-esta had not compelled [any one]4764-any one to marry [her]302-roberta . And how much better were [the Aldens]388-the aldens to [[his]201-clyde own parents]1122-his own parents — [poor farmers]4285-poor farmers as compared to [poor preachers]4286-poor preachers . And why should [he]201-clyde be so concerned as to what [they]1122-his own parents would think when [Esta]219-esta had not troubled to think what [[her]302-roberta parents]453-her parents would feel ?

In spite of all that [Roberta]302-roberta had said about blame , was [she]302-roberta so entirely lacking in blame [herself]302-roberta ? To be sure , [he]201-clyde had sought to entice or seduce [her]302-roberta , as [you]4288-you will , but even so , could [she]302-roberta be held entirely blameless ? Could [she]302-roberta not have refused , if [she]302-roberta was so positive at the time that [she]302-roberta was so very moral ? But [she]302-roberta had not . And as to all this , all that [he]201-clyde had done , had [he]201-clyde not done all [he]201-clyde could to help [her]302-roberta out of it ? And [he]201-clyde had so little money , too . And was placed in such a difficult position . [She]302-roberta was just as much to blame as [he]201-clyde was . And yet now [she]302-roberta was so determined to drive [him]201-clyde this way . To insist on [his]201-clyde marrying [her]302-roberta , whereas if [she]302-roberta would only go [her]302-roberta own way — as [she]302-roberta could with [his]201-clyde help — [she]302-roberta might still save both of [them]4289-them all this trouble .

But no , [she]302-roberta would not , and [he]201-clyde would not marry [her]302-roberta and that was all there was to it . [She]302-roberta need not think that [she]302-roberta could make [him]201-clyde . No , no , no ! At times , when in such moods , [he]201-clyde felt that [he]201-clyde could do anything — drown [her]302-roberta easily enough , and [she]302-roberta would only have [herself]302-roberta to blame .

Then again [his]201-clyde more cowering sense of what [society]4290-society would think and do , if it knew , what [he]201-clyde [himself]201-clyde would be compelled to think of [himself]201-clyde afterwards , fairly well satisfied [him]201-clyde that as much as [he]201-clyde desired to stay , [he]201-clyde was not [the one to do anything at all]4291-the one to do anything at all and in consequence must flee .

And so it was that Tuesday , Wednesday and Thursday following [Roberta]302-roberta 's letter received on Monday , had passed . And then , on Thursday night , following a most torturesome mental day on [his]201-clyde and [Roberta]302-roberta 's part for that matter , this is what [he]201-clyde received :

[Biltz]62-biltz , Wednesday , June 30th .

And with this in [his]201-clyde hands , [he]201-clyde was finally all but numbed by the fact that now decidedly [he]201-clyde must act . [She]302-roberta was actually coming ! Unless [he]201-clyde could soothe or restrain [her]302-roberta in some manner [she]302-roberta would be here to - morrow — the second . And yet the second , or the third , or any time until after the Fourth , was no time to leave with [her]302-roberta . The holiday crowds would be too great . There would be [too many people]4292-too many people to see — to encounter . There must be more secrecy . [He]201-clyde must have at least a little more time in which to get ready . [He]201-clyde must think now quickly and then act . [Great God]306-god ! Get ready . Could [he]201-clyde not telephone [her]302-roberta and say that [he]201-clyde had been sick or so worried on account of the necessary money or something that [he]201-clyde could not write — and that besides [[his]201-clyde uncle]692-his uncle had sent for [him]201-clyde to come to [Greenwood Lake]7-greenwood lake over the Fourth . [[His]201-clyde uncle]692-his uncle ! [[His]201-clyde uncle]692-his uncle ! No , that would not do . [He]201-clyde had used [his]201-clyde name too much , what difference should it make to [him]201-clyde or [her]302-roberta now , whether [he]201-clyde saw [[his]201-clyde uncle]692-his uncle once more or not ? [He]201-clyde was leaving once and for all , or so [he]201-clyde had been telling [her]302-roberta , on [her]302-roberta account , was [he]201-clyde not ? And so [he]201-clyde had better say that [he]201-clyde was going to [[his]201-clyde uncle]692-his uncle , in order to give a reason why [he]201-clyde was going away so that , possibly , [he]201-clyde might be able to return in a year or so . [She]302-roberta might believe that . At any rate [he]201-clyde must tell [her]302-roberta something that would quiet [her]302-roberta until after the Fourth — make [her]302-roberta stay up [there]4705-there until at least [he]201-clyde could perfect some plan — bring [himself]201-clyde to the place where [he]201-clyde could do one thing or the other . One thing or the other .

Without pausing to plan anything more than just this at this time , [he]201-clyde hurried to the nearest telephone where [he]201-clyde was least likely to be overheard . And , getting [her]302-roberta once more , began one of those long and evasive and , in this instance , ingratiating explanations which eventually , after [he]201-clyde had insisted that [he]201-clyde had actually been sick — confined to [[his]201-clyde room]530-his room with a fever and hence not able to get to a telephone — and because , as [he]201-clyde now said , [he]201-clyde had finally decided that it would be best if [he]201-clyde were to make some explanation to [[his]201-clyde uncle]692-his uncle , so that [he]201-clyde might return some time in the future , if necessary — [he]201-clyde , by using the most pleading , if not actually affectionate , tones and asking [her]302-roberta to consider what a state [he]201-clyde had been in , too , was able not only to make [her]302-roberta believe that there was some excuse for [his]201-clyde delay and silence , but also to introduce the plan that [he]201-clyde now had in mind ; which was if only [she]302-roberta could wait until the sixth , then assuredly , without fail as to any particular , [he]201-clyde would meet [her]302-roberta at any place [she]302-roberta would choose to come — [Homer]66-homer , [Fonda]47-fonda , [Lycurgus]1-lycurgus , [Little Falls]159-little falls — only since [they]4301-they were trying to keep everything so secret , [he]201-clyde would suggest that [she]302-roberta come to [Fonda]47-fonda on the morning of the sixth in order to make [the noon train]4919-the noon train for [Utica]3-utica . There [they]4301-they could spend the night since [they]4301-they could not very well discuss and decide on [their]4301-they plans over the telephone , now , and then [they]4301-they could act upon whatever [they]4301-they had decided . Besides [he]201-clyde could tell [her]302-roberta better then just how [he]201-clyde thought [they]4301-they ought to do . [He]201-clyde had an idea — a little trip maybe , somewhere before [they]4301-they got married or after , just as [she]302-roberta wished , but — something nice anyhow—(his voice grew husky and [his]201-clyde knees and hands shook slightly as [he]201-clyde said this , only [Roberta]302-roberta could not detect the sudden perturbation within [him]201-clyde ) . But [she]302-roberta must not ask [him]201-clyde now . [He]201-clyde could not tell [her]302-roberta over the phone . But as sure as anything , at noon on the sixth , [he]201-clyde would be on [the station platform at [Fonda]47-fonda]4303-the station platform at fonda . All [she]302-roberta had to do after seeing [him]201-clyde was to buy [her]302-roberta ticket to [Utica]3-utica and get in [one coach]4304-one coach , and [he]201-clyde would buy [[his]201-clyde separately]4305-his separately and get in another — the one just ahead or behind [hers]302-roberta . But [she]302-roberta must do this . Would [she]302-roberta have that much faith in [him]201-clyde ? If so , [he]201-clyde would call [her]302-roberta up on the third — the very next day — and on the morning of the sixth — sure , so that both [he]201-clyde and [she]302-roberta would know that everything was all right — that [she]302-roberta was starting and that [he]201-clyde would be [there]4705-there . What was that ? [[Her]302-roberta trunk]4312-her trunk ? The little one ? Sure . If [she]302-roberta needed it , certainly bring it . As [Clyde]201-clyde stood at the telephone in [a small outlying drug store]4313-a small outlying drug store and talked — [the lonely proprietor buried in a silly romance among [his]201-clyde pots and phials at the back]4314-the lonely proprietor buried in a silly romance among his pots and phials at the back — it seemed as though the Giant Efrit that had previously materialized in the silent halls of [his]201-clyde brain , was once more here at [his]201-clyde elbow — that [he]201-clyde [himself]201-clyde , cold and numb and fearsome , was being talked through — not actually talking [himself]201-clyde .

Go to [the lake which [you]4316-you visited with [Sondra]186-sondra]4315-the lake which you visited with sondra !

Get travel folders of [the region]481-the region there from either [the Lycurgus House]163-the lycurgus house here or [the depot]910-the depot .

Go to [the south end of]4319-the south end of [it]4315-the lake which you visited with sondra and from there walk south , afterwards .

Pick [a boat that will upset easily]4320-a boat that will upset easily — one with a round bottom , such as those [you]4316-you have seen here at [Crum Lake]77-crum lake and up there .

Buy a new and different hat and leave that on [the water]4702-the water — one that can not be traced to [you]4316-you . [You]4316-you might even tear the lining out of it so that it can not be traced .

Pack all of [your]4316-you things in [your]4316-you trunk here , but leave it , so that swiftly , in the event that anything goes wrong , [you]4316-you can return here and get it and depart .

And take only such things with [you]4316-you as will make it seem as though [you]4316-you were going for an outing to [Twelfth Lake]8-twelfth lake — not away , so that should [you]4316-you be sought at [Twelfth Lake]8-twelfth lake , it will look as though [you]4316-you had gone only there , not elsewhere .

Tell [her]4322-her that [you]4316-you intend to marry [her]4322-her , but after [you]4316-you return from this outing , not before .

And if necessary strike a light blow , so as to stun [her]4322-her — no more — so that falling in the water , [she]4322-her will drown the more easily .

Do not fear !

Do not be weak !

Walk through [the woods]2501-the woods by night , not by day — so that when seen again [you]4316-you will be in [Three Mile Bay]6065-three mile bay or [Sharon]10-sharon — and can say that [you]4316-you came from [Racquette]79-racquette or [Long Lake]154-long lake south , or from [Lycurgus north]1-lycurgus .

Use a false name and alter [your]4316-you handwriting as much as possible .

Assume that [you]4316-you will be successful .
